column1: 26|131|"Now fear Allah

column1: 27|1|These are verses of the Qur´an

column2: I am Allah
column3: the exalted in might
column4: the wise!....

Who has created the heavens and the earth
column3: and Who sends you down rain from the sky? Yea
column4: with it We cause to grow well-planted orchards full of beauty of delight: it is not in your power to cause the growth of the trees in them. (Can there be another) god besides Allah? Nay

column2: Who has made the earth firm to live in; made rivers in its midst; set thereon mountains immovable; and made a separating bar between the two bodies of flowing water? (can there be another) god besides Allah? Nay
column3: most of them know not.

column2: Who listens to the (soul) distressed when it calls on Him

column2: Who guides you through the depths of darkness on land and sea

column4: going before His Mercy? (Can there be another) god besides Allah?- High is Allah above what they associate with Him!

column2: Who originates creation
column3: then repeats it
column4: and who gives you sustenance from heaven and earth? (Can there be another) god besides Allah? Say
column5: "Bring forth your argument
column6: if ye are telling the truth!"

column1: 27|65|Say: None in the heavens or on earth
column2: except Allah
column3: knows what is hidden: nor can they perceive when they shall be raised up (for Judgment).

column1: 27|66|Still less can their knowledge comprehend the Hereafter: Nay

column1: 28|19|Then
column2: when he decided to lay hold of the man who was an enemy to both of them
column3: that man said: "O Moses! Is it thy intention to slay me as thou slewest a man yesterday? Thy intention is none other than to become a powerful violent man in the land
column4: and not to be one who sets things right!"

column1: 28|20|And there came a man
column2: running
column3: from the furthest end of the City. He said: "O Moses! the Chiefs are taking counsel together about thee
column4: to slay thee: so get thee away
column5: for I do give thee sincere advice."

column1: 28|21|He therefore got away therefrom
column2: looking about
column3: in a state of fear. He prayed "O my Lord! save me from people given to wrong-doing."

column1: 28|22|Then
column2: when he turned his face towards (the land of) Madyan
column3: he said: "I do hope that my Lord will show me the smooth and straight Path."

column1: 28|23|And when he arrived at the watering (place) in Madyan
column2: he found there a group of men watering (their flocks)
column3: and besides them he found two women who were keeping back (their flocks). He said: "What is the matter with you?" They said: "We cannot water (our flocks) until the shepherds take back (their flocks): And our father is a very old man."

column1: 28|24|So he watered (their flocks) for them; then he turned back to the shade
column2: and said:"O my Lord! truly am I in (desperate) need of any good that Thou dost send me!"

column1: 28|25|Afterwards one of the (damsels) came (back) to him
column2: walking bashfully. She said: "My father invites thee that he may reward thee for having watered (our flocks) for us." So when he came to him and narrated the story
column3: he said: "Fear thou not: (well) hast thou escaped from unjust people."

column1: 28|26|Said one of the (damsels): "O my (dear) father! engage him on wages: truly the best of men for thee to employ is the (man) who is strong and trusty"....
28|27|He said: "I intend to wed one of these my daughters to thee
column2: on condition that thou serve me for eight years; but if thou complete ten years
column3: it will be (grace) from thee. But I intend not to place thee under a difficulty: thou wilt find me
column4: indeed
column5: if Allah wills
column6: one of the righteous."

column1: 28|28|He said: "Be that (the agreement) between me and thee: whichever of the two terms I fulfil
column2: let there be no ill-will to me. Be Allah a witness to what we say."

column1: 28|29|Now when Moses had fulfilled the term
column2: and was travelling with his family
column3: he perceived a fire in the direction of Mount Tur. He said to his family: "Tarry ye; I perceive a fire; I hope to bring you from there some information
column4: or a burning firebrand
column5: that ye may warm yourselves."

column1: 28|30|But when he came to the (fire)
column2: a voice was heard from the right bank of the valley
column3: from a tree in hallowed ground: "O Moses! Verily I am Allah
column4: the Lord of the Worlds....

column1: 28|31|"Now do thou throw thy rod!" but when he saw it moving (of its own accord) as if it had been a snake
column2: he turned back in retreat
column3: and retraced not his steps: O Moses!" (It was said)
column4: "Draw near
column5: and fear not: for thou art of those who are secure.

column1: 28|32|"Move thy hand into thy bosom
column2: and it will come forth white without stain (or harm)
column3: and draw thy hand close to thy side (to guard) against fear. Those are the two credentials from thy Lord to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: for truly they are a people rebellious and wicked."

column1: 28|33|He said: "O my Lord! I have slain a man among them
column2: and I fear lest they slay me.

column1: 28|34|"And my brother Aaron - He is more eloquent in speech than I: so send him with me as a helper
column2: to confirm (and strengthen) me: for I fear that they may accuse me of falsehood."

column1: 28|35|He said: "We will certainly strengthen thy arm through thy brother
column2: and invest you both with authority
column3: so they shall not be able to touch you: with Our Sign shall ye triumph
column4: - you two as well as those who follow you."

column1: 28|36|When Moses came to them with Our clear signs
column2: they said: "This is nothing but sorcery faked up: never did we head the like among our fathers of old!"

column1: 28|37|Moses said: "My Lord knows best who it is that comes with guidance from Him and whose end will be best in the Hereafter: certain it is that the wrong-doers will not prosper."
28|38|Pharaoh said: "O Chiefs! no god do I know for you but myself: therefore
column2: O Haman! light me a (kiln to bake bricks) out of clay
column3: and build me a lofty palace
column4: that I may mount up to the god of Moses: but as far as I am concerned
column5: I think (Moses) is a liar!"

column1: 28|39|And he was arrogant and insolent in the land
column2: beyond reason
column3: - He and his hosts: they thought that they would not have to return to Us!

column1: 28|40|So We seized him and his hosts
column2: and We flung them into the sea: Now behold what was the end of those who did wrong!

column1: 28|41|And we made them (but) leaders inviting to the Fire; and on the Day of Judgment no help shall they find.
28|42|in this world We made a curse to follow them and on the Day of Judgment they will be among the loathed (and despised).
28|43|We did reveal to Moses the Book after We had destroyed the earlier generations
column2: (to give) Insight to men
column3: and guidance and Mercy
column4: that they might receive admonition.

column1: 28|44|Thou wast not on the Western side when We decreed the Commission to Moses
column2: nor wast thou a witness (of those events).

column1: 28|45|But We raised up (new) generations
column2: and long were the ages that passed over them; but thou wast not a dweller among the people of Madyan
column3: rehearsing Our Signs to them; but it is We Who send messengers (with inspiration).

column1: 28|46|Nor wast thou at the side of (the Mountain of) Tur when we called (to Moses). Yet (art thou sent) as Mercy from thy Lord
column2: to give warning to a people to whom no warner had come before thee: in order that they may receive admonition.

column1: 28|47|If (We had) not (sent thee to the Quraish)
column2: #NAME?
column3: they might say: "Our Lord! why didst Thou not sent us a messenger? We should then have followed Thy Signs and been amongst those who believe!"

column1: 28|48|But (now)
column2: when the Truth has come to them from Ourselves
column3: they say
column4: "Why are not (Signs) sent to him
column5: like those which were sent to Moses?" Do they not then reject (the Signs) which were formerly sent to Moses? They say: "Two kinds of sorcery
column6: each assisting the other!" And they say: "For us
column7: we reject all (such things)!"

column1: 28|49|Say: "Then bring ye a Book from Allah
column2: which is a better guide than either of them
column3: that I may follow it! (do)
column4: if ye are truthful!"

column1: 28|50|But if they hearken not to thee
column2: know that they only follow their own lusts: and who is more astray than one who follow his own lusts
column3: devoid of guidance from Allah? for Allah guides not people given to wrong-doing.

column1: 28|51|Now have We caused the Word to reach them themselves
column2: in order that they may receive admonition.

column1: 28|52|Those to whom We sent the Book before this
column2: - they do believe in this (revelation):

column1: 28|53|And when it is recited to them
column2: they say: "We believe therein
column3: for it is the Truth from our Lord: indeed we have been Muslims (bowing to Allah´s Will) from before this.

column1: 28|54|Twice will they be given their reward
column2: for that they have persevered
column3: that they avert Evil with Good
column4: and that they spend (in charity) out of what We have given them.

column1: 28|55|And when they hear vain talk
column2: they turn away therefrom and say: "To us our deeds
column3: and to you yours; peace be to you: we seek not the ignorant."

column1: 28|56|It is true thou wilt not be able to guide every one
column2: whom thou lovest; but Allah guides those whom He will and He knows best those who receive guidance.

column1: 28|57|They say: "If we were to follow the guidance with thee
column2: we should be snatched away from our land." Have We not established for them a secure sanctuary
column3: to which are brought as tribute fruits of all kinds
column4: #NAME?

column1: 28|58|And how many populations We destroyed
column2: which exulted in their life (of ease and plenty)! now those habitations of theirs
column3: after them
column4: are deserted
column5: - All but a (miserable) few! and We are their heirs!

column1: 28|59|Nor was thy Lord the one to destroy a population until He had sent to its centre a messenger
column2: rehearsing to them Our Signs; nor are We going to destroy a population except when its members practise iniquity.

column1: 28|60|The (material) things which ye are given are but the conveniences of this life and the glitter thereof; but that which is with Allah is better and more enduring: will ye not then be wise?
28|61|Are (these two) alike?- one to whom We have made a goodly promise
column2: and who is going to reach its (fulfilment)
column3: and one to whom We have given the good things of this life
column4: but who
column5: on the Day of Judgment
column6: is to be among those brought up (for punishment)?

column1: 28|62|That Day (Allah) will call to them
column2: and say "Where are my ´partners´?- whom ye imagined (to be such)?"

column1: 28|63|Those against whom the charge will be proved
column2: will say: "Our Lord! These are the ones whom we led astray: we led them astray
column3: as we were astray ourselves: we free ourselves (from them) in Thy presence: it was not us they worshipped."

column1: 28|64|It will be said (to them): "Call upon your ´partners´ (for help)" :they will call upon them
column2: but they will not listen to them; and they will see the Penalty (before them); (how they will wish) ´if only they had been open to guidance!´

column1: 28|65|That Day (Allah) will call to them
column2: and say: "What was the answer ye gave to the messengers?"

column1: 28|66|Then the (whole) story that Day will seem obscure to them (like light to the blind) and they will not be able (even) to question each other.
28|67|But any that (in this life) had repented
column2: believed
column3: and worked righteousness
column4: will have hopes to be among those who achieve salvation.

column1: 28|68|Thy Lord does create and choose as He pleases: no choice have they (in the matter): Glory to Allah! and far is He above the partners they ascribe (to Him)!
28|69|And thy Lord knows all that their hearts conceal and all that they reveal.
28|70|And He is Allah: There is no god but He. To Him be praise
column2: at the first and at the last: for Him is the Command
column3: and to Him shall ye (all) be brought back.

column1: 28|71|Say: See ye? If Allah were to make the night perpetual over you to the Day of Judgment
column2: what god is there other than Allah
column3: who can give you enlightenment? Will ye not then hearken?

column1: 28|72|Say: See ye? If Allah were to make the day perpetual over you to the Day of Judgment
column2: what god is there other than Allah
column3: who can give you a night in which ye can rest? Will ye not then see?

column1: 28|73|It is out of His Mercy that He has made for you Night and Day
column2: #NAME?
column3: and that ye may seek of his Grace;- and in order that ye may be grateful.

column1: 28|74|The Day that He will call on them
column2: He will say: "Where are my ´partners´? whom ye imagined (to be such)?"

column1: 28|75|And from each people shall We draw a witness
column2: and We shall say: "Produce your Proof": then shall they know that the Truth is in Allah (alone)
column3: and the (lies) which they invented will leave them in lurch.

column1: 28|76|Qarun was doubtless
column2: of the people of Moses; but he acted insolently towards them: such were the treasures We had bestowed on him that their very keys would have been a burden to a body of strong men
column3: behold
column4: his people said to him: "Exult not
column5: for Allah loveth not those who exult (in riches).

column1: 28|77|"But seek
column2: with the (wealth) which Allah has bestowed on thee
column3: the Home of the Hereafter
column4: nor forget thy portion in this world: but do thou good
column5: as Allah has been good to thee
column6: and seek not (occasions for) mischief in the land: for Allah loves not those who do mischief."

column1: 28|78|He said: "This has been given to me because of a certain knowledge which I have." Did he not know that Allah had destroyed
column2: before him
column3: (whole) generations
column4: #NAME?

column1: 28|79|So he went forth among his people in the (pride of his wordly) glitter. Said those whose aim is the Life of this World: "Oh! that we had the like of what Qarun has got! for he is truly a lord of mighty good fortune!"
28|80|But those who had been granted (true) knowledge said: "Alas for you! The reward of Allah (in the Hereafter) is best for those who believe and work righteousness: but this none shall attain
column2: save those who steadfastly persevere (in good)."

column1: 28|81|Then We caused the earth to swallow up him and his house; and he had not (the least little) party to help him against Allah
column2: nor could he defend himself.

column1: 28|82|And those who had envied his position the day before began to say on the morrow: "Ah! it is indeed Allah Who enlarges the provision or restricts it
column2: to any of His servants He pleases! had it not been that Allah was gracious to us
column3: He could have caused the earth to swallow us up! Ah! those who reject Allah will assuredly never prosper."

column1: 28|83|That Home of the Hereafter We shall give to those who intend not high-handedness or mischief on earth: and the end is (best) for the righteous.
28|84|If any does good
column2: the reward to him is better than his deed; but if any does evil
column3: the doers of evil are only punished (to the extent) of their deeds.

column1: 28|85|Verily He Who ordained the Qur´an for thee
column2: will bring thee back to the Place of Return. Say: "My Lord knows best who it is that brings true guidance
column3: and who is in manifest error."

column1: 28|86|And thou hadst not expected that the Book would be sent to thee except as a Mercy from thy Lord: Therefore lend not thou support in any way to those who reject (Allah´s Message).
28|87|And let nothing keep thee back from the Signs of Allah after they have been revealed to thee: and invite (men) to thy Lord
column2: and be not of the company of those who join gods with Allah.

column1: 28|88|And call not
column2: besides Allah
column3: on another god. There is no god but He. Everything (that exists) will perish except His own Face. To Him belongs the Command
column4: and to Him will ye (all) be brought back.

column1: 29|2|Do men think that they will be left alone on saying
column2: "We believe"
column3: and that they will not be tested?

column1: 29|3|We did test those before them
column2: and Allah will certainly know those who are true from those who are false.

column1: 29|4|Do those who practise evil think that they will get the better of Us? Evil is their judgment!
29|5|For those whose hopes are in the meeting with Allah (in the Hereafter
column2: let them strive); for the term (appointed) by Allah is surely coming and He hears and knows (all things).

column1: 29|6|And if any strive (with might and main)
column2: they do so for their own souls: for Allah is free of all needs from all creation.

column1: 29|7|Those who believe and work righteous deeds
column2: #NAME?
column3: and We shall reward them according to the best of their deeds.

column1: 29|8|We have enjoined on man kindness to parents: but if they (either of them) strive (to force) thee to join with Me (in worship) anything of which thou hast no knowledge
column2: obey them not. Ye have (all) to return to me
column3: and I will tell you (the truth) of all that ye did.

column1: 29|9|And those who believe and work righteous deeds
column2: #NAME?

column1: 29|10|Then there are among men such as say
column2: "We believe in Allah"; but when they suffer affliction in (the cause of) Allah
column3: they treat men´s oppression as if it were the Wrath of Allah! And if help comes (to thee) from thy Lord
column4: they are sure to say
column5: "We have (always) been with you!" Does not Allah know best all that is in the hearts of all creation?

column1: 29|11|And Allah most certainly knows those who believe
column2: and as certainly those who are Hypocrites.

column1: 29|12|And the Unbelievers say to those who believe: "Follow our path
column2: and we will bear (the consequences) of your faults." Never in the least will they bear their faults: in fact they are liars!

column1: 29|13|They will bear their own burdens
column2: and (other) burdens along with their own
column3: and on the Day of Judgments they will be called to account for their falsehoods.

column1: 29|14|We (once) sent Noah to his people
column2: and he tarried among them a thousand years less fifty: but the Deluge overwhelmed them while they (persisted in) sin.

column1: 29|15|But We saved him and the companions of the Ark
column2: and We made the (Ark) a Sign for all peoples!

column1: 29|16|And (We also saved) Abraham: behold
column2: he said to his people
column3: "Serve Allah and fear Him: that will be best for you- If ye understand!

column1: 29|17|"For ye do worship idols besides Allah
column2: and ye invent falsehood. The things that ye worship besides Allah have no power to give you sustenance: then seek ye sustenance from Allah
column3: serve Him
column4: and be grateful to Him: to Him will be your return.

column1: 29|18|"And if ye reject (the Message)
column2: so did generations before you: and the duty of the messenger is only to preach publicly (and clearly)."

column1: 29|19|See they not how Allah originates creation
column2: then repeats it: truly that is easy for Allah.

column1: 29|20|Say: "Travel through the earth and see how Allah did originate creation; so will Allah produce a later creation: for Allah has power over all things.
29|21|"He punishes whom He pleases
column2: and He grants Mercy to whom He pleases
column3: and towards Him are ye turned.

column1: 29|22|"Not on earth nor in heaven will ye be able (fleeing) to frustrate (his Plan)
column2: nor have ye
column3: besides Allah
column4: any protector or helper."

column1: 29|23|Those who reject the Signs of Allah and the Meeting with Him (in the Hereafter)
column2: #NAME?

column1: 29|24|So naught was the answer of (Abraham´s) people except that they said: "Slay him or burn him." But Allah did save him from the Fire. Verily in this are Signs for people who believe.
29|25|And he said: "For you
column2: ye have taken (for worship) idols besides Allah
column3: out of mutual love and regard between yourselves in this life; but on the Day of Judgment ye shall disown each other and curse each other: and your abode will be the Fire
column4: and ye shall have none to help."

column1: 29|26|But Lut had faith in Him: He said: "I will leave home for the sake of my Lord: for He is Exalted in Might
column2: and Wise."

column1: 29|27|And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob
column2: and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation
column3: and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.

column1: 29|28|And (remember) Lut: behold
column2: he said to his people: "Ye do commit lewdness
column3: such as no people in Creation (ever) committed before you.

column1: 29|29|"Do ye indeed approach men
column2: and cut off the highway?- and practise wickedness (even) in your councils?" But his people gave no answer but this: they said: "Bring us the Wrath of Allah if thou tellest the truth."

column1: 29|30|He said: "O my Lord! help Thou me against people who do mischief!"
29|31|When Our Messengers came to Abraham with the good news
column2: they said: "We are indeed going to destroy the people of this township: for truly they are (addicted to) crime."

column1: 29|32|He said: "But there is Lut there." They said: "Well do we know who is there : we will certainly save him and his following
column2: - except his wife: she is of those who lag behind!"

column1: 29|33|And when Our Messengers came to Lut
column2: he was grieved on their account
column3: and felt himself powerless (to protect) them: but they said: "Fear thou not
column4: nor grieve: we are (here) to save thee and thy following
column5: except thy wife: she is of those who lag behind.

column1: 29|34|"For we are going to bring down on the people of this township a Punishment from heaven
column2: because they have been wickedly rebellious."

column1: 29|35|And We have left thereof an evident Sign
column2: for any people who (care to) understand.

column1: 29|36|To the Madyan (people) (We sent) their brother Shu´aib. Then he said: "O my people! serve Allah
column2: and fear the Last Day: nor commit evil on the earth
column3: with intent to do mischief."

column1: 29|37|But they rejected him: Then the mighty Blast seized them
column2: and they lay prostrate in their homes by the morning.

column1: 29|38|(Remember also) the ´Ad and the Thamud (people): clearly will appear to you from (the traces) of their buildings (their fate): the Evil One made their deeds alluring to them
column2: and kept them back from the Path
column3: though they were gifted with intelligence and skill.

column1: 29|39|(Remember also) Qarun
column2: Pharaoh
column3: and Haman: there came to them Moses with Clear Signs
column4: but they behaved with insolence on the earth; yet they could not overreach (Us).

column1: 29|40|Each one of them We seized for his crime: of them
column2: against some We sent a violent tornado (with showers of stones); some were caught by a (mighty) Blast; some We caused the earth to swallow up; and some We drowned (in the waters): It was not Allah Who injured (or oppressed) them:" They injured (and oppressed) their own souls.

column1: 29|41|The parable of those who take protectors other than Allah is that of the spider
column2: who builds (to itself) a house; but truly the flimsiest of houses is the spider´s house;- if they but knew.

column1: 29|42|Verily Allah doth know of (every thing) whatever that they call upon besides Him: and He is Exalted (in power)
column2: Wise.

column1: 29|43|And such are the Parables We set forth for mankind
column2: but only those understand them who have knowledge.

column1: 29|44|Allah created the heavens and the earth in true (proportions): verily in that is a Sign for those who believe.
29|45|Recite what is sent of the Book by inspiration to thee
column2: and establish regular Prayer: for Prayer restrains from shameful and unjust deeds; and remembrance of Allah is the greatest (thing in life) without doubt. And Allah knows the (deeds) that ye do.

column1: 29|46|And dispute ye not with the People of the Book
column2: except with means better (than mere disputation)
column3: unless it be with those of them who inflict wrong (and injury): but say
column4: "We believe in the revelation which has come down to us and in that which came down to you; Our Allah and your Allah is one; and it is to Him we bow (in Islam)."

column1: 29|47|And thus (it is) that We have sent down the Book to thee. So the People of the Book believe therein
column2: as also do some of these (pagan Arabs): and none but Unbelievers reject our signs.

column1: 29|48|And thou wast not (able) to recite a Book before this (Book came)
column2: nor art thou (able) to transcribe it with thy right hand: In that case
column3: indeed
column4: would the talkers of vanities have doubted.

column2: here are Signs self-evident in the hearts of those endowed with knowledge: and none but the unjust reject Our Signs.

column1: 29|50|Ye they say: "Why are not Signs sent down to him from his Lord?" Say: "The signs are indeed with Allah: and I am indeed a clear Warner."
29|51|And is it not enough for them that we have sent down to thee the Book which is rehearsed to them? Verily
column2: in it is Mercy and a Reminder to those who believe.

column1: 29|52|Say: "Enough is Allah for a witness between me and you: He knows what is in the heavens and on earth. And it is those who believe in vanities and reject Allah
column2: that will perish (in the end).

column1: 29|53|They ask thee to hasten on the Punishment (for them): had it not been for a term (of respite) appointed
column2: the Punishment would certainly have come to them: and it will certainly reach them
column3: #NAME?
column4: while they perceive not!

column1: 29|54|They ask thee to hasten on the Punishment: but
column2: of a surety
column3: Hell will encompass the Rejecters of Faith!-

column1: 29|55|On the Day that the Punishment shall cover them from above them and from below them
column2: and (a Voice) shall say: "Taste ye (the fruits) of your deeds!"

column1: 29|56|O My servants who believe! truly
column2: spacious is My Earth: therefore serve ye Me - (and Me alone)!

column1: 29|57|Every soul shall have a taste of death in the end to Us shall ye be brought back.
29|58|But those who believe and work deeds of righteousness - to them shall We give a Home in Heaven
column2: #NAME?
column3: - to dwell therein for aye;- an excellent reward for those who do (good)!-

column1: 29|59|Those who persevere in patience
column2: and put their trust
column3: in their Lord and Cherisher.

column1: 29|60|How many are the creatures that carry not their own sustenance? It is Allah who feeds (both) them and you: for He hears and knows (all things).
29|61|If indeed thou ask them who has created the heavens and the earth and subjected the sun and the moon (to his Law)
column2: they will certainly reply
column3: "Allah". How are they then deluded away (from the truth)?

column1: 29|62|Allah enlarges the sustenance (which He gives) to whichever of His servants He pleases; and He (similarly) grants by (strict) measure
column2: (as He pleases): for Allah has full knowledge of all things.

column1: 29|63|And if indeed thou ask them who it is that sends down rain from the sky
column2: and gives life therewith to the earth after its death
column3: they will certainly reply
column4: "Allah!" Say
column5: "Praise be to Allah!" But most of them understand not.

column1: 29|64|What is the life of this world but amusement and play? but verily the Home in the Hereafter
column2: #NAME?
column3: if they but knew.

column2: if they embark on a boat
column3: they call on Allah
column4: making their devotion sincerely (and exclusively) to Him; but when He has delivered them safely to (dry) land
column5: behold
column6: they give a share (of their worship to others)!-

column1: 29|66|Disdaining ungratefully Our gifts
column2: and giving themselves up to (worldly) enjoyment! But soon will they know.

column1: 29|67|Do they not then see that We have made a sanctuary secure
column2: and that men are being snatched away from all around them? Then
column3: do they believe in that which is vain
column4: and reject the Grace of Allah?

column1: 29|68|And who does more wrong than he who invents a lie against Allah or rejects the Truth when it reaches him? Is there not a home in Hell for those who reject Faith?
29|69|And those who strive in Our (cause)
column2: #NAME?

column1: 30|2|The Roman Empire has been defeated-
30|3|In a land close by; but they
column2: (even) after (this) defeat of theirs
column3: will soon be victorious-

column1: 30|4|Within a few years. With Allah is the Decision
column2: in the past and in the Future: on that Day shall the Believers rejoice-

column1: 30|5|With the help of Allah. He helps whom He will
column2: and He is exalted in might
column3: most merciful.

column1: 30|6|(It is) the promise of Allah. Never does Allah depart from His promise: but most men understand not.
30|7|They know but the outer (things) in the life of this world: but of the End of things they are heedless.
30|8|Do they not reflect in their own minds? Not but for just ends and for a term appointed
column2: did Allah create the heavens and the earth
column3: and all between them: yet are there truly many among men who deny the meeting with their Lord (at the Resurrection)!

column1: 30|9|Do they not travel through the earth
column2: and see what was the end of those before them? They were superior to them in strength: they tilled the soil and populated it in greater numbers than these have done: there came to them their messengers with Clear (Signs). (Which they rejected
column3: to their own destruction): It was not Allah Who wronged them
column4: but they wronged their own souls.

column1: 30|10|In the long run evil in the extreme will be the End of those who do evil; for that they rejected the Signs of Allah
column2: and held them up to ridicule.

column1: 30|11|It is Allah Who begins (the process of) creation; then repeats it; then shall ye be brought back to Him.
30|12|On the Day that the Hour will be established
column2: the guilty will be struck dumb with despair.

column1: 30|13|No intercessor will they have among their "Partners" and they will (themselves) reject their "Partners".
30|14|On the Day that the Hour will be established
column2: #NAME?

column1: 30|15|Then those who have believed and worked righteous deeds
column2: shall be made happy in a Mead of Delight.

column1: 30|16|And those who have rejected Faith and falsely denied our Signs and the meeting of the Hereafter
column2: #NAME?

column1: 30|17|So (give) glory to Allah
column2: when ye reach eventide and when ye rise in the morning;
to Him be praise
column3: in the heavens and on earth; and in the late afternoon and when the day begins to decline.

column1: 30|19|It is He Who brings out the living from the dead
column2: and brings out the dead from the living
column3: and Who gives life to the earth after it is dead: and thus shall ye be brought out (from the dead).

column1: 30|20|Among His Signs in this
column2: that He created you from dust; and then
column3: #NAME?
column4: ye are men scattered (far and wide)!

column1: 30|21|And among His Signs is this
column2: that He created for you mates from among yourselves
column3: that ye may dwell in tranquillity with them
column4: and He has put love and mercy between your (hearts): verily in that are Signs for those who reflect.

column1: 30|22|And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth
column2: and the variations in your languages and your colours: verily in that are Signs for those who know.

column1: 30|23|And among His Signs is the sleep that ye take by night and by day
column2: and the quest that ye (make for livelihood) out of His Bounty: verily in that are signs for those who hearken.

column1: 30|24|And among His Signs
column2: He shows you the lightning
column3: by way both of fear and of hope
column4: and He sends down rain from the sky and with it gives life to the earth after it is dead: verily in that are Signs for those who are wise.

column1: 30|25|And among His Signs is this
column2: that heaven and earth stand by His Command: then when He calls you
column3: by a single call
column4: from the earth
column5: behold
column6: ye (straightway) come forth.

column1: 30|26|To Him belongs every being that is in the heavens and on earth: all are devoutly obedient to Him.

30|27|It is He Who begins (the process of) creation; then repeats it; and for Him it is most easy. To Him belongs the loftiest similitude (we can think of) in the heavens and the earth: for He is Exalted in Might
column2: full of wisdom.

column1: 30|28|He does propound to you a similitude from your own (experience): do ye have partners among those whom your right hands possess
column2: to share as equals in the wealth We have bestowed on you? Do ye fear them as ye fear each other? Thus do we explain the Signs in detail to a people that understand.
the wrong-doers (merely) follow their own lusts
column3: being devoid of knowledge. But who will guide those whom Allah leaves astray? To them there will be no helpers.

column1: 30|30|So set thou thy face steadily and truly to the Faith: (establish) Allah´s handiwork according to the pattern on which He has made mankind: no change (let there be) in the work (wrought) by Allah: that is the standard Religion: but most among mankind understand not.
30|31|Turn ye back in repentance to Him
column2: and fear Him: establish regular prayers
column3: and be not ye among those who join gods with Allah

column1: 30|32|Those who split up their Religion
column2: and become (mere) Sects
column3: - each party rejoicing in that which is with itself!

column1: 30|33|When trouble touches men
column2: they cry to their Lord
column3: turning back to Him in repentance: but when He gives them a taste of Mercy as from Himself
column4: behold
column5: some of them pay part-worship to other god´s besides their Lord

column1: 30|34|(As if) to show their ingratitude for the (favours) We have bestowed on them! Then enjoy (your brief day); but soon will ye know (your folly).
30|35|Or have We sent down authority to them
column2: which points out to them the things to which they pay part-worship?

column1: 30|36|When We give men a taste of Mercy
column2: they exult thereat: and when some evil afflicts them because of what their (own) hands have sent forth
column3: behold
column4: they are in despair!

column1: 30|37|See they not that Allah enlarges the provision and restricts it
column2: to whomsoever He pleases? Verily in that are Signs for those who believe.

column1: 30|38|So give what is due to kindred
column2: the needy
column3: and the wayfarer. That is best for those who seek the Countenance
column4: of Allah
column5: and it is they who will prosper.

column1: 30|39|That which ye lay out for increase through the property of (other) people
column2: will have no increase with Allah: but that which ye lay out for charity
column3: seeking the Countenance of Allah
column4: (will increase): it is these who will get a recompense multiplied.

column1: 30|40|It is Allah Who has created you: further
column2: He has provided for your sustenance; then He will cause you to die; and again He will give you life. Are there any of your (false) "Partners" who can do any single one of these things? Glory to Him! and high is He above the partners they attribute (to him)!

column1: 30|41|Mischief has appeared on land and sea because of (the meed) that the hands of men have earned
column2: that (Allah) may give them a taste of some of their deeds: in order that they may turn back (from Evil).

column1: 30|42|Say: "Travel through the earth and see what was the end of those before (you): Most of them worshipped others besides Allah."
30|43|But set thou thy face to the right Religion before there come from Allah the Day which there is no chance of averting: on that Day shall men be divided (in two).
30|44|Those who reject Faith will suffer from that rejection: and those who work righteousness will spread their couch (of repose) for themselves (in heaven):
30|45|That He may reward those who believe and work righteous deeds
column2: out of his Bounty. For He loves not those who reject Faith.

column1: 30|46|Among His Signs is this
column2: that He sends the Winds
column3: as heralds of Glad Tidings
column4: giving you a taste of His (Grace and) Mercy
column5: #NAME?

column1: 30|47|We did indeed send
column2: before thee
column3: messengers to their (respective) peoples
column4: and they came to them with Clear Signs: then
column5: to those who transgressed
column6: We meted out Retribution: and it was due from Us to aid those who believed.

column1: 30|48|It is Allah Who sends the Winds
column2: and they raise the Clouds: then does He spread them in the sky as He wills
column3: and break them into fragments
column4: until thou seest rain-drops issue from the midst thereof: then when He has made them reach such of his servants as He wills behold
column5: they do rejoice!-

column1: 30|49|Even though
column2: before they received (the rain) - just before this - they were dumb with despair!

column1: 30|50|Then contemplate (O man!) the memorials of Allah´s Mercy!- how He gives life to the earth after its death: verily the same will give life to the men who are dead: for He has power over all things.
30|51|And if We (but) send a Wind from which they see (their tilth) turn yellow
column2: #NAME?
column3: they become
column4: thereafter
column5: Ungrateful (Unbelievers)!

column1: 30|52|So verily thou canst not make the dead to hear
column2: nor canst thou make the deaf to hear the call
column3: when they show their backs and turn away.

column1: 30|53|Nor canst thou lead back the blind from their straying: only those wilt thou make to hear
column2: who believe in Our signs and submit (their wills in Islam).

column1: 30|54|It is Allah Who created you in a state of (helpless) weakness
column2: then gave (you) strength after weakness
column3: then
column4: after strength
column5: gave (you weakness and a hoary head: He creates as He wills
column6: and it is He Who has all knowledge and power.

column1: 30|55|On the Day that the Hour (of Reckoning) will be established
column2: the transgressors will swear that they tarried not but an hour: thus were they used to being deluded!

column1: 30|56|But those endued with knowledge and faith will say: "Indeed ye did tarry
column2: within Allah´s Decree
column3: to the Day of Resurrection
column4: and this is the Day of Resurrection: but ye - ye were not aware!"

column1: 30|57|So on that Day no excuse of theirs will avail the transgressors
column2: nor will they be invited (then) to seek grace (by repentance).

column1: 30|58|verily We have propounded for men
column2: in this Qur´an every kind of Parable: But if thou bring to them any Sign
column3: the Unbelievers are sure to say
column4: "Ye do nothing but talk vanities."

column1: 30|59|Thus does Allah seal up the hearts of those who understand not.
30|60|So patiently persevere: for verily the promise of Allah is true: nor let those shake thy firmness
column2: who have (themselves) no certainty of faith.

column1: 31|2|These are Verses of the Wise Book
31|3|A Guide and a Mercy to the Doers of Good
31|4|Those who establish regular Prayer
column2: and give regular Charity
column3: and have (in their hearts) the assurance of the Hereafter.

column1: 31|5|These are on (true) guidance from their Lord: and these are the ones who will prosper.
31|6|But there are
column2: among men
column3: those who purchase idle tales
column4: without knowledge (or meaning)
column5: to mislead (men) from the Path of Allah and throw ridicule (on the Path): for such there will be a Humiliating Penalty.

column1: 31|7|When Our Signs are rehearsed to such a one
column2: he turns away in arrogance
column3: as if he heard them not
column4: as if there were deafness in both his ears: announce to him a grievous Penalty.

column1: 31|8|For those who believe and work righteous deeds
column2: there will be Gardens of Bliss

column1: 31|9|To dwell therein. The promise of Allah is true: and He is Exalted in Power
column2: Wise.

column1: 31|10|He created the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; He set on the earth mountains standing firm
column2: lest it should shake with you; and He scattered through it beasts of all kinds. We send down rain from the sky
column3: and produce on the earth every kind of noble creature
column4: in pairs.

column1: 31|11|Such is the Creation of Allah: now show Me what is there that others besides Him have created: nay
column2: but the Transgressors are in manifest error.

column1: 31|12|we bestowed (in the past) Wisdom on Luqman: "Show (thy) gratitude to Allah." Any who is (so) grateful does so to the profit of his own soul: but if any is ungrateful
column2: verily Allah is free of all wants
column3: Worthy of all praise.

column1: 31|13|Behold
column2: Luqman said to his son by way of instruction: "O my son! join not in worship (others) with Allah: for false worship is indeed the highest wrong-doing."

column1: 31|14|And We have enjoined on man (to be good) to his parents: in travail upon travail did his mother bear him
column2: and in years twain was his weaning: (hear the command)
column3: "Show gratitude to Me and to thy parents: to Me is (thy final) Goal.

column1: 31|15|"But if they strive to make thee join in worship with Me things of which thou hast no knowledge
column2: obey them not; yet bear them company in this life with justice (and consideration)
column3: and follow the way of those who turn to me (in love): in the end the return of you all is to Me
column4: and I will tell you the truth (and meaning) of all that ye did."

column1: 31|16|"O my son!" (said Luqman)
column2: "If there be (but) the weight of a mustard-seed and it were (hidden) in a rock
column3: or (anywhere) in the heavens or on earth
column4: Allah will bring it forth: for Allah understands the finest mysteries
column5: (and) is well-acquainted (with them).

column1: 31|17|"O my son! establish regular prayer
column2: enjoin what is just
column3: and forbid what is wrong: and bear with patient constancy whatever betide thee; for this is firmness (of purpose) in (the conduct of) affairs.

column1: 31|18|"And swell not thy cheek (for pride) at men
column2: nor walk in insolence through the earth; for Allah loveth not any arrogant boaster.

column1: 31|19|"And be moderate in thy pace
column2: and lower thy voice; for the harshest of sounds without doubt is the braying of the ass."

column1: 31|20|Do ye not see that Allah has subjected to your (use) all things in the heavens and on earth
column2: and has made his bounties flow to you in exceeding measure
column3: (both) seen and unseen? Yet there are among men those who dispute about Allah
column4: without knowledge and without guidance
column5: and without a Book to enlighten them!

column1: 31|21|When they are told to follow the (Revelation) that Allah has sent down
column2: they say: "Nay
column3: we shall follow the ways that we found our fathers (following). "What! even if it is Satan beckoning them to the Penalty of the (Blazing) Fire?

column1: 31|22|Whoever submits his whole self to Allah
column2: and is a doer of good
column3: has grasped indeed the most trustworthy hand-hold: and with Allah rests the End and Decision of (all) affairs.

column1: 31|23|But if any reject Faith
column2: let not his rejection grieve thee: to Us is their return
column3: and We shall tell them the truth of their deeds: for Allah knows well all that is in (men´s) hearts.

column1: 31|24|We grant them their pleasure for a little while: in the end shall We drive them to a chastisement unrelenting.
31|25|If thou ask them
column2: who it is that created the heavens and the earth. They will certainly say
column3: "Allah". Say: "Praise be to Allah!" But most of them understand not.

column1: 31|26|To Allah belong all things in heaven and earth: verily Allah is He (that is) free of all wants
column2: worthy of all praise.

column1: 31|27|And if all the trees on earth were pens and the ocean (were ink)
column2: with seven oceans behind it to add to its (supply)
column3: yet would not the words of Allah be exhausted (in the writing): for Allah is Exalted in Power
column4: full of Wisdom.

column1: 31|28|And your creation or your resurrection is in no wise but as an individual soul: for Allah is He Who hears and sees (all things).
31|29|Seest thou not that Allah merges Night into Day and he merges Day into Night; that He has subjected the sun
column2: and the moon (to his Law)
column3: each running its course for a term appointed; and that Allah is well-acquainted with all that ye do?

column1: 31|30|That is because Allah is the (only) Reality
column2: and because whatever else they invoke besides Him is Falsehood; and because Allah
column3: #NAME?
column4: Most Great.

column1: 31|31|Seest thou not that the ships sail through the ocean by the Grace of Allah?- that He may show you of His Signs? Verily in this are Signs for all who constantly persevere and give thanks.
31|32|When a wave covers them like the canopy (of clouds)
column2: they call to Allah
column3: offering Him sincere devotion. But when He has delivered them safely to land
column4: there are among them those that halt between (right and wrong). But none reject Our Signs except only a perfidious ungrateful (wretch)!

column1: 31|33|O mankind! do your duty to your Lord
column2: and fear (the coming of) a Day when no father can avail aught for his son
column3: nor a son avail aught for his father. Verily
column4: the promise of Allah is true: let not then this present life deceive you
column5: nor let the chief Deceiver deceive you about Allah.

column1: 31|34|Verily the knowledge of the Hour is with Allah (alone). It is He Who sends down rain
column2: and He Who knows what is in the wombs. Nor does any one know what it is that he will earn on the morrow: Nor does any one know in what land he is to die. Verily with Allah is full knowledge and He is acquainted (with all things).

column1: 32|2|(This is) the Revelation of the Book in which there is no doubt
column2: #NAME?

column1: 32|3|Or do they say
column2: "He has forged it"? Nay
column3: it is the Truth from thy Lord
column4: that thou mayest admonish a people to whom no warner has come before thee: in order that they may receive guidance.

column1: 32|4|It is Allah Who has created the heavens and the earth
column2: and all between them
column3: in six Days
column4: and is firmly established on the Throne (of Authority): ye have none
column5: besides Him
column6: to protect or intercede (for you): will ye not then receive admonition?

column1: 32|5|He rules (all) affairs from the heavens to the earth: in the end will (all affairs) go up to Him
column2: on a Day
column3: the space whereof will be (as) a thousand years of your reckoning.

column1: 32|6|Such is He
column2: the Knower of all things
column3: hidden and open
column4: the Exalted (in power)
column5: the Merciful;-

column1: 32|7|He Who has made everything which He has created most good: He began the creation of man with (nothing more than) clay
32|8|And made his progeny from a quintessence of the nature of a fluid despised:
32|9|But He fashioned him in due proportion
column2: and breathed into him something of His spirit. And He gave you (the faculties of) hearing and sight and feeling (and understanding): little thanks do ye give!

column1: 32|10|And they say: "What! when we lie
column2: hidden and lost
column3: in the earth
column4: shall we indeed be in a Creation renewed? Nay
column5: they deny the Meeting with their Lord.

column1: 32|11|Say: "The Angel of Death
column2: put in charge of you
column3: will (duly) take your souls: then shall ye be brought back to your Lord."

column1: 32|12|If only thou couldst see when the guilty ones will bend low their heads before their Lord
column2: (saying:) "Our Lord! We have seen and we have heard: Now then send us back (to the world): we will work righteousness: for we do indeed (now) believe."

column1: 32|13|If We had so willed
column2: We could certainly have brought every soul its true guidance: but the Word from Me will come true
column3: "I will fill Hell with Jinns and men all together."

column1: 32|14|"Taste ye then - for ye forgot the Meeting of this Day of yours
column2: and We too will forget you - taste ye the Penalty of Eternity for your (evil) deeds!"

column1: 32|15|Only those believe in Our Signs
column2: who
column3: when they are recited to them
column4: fall down in prostration
column5: and celebrate the praises of their Lord
column6: nor are they (ever) puffed up with pride.

column1: 32|16|Their limbs do forsake their beds of sleep
column2: the while they call on their Lord
column3: in Fear and Hope: and they spend (in charity) out of the sustenance which We have bestowed on them.

column1: 32|17|Now no person knows what delights of the eye are kept hidden (in reserve) for them - as a reward for their (good) deeds.
32|18|Is then the man who believes no better than the man who is rebellious and wicked? Not equal are they.
32|19|For those who believe and do righteous deeds are Gardens as hospitable homes
column2: for their (good) deeds.

column1: 32|20|As to those who are rebellious and wicked
column2: their abode will be the Fire: every time they wish to get away therefrom
column3: they will be forced thereinto
column4: and it will be said to them: "Taste ye the Penalty of the Fire
column5: the which ye were wont to reject as false."

column1: 32|21|And indeed We will make them taste of the Penalty of this (life) prior to the supreme Penalty
column2: in order that they may (repent and) return.

column1: 32|22|And who does more wrong than one to whom are recited the Signs of his Lord
column2: and who then turns away therefrom? Verily from those who transgress We shall exact (due) Retribution.

column1: 32|23|We did indeed aforetime give the Book to Moses: be not then in doubt of its reaching (thee): and We made it a guide to the Children of Israel.
32|24|And We appointed
column2: from among them
column3: leaders
column4: giving guidance under Our command
column5: so long as they persevered with patience and continued to have faith in Our Signs.

column1: 32|25|Verily thy Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgment
column2: in the matters wherein they differ (among themselves)

column1: 32|26|Does it not teach them a lesson
column2: how many generations We destroyed before them
column3: in whose dwellings they (now) go to and fro? Verily in that are Signs: Do they not then listen?

column1: 32|27|And do they not see that We do drive rain to parched soil (bare of herbage)
column2: and produce therewith crops
column3: providing food for their cattle and themselves? Have they not the vision?

column1: 32|28|They say: "When will this decision be
column2: if ye are telling the truth?"

column1: 32|29|Say: "On the Day of Decision
column2: no profit will it be to Unbelievers if they (then) believe! nor will they be granted a respite."

column1: 32|30|So turn away from them
column2: and wait: they too are waiting.

column1: 33|1|O Prophet! Fear Allah
column2: and hearken not to the Unbelievers and the Hypocrites: verily Allah is full of Knowledge and Wisdom.

column1: 33|2|But follow that which comes to thee by inspiration from thy Lord: for Allah is well acquainted with (all) that ye do.
33|3|And put thy trust in Allah
column2: and enough is Allah as a disposer of affairs.

column1: 33|4|Allah has not made for any man two hearts in his (one) body: nor has He made your wives whom ye divorce by Zihar your mothers: nor has He made your adopted sons your sons. Such is (only) your (manner of) speech by your mouths. But Allah tells (you) the Truth
column2: and He shows the (right) Way.

column1: 33|5|Call them by (the names of) their fathers: that is juster in the sight of Allah. But if ye know not their father´s (names
column2: call them) your Brothers in faith
column3: or your maulas. But there is no blame on you if ye make a mistake therein: (what counts is) the intention of your hearts: and Allah is Oft-Returning
column4: Most Merciful.

column1: 33|6|The Prophet is closer to the Believers than their own selves
column2: and his wives are their mothers. Blood-relations among each other have closer personal ties
column3: in the Decree of Allah. Than (the Brotherhood of) Believers and Muhajirs: nevertheless do ye what is just to your closest friends: such is the writing in the Decree (of Allah).

column1: 33|7|And remember We took from the prophets their covenant: As (We did) from thee: from Noah
column2: Abraham
column3: Moses
column4: and Jesus the son of Mary: We took from them a solemn covenant:

column1: 33|8|That (Allah) may question the (custodians) of Truth concerning the Truth they (were charged with): And He has prepared for the Unbelievers a grievous Penalty.
33|9|O ye who believe! Remember the Grace of Allah
column2: (bestowed) on you
column3: when there came down on you hosts (to overwhelm you): But We sent against them a hurricane and forces that ye saw not: but Allah sees (clearly) all that ye do.

column1: 33|10|Behold! they came on you from above you and from below you
column2: and behold
column3: the eyes became dim and the hearts gaped up to the throats
column4: and ye imagined various (vain) thoughts about Allah!

column1: 33|11|In that situation were the Believers tried: they were shaken as by a tremendous shaking.
33|12|And behold! The Hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease (even) say: "Allah and His Messenger promised us nothing but delusion!"
33|13|Behold! A party among them said: "Ye men of Yathrib! ye cannot stand (the attack)! therefore go back!" And a band of them ask for leave of the Prophet
column2: saying
column3: "Truly our houses are bare and exposed
column4:
though they were not exposed they intended nothing but to run away.
33|14|And if an entry had been effected to them from the sides of the (city), and they had been incited to sedition, they would certainly have brought it to pass, with none but a brief delay!
33|15|And yet they had already covenanted with Allah not to turn their backs, and a covenant with Allah must (surely) be answered for.
33|16|Say: Running away will not profit you if ye are running away from death or slaughter; and even if (ye do escape)
column5: no more than a brief (respite) will ye be allowed to enjoy!"

column1: 33|17|Say: "Who is it that can screen you from Allah if it be His wish to give you punishment or to give you Mercy?" Nor will they find for themselves
column2: besides Allah
column3: any protector or helper.

column1: 33|18|Verily Allah knows those among you who keep back (men) and those who say to their brethren
column2: "Come along to us"
column3: but come not to the fight except for just a little while.

column1: 33|19|Covetous over you. Then when fear comes
column2: thou wilt see them looking to thee
column3: their eyes revolving
column4: like (those of) one over whom hovers death: but when the fear is past
column5: they will smite you with sharp tongues
column6: covetous of goods. Such men have no faith
column7: and so Allah has made their deeds of none effect: and that is easy for Allah.

column1: 33|20|They think that the Confederates have not withdrawn; and if the Confederates should come (again)
column2: they would wish they were in the deserts (wandering) among the Bedouins
column3: and seeking news about you (from a safe distance); and if they were in your midst
column4: they would fight but little.

column1: 33|21|Ye have indeed in the Messenger of Allah a beautiful pattern (of conduct) for any one whose hope is in Allah and the Final Day
column2: and who engages much in the Praise of Allah.

column1: 33|22|When the Believers saw the Confederate forces
column2: they said: "This is what Allah and his Messenger had promised us
column3: and Allah and His Messenger told us what was true." And it only added to their faith and their zeal in obedience.

column1: 33|23|Among the Believers are men who have been true to their covenant with Allah: of them some have completed their vow (to the extreme)
column2: and some (still) wait: but they have never changed (their determination) in the least:

column1: 33|24|That Allah may reward the men of Truth for their Truth
column2: and punish the Hypocrites if that be His Will
column3: or turn to them in Mercy: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving
column4: Most Merciful.

column1: 33|25|And Allah turned back the Unbelievers for (all) their fury: no advantage did they gain; and enough is Allah for the believers in their fight. And Allah is full of Strength
column2: able to enforce His Will.

column1: 33|26|And those of the People of the Book who aided them - Allah did take them down from their strongholds and cast terror into their hearts. (So that) some ye slew
column2: and some ye made prisoners.

column1: 33|27|And He made you heirs of their lands
column2: their houses
column3: and their goods
column4: and of a land which ye had not frequented (before). And Allah has power over all things.

column1: 33|28|O Prophet! Say to thy Consorts: "If it be that ye desire the life of this World
column2: and its glitter
column3: #NAME?

column1: 33|29|But if ye seek Allah and His Messenger
column2: and the Home of the Hereafter
column3: verily Allah has prepared for the well-doers amongst you a great reward.

column1: 33|30|O Consorts of the Prophet! If any of you were guilty of evident unseemly conduct
column2: the Punishment would be doubled to her

column1: 33|31|But any of you that is devout in the service of Allah and His Messenger
column2: and works righteousness
column3: #NAME?

column1: 33|32|O Consorts of the Prophet! Ye are not like any of the (other) women: if ye do fear (Allah)
column2: be not too complacent of speech
column3: lest one in whose heart is a disease should be moved with desire: but speak ye a speech (that is) just.

column1: 33|33|And stay quietly in your houses
column2: and make not a dazzling display
column3: like that of the former Times of Ignorance; and establish regular Prayer
column4: and give regular Charity; and obey Allah and His Messenger. And Allah only wishes to remove all abomination from you
column5: ye members of the Family
column6: and to make you pure and spotless.

column1: 33|34|And recite what is rehearsed to you in your homes
column2: of the Signs of Allah and His Wisdom: for Allah understands the finest mysteries and is well-acquainted (with them).

column1: 33|35|For Muslim men and women
column2: #NAME?
column3: for devout men and women
column4: for true men and women
column5: for men and women who are patient and constant
column6: for men and women who humble themselves
column7: for men and women who give in Charity
column8: for men and women who fast (and deny themselves)
column9: for men and women who guard their chastity
column10: and for men and women who engage much in Allah´s praise

column1: 33|36|It is not fitting for a Believer
column2: man or woman
column3: when a matter has been decided by Allah and His Messenger to have any option about their decision: if any one disobeys Allah and His Messenger
column4: he is indeed on a clearly wrong Path.

column1: 33|37|Behold! Thou didst say to one who had received the grace of Allah and thy favour: "Retain thou (in wedlock) thy wife
column2: and fear Allah." But thou didst hide in thy heart that which Allah was about to make manifest: thou didst fear the people
column3: but it is more fitting that thou shouldst fear Allah. Then when Zaid had dissolved (his marriage) with her
column4: with the necessary (formality)
column5: We joined her in marriage to thee: in order that (in future) there may be no difficulty to the Believers in (the matter of) marriage with the wives of their adopted sons
column6: when the latter have dissolved with the necessary (formality) (their marriage) with them. And Allah´s command must be fulfilled.

column1: 33|38|There can be no difficulty to the Prophet in what Allah has indicated to him as a duty. It was the practice (approved) of Allah amongst those of old that have passed away. And the command of Allah is a decree determined.
33|39|(It is the practice of those) who preach the Messages of Allah
column2: and fear Him
column3: and fear none but Allah. And enough is Allah to call (men) to account.

column1: 33|40|Muhammad is not the father of any of your men
column2: but (he is) the Messenger of Allah
column3: and the Seal of the Prophets: and Allah has full knowledge of all things.

column1: 33|41|O ye who believe! Celebrate the praises of Allah
column2: and do this often;

column1: 33|42|And glorify Him morning and evening.
33|43|He it is Who sends blessings on you
column2: as do His angels
column3: that He may bring you out from the depths of Darkness into Light: and He is Full of Mercy to the Believers.

column1: 33|44|Their salutation on the Day they meet Him will be "Peace!"; and He has prepared for them a generous Reward.
33|45|O Prophet! Truly We have sent thee as a Witness
column2: a Bearer of Glad Tidings
column3: and Warner

column1: 33|46|And as one who invites to Allah´s (grace) by His leave
column2: and as a lamp spreading light.

column1: 33|47|Then give the Glad Tidings to the Believers
column2: that they shall have from Allah a very great Bounty.

column1: 33|48|And obey not (the behests) of the Unbelievers and the Hypocrites
column2: and heed not their annoyances
column3: but put thy Trust in Allah. For enough is Allah as a Disposer of affairs.

column1: 33|49|O ye who believe! When ye marry believing women
column2: and then divorce them before ye have touched them
column3: no period of ´Iddat have ye to count in respect of them: so give them a present. And set them free in a handsome manner.

column1: 33|50|O Prophet! We have made lawful to thee thy wives to whom thou hast paid their dowers; and those whom thy right hand possesses out of the prisoners of war whom Allah has assigned to thee; and daughters of thy paternal uncles and aunts
column2: and daughters of thy maternal uncles and aunts
column3: who migrated (from Makka) with thee; and any believing woman who dedicates her soul to the Prophet if the Prophet wishes to wed her;- this only for thee
column4: and not for the Believers (at large); We know what We have appointed for them as to their wives and the captives whom their right hands possess;- in order that there should be no difficulty for thee. And Allah is Oft-Forgiving
column5: Most Merciful.

column1: 33|51|Thou mayest defer (the turn of) any of them that thou pleasest
column2: and thou mayest receive any thou pleasest: and there is no blame on thee if thou invite one whose (turn) thou hadst set aside. This were nigher to the cooling of their eyes
column3: the prevention of their grief
column4: and their satisfaction - that of all of them - with that which thou hast to give them: and Allah knows (all) that is in your hearts: and Allah is All-Knowing
column5: Most Forbearing.

column1: 33|52|It is not lawful for thee (to marry more) women after this
column2: nor to change them for (other) wives
column3: even though their beauty attract thee
column4: except any thy right hand should possess (as handmaidens): and Allah doth watch over all things.

column1: 33|53|O ye who believe! Enter not the Prophet´s houses
column2: #NAME?
column3: #NAME?
column4: (and then) not (so early as) to wait for its preparation: but when ye are invited
column5: enter; and when ye have taken your meal
column6: disperse
column7: without seeking familiar talk. Such (behaviour) annoys the Prophet: he is ashamed to dismiss you
column8: but Allah is not ashamed (to tell you) the truth. And when ye ask (his ladies) for anything ye want
column9: ask them from before a screen: that makes for greater purity for your hearts and for theirs. Nor is it right for you that ye should annoy Allah´s Messenger
column10: or that ye should marry his widows after him at any time. Truly such a thing is in Allah´s sight an enormity.

column1: 33|54|Whether ye reveal anything or conceal it
column2: verily Allah has full knowledge of all things.

column1: 33|55|There is no blame (on these ladies if they appear) before their fathers or their sons
column2: their brothers
column3: or their brother´s sons
column4: or their sisters´ sons
column5: or their women
column6: or the (slaves) whom their right hands possess. And
column7: (ladies)
column8: fear Allah; for Allah is Witness to all things.

column1: 33|56|Allah and His angels send blessings on the Prophet: O ye that believe! Send ye blessings on him
column2: and salute him with all respect.

column1: 33|57|Those who annoy Allah and His Messenger - Allah has cursed them in this World and in the Hereafter
column2: and has prepared for them a humiliating Punishment.

column1: 33|58|And those who annoy believing men and women undeservedly
column2: bear (on themselves) a calumny and a glaring sin.

column1: 33|59|O Prophet! Tell thy wives and daughters
column2: and the believing women
column3: that they should cast their outer garments over their persons (when abroad): that is most convenient
column4: that they should be known (as such) and not molested. And Allah is Oft-Forgiving
column5: Most Merciful.

column1: 33|60|Truly
column2: if the Hypocrites
column3: and those in whose hearts is a disease
column4: and those who stir up sedition in the City
column5: desist not
column6: We shall certainly stir thee up against them: Then will they not be able to stay in it as thy neighbours for any length of time:

column1: 33|61|They shall have a curse on them: whenever they are found
column2: they shall be seized and slain (without mercy).

column1: 33|62|(Such was) the practice (approved) of Allah among those who lived aforetime: No change wilt thou find in the practice (approved) of Allah.
33|63|Men ask thee concerning the Hour: Say
column2: "The knowledge thereof is with Allah (alone)": and what will make thee understand?- perchance the Hour is nigh!

column1: 33|64|Verily Allah has cursed the Unbelievers and prepared for them a Blazing Fire
33|65|To dwell therein for ever: no protector will they find
column2: nor helper.

column1: 33|66|The Day that their faces will be turned upside down in the Fire
column2: they will say: "Woe to us! Would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger!"

column1: 33|67|And they would say: "Our Lord! We obeyed our chiefs and our great ones
column2: and they misled us as to the (right) Path.

column1: 33|68|"Our Lord! Give them double Penalty and curse them with a very great Curse!"
33|69|O ye who believe! Be ye not like those who vexed and insulted Moses
column2: but Allah cleared him of the (calumnies) they had uttered: and he was honourable in Allah´s sight.

column1: 33|70|O ye who believe! Fear Allah
column2: and (always) say a word directed to the Right:

column1: 33|71|That He may make your conduct whole and sound and forgive you your sins: He that obeys Allah and His Messenger
column2: has already attained the highest achievement.

column1: 33|72|We did indeed offer the Trust to the Heavens and the Earth and the Mountains; but they refused to undertake it
column2: being afraid thereof: but man undertook it;- He was indeed unjust and foolish;-

column1: 33|73|(With the result) that Allah has to punish the Hypocrites
column2: men and women
column3: and the Unbelievers
column4: men and women
column5: and Allah turns in Mercy to the Believers
column6: men and women: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving
column7: Most Merciful.

column1: 34|1|Praise be to Allah
column2: to Whom belong all things in the heavens and on earth: to Him be Praise in the Hereafter: and He is Full of Wisdom
column3: acquainted with all things.

column1: 34|2|He knows all that goes into the earth
column2: and all that comes out thereof; all that comes down from the sky and all that ascends thereto and He is the Most Merciful
column3: the Oft-Forgiving.

column1: 34|3|The Unbelievers say
column2: "Never to us will come the Hour": Say
column3: "Nay! but most surely
column4: by my Lord
column5: it will come upon you;- by Him Who knows the unseen
column6: #NAME?
column7: or greater
column8: but is in the Record Perspicuous:

column1: 34|4|That He may reward those who believe and work deeds of righteousness: for such is Forgiveness and a Sustenance Most Generous."
34|5|But those who strive against Our Signs
column2: to frustrate them
column3: #NAME?
column4: #NAME?

column1: 34|6|And those to whom knowledge has come see that the (Revelation) sent down to thee from thy Lord - that is the Truth
column2: and that it guides to the Path of the Exalted (in might)
column3: Worthy of all praise.

column1: 34|7|The Unbelievers say (in ridicule): "Shall we point out to you a man that will tell you
column2: when ye are all scattered to pieces in disintegration
column3: that ye shall (then be raised) in a New Creation?

column1: 34|8|"Has he invented a falsehood against Allah
column2: or has a spirit (seized) him?"- Nay
column3: it is those who believe not in the Hereafter
column4: that are in (real) Penalty
column5: and in farthest error.

column1: 34|9|See they not what is before them and behind them
column2: of the sky and the earth? If We wished
column3: We could cause the earth to swallow them up
column4: or cause a piece of the sky to fall upon them. Verily in this is a Sign for every devotee that turns to Allah (in repentance).

column1: 34|10|We bestowed Grace aforetime on David from ourselves: "O ye Mountains! Sing ye back the Praises of Allah with him! and ye birds (also)! And We made the iron soft for him;-
34|11|(Commanding)
column2: "Make thou coast of mail
column3: balancing well the rings of chain armour
column4: and work ye righteousness; for be sure I see (clearly) all that ye do."

column1: 34|12|And to Solomon (We made) the Wind (obedient): Its early morning (stride) was a month´s (journey)
column2: and its evening (stride) was a month´s (journey); and We made a Font of molten brass to flow for him; and there were Jinns that worked in front of him
column3: by the leave of his Lord
column4: and if any of them turned aside from our command
column5: We made him taste of the Penalty of the Blazing Fire.

column1: 34|13|They worked for him as he desired
column2: (making) arches
column3: images
column4: basons as large as reservoirs
column5: and (cooking) cauldrons fixed (in their places): "Work ye
column6: sons of David
column7: with thanks! but few of My servants are grateful!"

column1: 34|14|Then
column2: when We decreed (Solomon´s) death
column3: nothing showed them his death except a little worm of the earth
column4: which kept (slowly) gnawing away at his staff: so when he fell down
column5: the Jinns saw plainly that if they had known the unseen
column6: they would not have tarried in the humiliating Penalty (of their Task).

column1: 34|15|There was
column2: for Saba
column3: aforetime
column4: a Sign in their home-land - two Gardens to the right and to the left. "Eat of the Sustenance (provided) by your Lord
column5: and be grateful to Him: a territory fair and happy
column6: and a Lord Oft-Forgiving!

column1: 34|16|But they turned away (from Allah)
column2: and We sent against them the Flood (released) from the dams
column3: and We converted their two garden (rows) into "gardens" producing bitter fruit
column4: and tamarisks
column5: and some few (stunted) Lote-trees.

column1: 34|17|That was the Requital We gave them because they ungratefully rejected Faith: and never do We give (such) requital except to such as are ungrateful rejecters.
34|18|Between them and the Cities on which We had poured our blessings
column2: We had placed Cities in prominent positions
column3: and between them We had appointed stages of journey in due proportion: "Travel therein
column4: secure
column5: by night and by day."

column1: 34|19|But they said: "Our Lord! Place longer distances between our journey-stages": but they wronged themselves (therein). At length We made them as a tale (that is told)
column2: and We dispersed them all in scattered fragments. Verily in this are Signs for every (soul that is) patiently constant and grateful.

column1: 34|20|And on them did Satan prove true his idea
column2: and they followed him
column3: all but a party that believed.

column1: 34|21|But he had no authority over them
column2: #NAME?

column1: 34|22|Say: "Call upon other (gods) whom ye fancy
column2: besides Allah: They have no power
column3: #NAME?
column4: #NAME?
column5: nor is any of them a helper to Allah.

column1: 34|23|"No intercession can avail in His Presence
column2: except for those for whom He has granted permission. So far (is this the case) that
column3: when terror is removed from their hearts (at the Day of Judgment
column4: then) will they say
column5: ´what is it that your Lord commanded?´ they will say
column6: ´That which is true and just; and He is the Most High Most Great´."

column1: 34|24|Say: "Who gives you sustenance
column2: from the heavens and the earth?" Say: "It is Allah; and certain it is that either we or ye are on right guidance or in manifest error!"

column1: 34|25|Say: "Ye shall not be questioned as to our sins
column2: nor shall we be questioned as to what ye do."

column1: 34|26|Say: "Our Lord will gather us together and will in the end decide the matter between us (and you) in truth and justice: and He is the one to decide
