column1: 34|27|Say: "Show me those whom ye have joined with Him as partners: by no means (can ye). Nay
column2: He is Allah
column3: the Exalted in Power
column4: the Wise."

column1: 34|28|We have not sent thee but as a universal (Messenger) to men
column2: giving them glad tidings
column3: and warning them (against sin)
column4: but most men understand not.

column1: 34|29|They say: "When will this promise (come to pass) if ye are telling the truth?"
34|30|Say: "The appointment to you is for a Day
column2: which ye cannot put back for an hour nor put forward."

column1: 34|31|The Unbelievers say: "We shall neither believe in this scripture nor in (any) that (came) before it." Couldst thou but see when the wrong-doers will be made to stand before their Lord
column2: throwing back the word (of blame) on one another! Those who had been despised will say to the arrogant ones: "Had it not been for you
column3: we should certainly have been believers!"

column1: 34|32|The arrogant ones will say to those who had been despised: "Was it we who kept you back from Guidance after it reached you? Nay
column2: rather
column3: it was ye who transgressed.

column1: 34|33|Those who had been despised will say to the arrogant ones: "Nay! it was a plot (of yours) by day and by night: Behold! Ye (constantly) ordered us to be ungrateful to Allah and to attribute equals to Him!" They will declare (their) repentance when they see the Penalty: We shall put yokes on the necks of the Unbelievers: It would only be a requital for their (ill) Deeds.
34|34|Never did We send a warner to a population
column2: but the wealthy ones among them said: "We believe not in the (Message) with which ye have been sent."

column1: 34|35|They said: "We have more in wealth and in sons
column2: and we cannot be punished."

column1: 34|36|Say: "Verily my Lord enlarges and restricts the Provision to whom He pleases
column2: but most men understand not."

column1: 34|37|It is not your wealth nor your sons
column2: that will bring you nearer to Us in degree: but only those who believe and work righteousness - these are the ones for whom there is a multiplied Reward for their deeds
column3: while secure they (reside) in the dwellings on high!

column1: 34|38|Those who strive against Our Signs
column2: to frustrate them
column3: will be given over into Punishment.

column1: 34|39|Say: "Verily my Lord enlarges and restricts the Sustenance to such of his servants as He pleases: and nothing do ye spend in the least (in His cause) but He replaces it: for He is the Best of those who grant Sustenance.
34|40|One Day He will gather them all together
column2: and say to the angels
column3: "Was it you that these men used to worship?"

column1: 34|41|They will say
column2: "Glory to Thee! our (tie) is with Thee - as Protector - not with them. Nay
column3: but they worshipped the Jinns: most of them believed in them."

column1: 34|42|So on that Day no power shall they have over each other
column2: for profit or harm: and We shall say to the wrong-doers
column3: "Taste ye the Penalty of the Fire
column4: - the which ye were wont to deny!"

column1: 34|43|When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them
column2: they say
column3: "This is only a man who wishes to hinder you from the (worship) which your fathers practised." And they say
column4: "This is only a falsehood invented!" and the Unbelievers say of the Truth when it comes to them
column5: "This is nothing but evident magic!"

column1: 34|44|But We had not given them Books which they could study
column2: nor sent messengers to them before thee as Warners.

column1: 34|45|And their predecessors rejected (the Truth); these have not received a tenth of what We had granted to those: yet when they rejected My messengers
column2: how (terrible) was My rejection (of them)!

column1: 34|46|Say: "I do admonish you on one point: that ye do stand up before Allah
column2: #NAME?
column3: or (it may be) singly
column4: #NAME?
column5: in face of a terrible Penalty."

column1: 34|47|Say: "No reward do I ask of you: it is (all) in your interest: my reward is only due from Allah: And He is witness to all things."
34|48|Say: "Verily my Lord doth cast the (mantle of) Truth (over His servants)
column2: - He that has full knowledge of (all) that is hidden."

column1: 34|49|Say: "The Truth has arrived
column2: and Falsehood neither creates anything new
column3: nor restores anything."

column1: 34|50|Say: "If I am astray
column2: I only stray to the loss of my own soul: but if I receive guidance
column3: it is because of the inspiration of my Lord to me: it is He Who hears all things
column4: and is (ever) near."

column1: 34|51|If thou couldst but see when they will quake with terror; but then there will be no escape (for them)
column2: and they will be seized from a position (quite) near.

column1: 34|52|And they will say
column2: "We do believe (now) in the (Truth)"; but how could they receive (Faith) from a position (so far off

column1: 34|53|Seeing that they did reject Faith (entirely) before
column2: and that they (continually) cast (slanders) on the unseen from a position far off?

column1: 34|54|And between them and their desires
column2: is placed a barrier
column3: as was done in the past with their partisans: for they were indeed in suspicious (disquieting) doubt.

column1: 35|1|Praise be to Allah
column2: Who created (out of nothing) the heavens and the earth
column3: Who made the angels
column4: messengers with wings
column5: #NAME?
column6: or three
column7: or four (pairs): He adds to Creation as He pleases: for Allah has power over all things.

column1: 35|2|What Allah out of his Mercy doth bestow on mankind there is none can withhold: what He doth withhold
column2: there is none can grant
column3: apart from Him: and He is the Exalted in Power
column4: full of Wisdom.

column1: 35|3|O men! Call to mind the grace of Allah unto you! is there a creator
column2: other than Allah
column3: to give you sustenance from heaven or earth? There is no god but He: how then are ye deluded away from the Truth?

column1: 35|4|And if they reject thee
column2: so were messengers rejected before thee: to Allah back for decision all affairs.

column1: 35|5|O men! Certainly the promise of Allah is true. Let not then this present life deceive you
column2: nor let the Chief Deceiver deceive you about Allah.

column1: 35|6|Verily Satan is an enemy to you: so treat him as an enemy. He only invites his adherents
column2: that they may become Companions of the Blazing Fire.

column1: 35|7|For those who reject Allah
column2: is a terrible Penalty: but for those who believe and work righteous deeds
column3: is Forgiveness
column4: and a magnificent Reward.

column1: 35|8|Is he
column2: then
column3: to whom the evil of his conduct is made alluring
column4: so that he looks upon it as good
column5: (equal to one who is rightly guided)? For Allah leaves to stray whom He wills
column6: and guides whom He wills. So let not thy soul go out in (vainly) sighing after them: for Allah knows well all that they do!

column1: 35|9|It is Allah Who sends forth the Winds
column2: so that they raise up the Clouds
column3: and We drive them to a land that is dead
column4: and revive the earth therewith after its death: even so (will be) the Resurrection!

column1: 35|10|If any do seek for glory and power
column2: #NAME?
column3: - for them is a Penalty terrible; and the plotting of such will be void (of result).

column1: 35|11|And Allah did create you from dust; then from a sperm-drop; then He made you in pairs. And no female conceives
column2: or lays down (her load)
column3: but with His knowledge. Nor is a man long-lived granted length of days
column4: nor is a part cut off from his life
column5: but is in a Decree (ordained). All this is easy to Allah.

column1: 35|12|Nor are the two bodies of flowing water alike
column2: #NAME?
column3: sweet
column4: and pleasant to drink
column5: and the other
column6: salt and bitter. Yet from each (kind of water) do ye eat flesh fresh and tender
column7: and ye extract ornaments to wear; and thou seest the ships therein that plough the waves
column8: that ye may seek (thus) of the Bounty of Allah that ye may be grateful.

column1: 35|13|He merges Night into Day
column2: and he merges Day into Night
column3: and he has subjected the sun and the moon (to his Law): each one runs its course for a term appointed. Such is Allah your Lord: to Him belongs all Dominion. And those whom ye invoke besides Him have not the least power.

column1: 35|14|If ye invoke them
column2: they will not listen to your call
column3: and if they were to listen
column4: they cannot answer your (prayer). On the Day of Judgment they will reject your "Partnership". and none
column5: (O man!) can tell thee (the Truth) like the One Who is acquainted with all things.

column1: 35|15|O ye men! It is ye that have need of Allah: but Allah is the One Free of all wants
column2: worthy of all praise.

column1: 35|16|If He so pleased
column2: He could blot you out and bring in a New Creation.

column1: 35|17|Nor is that (at all) difficult for Allah.

35|18|Nor can a bearer of burdens bear another´s burdens if one heavily laden should call another to (bear) his load. Not the least portion of it can be carried (by the other). Even though he be nearly related. Thou canst but admonish such as fear their Lord unseen and establish regular Prayer. And whoever purifies himself does so for the benefit of his own soul; and the destination (of all) is to Allah.
35|19|The blind and the seeing are not alike;
35|20|Nor are the depths of Darkness and the Light;
35|21|Nor are the (chilly) shade and the (genial) heat of the sun:
35|22|Nor are alike those that are living and those that are dead. Allah can make any that He wills to hear; but thou canst not make those to hear who are (buried) in graves.
35|23|Thou art no other than a warner.
35|24|Verily We have sent thee in truth
column2: as a bearer of glad tidings
column3: and as a warner: and there never was a people
column4: without a warner having lived among them (in the past).

column1: 35|25|And if they reject thee
column2: so did their predecessors
column3: to whom came their messengers with Clear Signs
column4: Books of dark prophecies
column5: and the Book of Enlightenment.

column1: 35|26|In the end did I punish those who rejected Faith: and how (terrible) was My rejection (of them)!
35|27|Seest thou not that Allah sends down rain from the sky? With it We then bring out produce of various colours. And in the mountains are tracts white and red
column2: of various shades of colour
column3: and black intense in hue.

column1: 35|28|And so amongst men and crawling creatures and cattle
column2: are they of various colours. Those truly fear Allah
column3: among His Servants
column4: who have knowledge: for Allah is Exalted in Might
column5: Oft-Forgiving.

column1: 35|29|Those who rehearse the Book of Allah
column2: establish regular Prayer
column3: and spend (in Charity) out of what We have provided for them
column4: secretly and openly
column5: hope for a commerce that will never fail:

column1: 35|30|For He will pay them their meed
column2: nay
column3: He will give them (even) more out of His Bounty: for He is Oft-Forgiving
column4: Most Ready to appreciate (service).

column1: 35|31|That which We have revealed to thee of the Book is the Truth
column2: #NAME?

column1: 35|32|Then We have given the Book for inheritance to such of Our Servants as We have chosen: but there are among them some who wrong their own souls; some who follow a middle course; and some who are
column2: by Allah´s leave
column3: foremost in good deeds; that is the highest Grace.

column1: 35|33|Gardens of Eternity will they enter: therein will they be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls; and their garments there will be of silk.
35|34|And they will say: "Praise be to Allah
column2: Who has removed from us (all) sorrow: for our Lord is indeed Oft-Forgiving Ready to appreciate (service):

column1: 35|35|"Who has
column2: out of His Bounty
column3: settled us in a Home that will last: no toil nor sense of weariness shall touch us therein."

column1: 35|36|But those who reject (Allah) - for them will be the Fire of Hell: No term shall be determined for them
column2: so they should die
column3: nor shall its Penalty be lightened for them. Thus do We reward every ungrateful one!

column1: 35|37|Therein will they cry aloud (for assistance): "Our Lord! Bring us out: we shall work righteousness
column2: not the (deeds) we used to do!" - "Did We not give you long enough life so that he that would should receive admonition? and (moreover) the warner came to you. So taste ye (the fruits of your deeds): for the wrong-doers there is no helper."

column1: 35|38|Verily Allah knows (all) the hidden things of the heavens and the earth: verily He has full knowledge of all that is in (men´s) hearts.
35|39|He it is That has made you inheritors in the earth: if
column2: then
column3: any do reject (Allah)
column4: their rejection (works) against themselves: their rejection but adds to the odium for the Unbelievers in the sight of their Lord: their rejection but adds to (their own) undoing.

column1: 35|40|Say: "Have ye seen (these) ´Partners´ of yours whom ye call upon besides Allah? Show Me what it is they have created in the (wide) earth. Or have they a share in the heavens? Or have We given them a Book from which they (can derive) clear (evidence)?- Nay
column2: the wrong-doers promise each other nothing but delusions.

column1: 35|41|It is Allah Who sustains the heavens and the earth
column2: lest they cease (to function): and if they should fail
column3: there is none - not one - can sustain them thereafter: Verily He is Most Forbearing
column4: Oft-Forgiving.

column1: 35|42|They swore their strongest oaths by Allah that if a warner came to them
column2: they would follow his guidance better than any (other) of the Peoples: But when a warner came to them
column3: it has only increased their flight (from righteousness)

column1: 35|43|On account of their arrogance in the land and their plotting of Evil
column2: but the plotting of Evil will hem in only the authors thereof. Now are they but looking for the way the ancients were dealt with? But no change wilt thou find in Allah´s way (of dealing): no turning off wilt thou find in Allah´s way (of dealing).

column1: 35|44|Do they not travel through the earth
column2: and see what was the End of those before them
column3: #NAME?

column1: 35|45|If Allah were to punish men according to what they deserve. He would not leave on the back of the (earth) a single living creature: but He gives them respite for a stated Term: when their Term expires
column2: verily Allah has in His sight all His Servants.

column1: 36|1|Ya Sin.
36|2|By the Qur´an
column2: full of Wisdom

column1: 36|3|Thou art indeed one of the messengers
36|4|On a Straight Way.
36|5|It is a Revelation sent down by (Him)
column2: the Exalted in Might
column3: Most Merciful.

column1: 36|6|In order that thou mayest admonish a people
column2: whose fathers had received no admonition
column3: and who therefore remain heedless (of the Signs of Allah).

column1: 36|7|The Word is proved true against the greater part of them: for they do not believe.
36|8|We have put yokes round their necks right up to their chins
column2: so that their heads are forced up (and they cannot see).

column1: 36|9|And We have put a bar in front of them and a bar behind them
column2: and further
column3: We have covered them up; so that they cannot see.

column1: 36|10|The same is it to them whether thou admonish them or thou do not admonish them: they will not believe.
36|11|Thou canst but admonish such a one as follows the Message and fears the (Lord) Most Gracious
column2: unseen: give such a one
column3: therefore
column4: good tidings
column5: of Forgiveness and a Reward most generous.

column1: 36|12|Verily We shall give life to the dead
column2: and We record that which they send before and that which they leave behind
column3: and of all things have We taken account in a clear Book (of evidence).

column1: 36|13|Set forth to them
column2: by way of a parable
column3: the (story of) the Companions of the City. Behold!
column4: there came messengers to it.

column1: 36|14|When We (first) sent to them two messengers
column2: they rejected them: But We strengthened them with a third: they said
column3: "Truly
column4: we have been sent on a mission to you."

column1: 36|15|The (people) said: "Ye are only men like ourselves; and (Allah) Most Gracious sends no sort of revelation: ye do nothing but lie."
36|16|They said: "Our Lord doth know that we have been sent on a mission to you:
36|17|"And our duty is only to proclaim the clear Message."
36|18|The (people) said: "for us
column2: we augur an evil omen from you: if ye desist not
column3: we will certainly stone you. And a grievous punishment indeed will be inflicted on you by us."

column1: 36|19|They said: "Your evil omens are with yourselves: (deem ye this an evil omen). If ye are admonished? Nay
column2: but ye are a people transgressing all bounds!"

column1: 36|20|Then there came running
column2: from the farthest part of the City
column3: a man
column4: saying
column5: "O my people! Obey the messengers:

column1: 36|21|"Obey those who ask no reward of you (for themselves)
column2: and who have themselves received Guidance.

column1: 36|22|"It would not be reasonable in me if I did not serve Him Who created me
column2: and to Whom ye shall (all) be brought back.

column1: 36|23|"Shall I take (other) gods besides Him? If (Allah) Most Gracious should intend some adversity for me
column2: of no use whatever will be their intercession for me
column3: nor can they deliver me.

column1: 36|24|"I would indeed
column2: if I were to do so
column3: be in manifest Error.

column1: 36|25|"For me
column2: I have faith in the Lord of you (all): listen
column3: then
column4: to me!"

column1: 36|26|It was said: "Enter thou the Garden." He said: "Ah me! Would that my People knew (what I know)!-
36|27|"For that my Lord has granted me Forgiveness and has enrolled me among those held in honour!"
36|28|And We sent not down against his People
column2: after him
column3: any hosts from heaven
column4: nor was it needful for Us so to do.

column1: 36|29|It was no more than a single mighty Blast
column2: and behold! they were (like ashes) quenched and silent.

column1: 36|30|Ah! Alas for (My) Servants! There comes not a messenger to them but they mock him!
36|31|See they not how many generations before them we destroyed? Not to them will they return:
36|32|But each one of them all - will be brought before Us (for judgment).
36|33|A Sign for them is the earth that is dead: We do give it life
column2: and produce grain therefrom
column3: of which ye do eat.

column1: 36|34|And We produce therein orchard with date-palms and vines
column2: and We cause springs to gush forth therein:

column1: 36|35|That they may enjoy the fruits of this (artistry): It was not their hands that made this: will they not then give thanks?
36|36|Glory to Allah
column2: Who created in pairs all things that the earth produces
column3: as well as their own (human) kind and (other) things of which they have no knowledge.

column1: 36|37|And a Sign for them is the Night: We withdraw therefrom the Day
column2: and behold they are plunged in darkness;

column1: 36|38|And the sun runs his course for a period determined for him: that is the decree of (Him)
column2: the Exalted in Might
column3: the All-Knowing.

column1: 36|39|And the Moon
column2: #NAME?

column1: 36|40|It is not permitted to the Sun to catch up the Moon
column2: nor can the Night outstrip the Day: Each (just) swims along in (its own) orbit (according to Law).

column1: 36|41|And a Sign for them is that We bore their race (through the Flood) in the loaded Ark;
36|42|And We have created for them similar (vessels) on which they ride.
36|43|If it were Our Will
column2: We could drown them: then would there be no helper (to hear their cry)
column3: nor could they be delivered

column1: 36|44|Except by way of Mercy from Us
column2: and by way of (world) convenience (to serve them) for a time.

column1: 36|45|When they are told
column2: "Fear ye that which is before you and that which will be after you
column3: in order that ye may receive Mercy
column4:
(they turn back).
36|46|Not a Sign comes to them from among the Signs of their Lord, but they turn away therefrom.
36|47|And when they are told, Spend ye of (the bounties) with which Allah has provided you
column5: the Unbelievers say to those who believe: Shall we then feed those whom
column6: if Allah had so willed
column7: He would have fed
column8: (Himself)?- Ye are in nothing but manifest error."

column1: 36|48|Further
column2: they say
column3: "When will this promise (come to pass)
column4: if what ye say is true?"

column1: 36|49|They will not (have to) wait for aught but a single Blast: it will seize them while they are yet disputing among themselves!
36|50|No (chance) will they then have
column2: by will
column3: to dispose (of their affairs)
column4: nor to return to their own people!

column1: 36|51|The trumpet shall be sounded
column2: when behold! from the sepulchres (men) will rush forth to their Lord!

column1: 36|52|They will say: "Ah! Woe unto us! Who hath raised us up from our beds of repose?"... (A voice will say:) "This is what (Allah) Most Gracious had promised. And true was the word of the messengers!"
36|53|It will be no more than a single Blast
column2: when lo! they will all be brought up before Us!

column1: 36|54|Then
column2: on that Day
column3: not a soul will be wronged in the least
column4: and ye shall but be repaid the meeds of your past Deeds.

column1: 36|55|Verily the Companions of the Garden shall that Day have joy in all that they do;
36|56|They and their associates will be in groves of (cool) shade
column2: reclining on Thrones (of dignity);

column1: 36|57|(Every) fruit (enjoyment) will be there for them; they shall have whatever they call for;
36|58|"Peace!" - a word (of salutation) from a Lord Most Merciful!
36|59|"And O ye in sin! Get ye apart this Day!
36|60|"Did I not enjoin on you
column2: O ye Children of Adam
column3: that ye should not worship Satan; for that he was to you an enemy avowed?-

column1: 36|61|"And that ye should worship Me
column2: (for that) this was the Straight Way?

column1: 36|62|"But he did lead astray a great multitude of you. Did ye not
column2: then
column3: understand?

column1: 36|63|"This is the Hell of which ye were (repeatedly) warned!
36|64|"Embrace ye the (fire) this Day
column2: for that ye (persistently) rejected (Truth)."

column1: 36|65|That Day shall We set a seal on their mouths. But their hands will speak to us
column2: and their feet bear witness
column3: to all that they did.

column1: 36|66|If it had been our Will
column2: We could surely have blotted out their eyes; then should they have run about groping for the Path
column3: but how could they have seen?

column1: 36|67|And if it had been Our Will
column2: We could have transformed them (to remain) in their places; then should they have been unable to move about
column3: nor could they have returned (after error).

column1: 36|68|If We grant long life to any
column2: We cause him to be reversed in nature: Will they not then understand?

column1: 36|69|We have not instructed the (Prophet) in Poetry
column2: nor is it meet for him: this is no less than a Message and a Qur´an making things clear:

column1: 36|70|That it may give admonition to any (who are) alive
column2: and that the charge may be proved against those who reject (Truth).

column1: 36|71|See they not that it is We Who have created for them - among the things which Our hands have fashioned - cattle
column2: which are under their dominion?-

column1: 36|72|And that We have subjected them to their (use)? of them some do carry them and some they eat:
36|73|And they have (other) profits from them (besides)
column2: and they get (milk) to drink. Will they not then be grateful?

column1: 36|74|Yet they take (for worship) gods other than Allah
column2: (hoping) that they might be helped!

column1: 36|75|They have not the power to help them: but they will be brought up (before Our Judgment-seat) as a troop (to be condemned).
36|76|Let not their speech
column2: then
column3: grieve thee. Verily We know what they hide as well as what they disclose.

column1: 36|77|Doth not man see that it is We Who created him from sperm? yet behold! he (stands forth) as an open adversary!
36|78|And he makes comparisons for Us
column2: and forgets his own (origin and) Creation: He says
column3: "Who can give life to (dry) bones and decomposed ones (at that)?"

column2: "He will give them life Who created them for the first time! for He is Well-versed in every kind of creation!-

column1: 36|80|"The same Who produces for you fire out of the green tree
column2: when behold! ye kindle therewith (your own fires)!

column1: 36|81|"Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like thereof?" - Yea
column2: indeed! for He is the Creator Supreme
column3: of skill and knowledge (infinite)!

column1: 36|82|Verily
column2: when He intends a thing
column3: His Command is
column4: "be"
column5: and it is!

column1: 36|83|So glory to Him in Whose hands is the dominion of all things: and to Him will ye be all brought back.
37|1|By those who range themselves in ranks
37|2|And so are strong in repelling (evil)
37|3|And thus proclaim the Message (of Allah)!
37|4|Verily
column2: verily
column3: your Allah is one!-

column1: 37|5|Lord of the heavens and of the earth and all between them
column2: and Lord of every point at the rising of the sun!

column1: 37|6|We have indeed decked the lower heaven with beauty (in) the stars
37|7|(For beauty) and for guard against all obstinate rebellious evil spirits
37|8|(So) they should not strain their ears in the direction of the Exalted Assembly but be cast away from every side
37|9|Repulsed
column2: for they are under a perpetual penalty

column1: 37|10|Except such as snatch away something by stealth
column2: and they are pursued by a flaming fire
column3: of piercing brightness.

column1: 37|11|Just ask their opinion: are they the more difficult to create
column2: or the (other) beings We have created? Them have We created out of a sticky clay!

column1: 37|12|Truly dost thou marvel
column2: while they ridicule
when they are admonished
column3: pay no heed

column2: when they see a Sign
column3: turn it to mockery

column1: 37|15|And say
column2: "This is nothing but evident sorcery!

column1: 37|16|"What! when we die
column2: and become dust and bones
column3: shall we (then) be raised up (again)

column1: 37|17|"And also our fathers of old?"
37|18|Say thou: "Yea
column2: and ye shall then be humiliated (on account of your evil)."

column1: 37|19|Then it will be a single (compelling) cry; and behold
column2: they will begin to see!

column1: 37|20|They will say
column2: "Ah! Woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!"

column1: 37|21|(A voice will say
column2: ) "This is the Day of Sorting Out
column3: whose truth ye (once) denied!"

column1: 37|22|"Bring ye up"
column2: it shall be said
column3: "The wrong-doers and their wives
column4: and the things they worshipped-

column1: 37|23|"Besides Allah
column2: and lead them to the Way to the (Fierce) Fire!

column1: 37|24|"But stop them
column2: for they must be asked:

column1: 37|25|"´What is the matter with you that ye help not each other?´"

column2: but that day they shall submit (to Judgment);

column1: 37|27|And they will turn to one another
column2: and question one another.

column1: 37|28|They will say: "It was ye who used to come to us from the right hand (of power and authority)!"
37|29|They will reply: "Nay
column2: ye yourselves had no Faith!

column1: 37|30|"Nor had we any authority over you. Nay
column2: it was ye who were a people in obstinate rebellion!

column1: 37|31|"So now has been proved true
column2: against us
column3: the word of our Lord that we shall indeed (have to) taste (the punishment of our sins).

column1: 37|32|"We led you astray: for truly we were ourselves astray."
37|33|Truly
column2: that Day
column3: they will (all) share in the Penalty.

column1: 37|34|Verily that is how We shall deal with Sinners.
37|35|For they
column2: when they were told that there is no god except Allah
column3: would puff themselves up with Pride

column1: 37|36|And say: "What! shall we give up our gods for the sake of a Poet possessed?"
37|37|Nay! he has come with the (very) Truth
column2: and he confirms (the Message of) the messengers (before him).

column1: 37|38|Ye shall indeed taste of the Grievous Penalty;-
37|39|But it will be no more than the retribution of (the Evil) that ye have wrought;-
37|40|But the sincere (and devoted) Servants of Allah
37|41|For them is a Sustenance determined
37|42|Fruits (Delights); and they (shall enjoy) honour and dignity
37|43|In Gardens of Felicity
37|44|Facing each other on Thrones (of Dignity):
37|45|Round will be passed to them a Cup from a clear-flowing fountain
37|46|Crystal-white
column2: of a taste delicious to those who drink (thereof)

column1: 37|47|Free from headiness; nor will they suffer intoxication therefrom.
37|48|And besides them will be chaste women
column2: restraining their glances
column3: with big eyes (of wonder and beauty).

column1: 37|49|As if they were (delicate) eggs closely guarded.
37|50|Then they will turn to one another and question one another.
37|51|One of them will start the talk and say: "I had an intimate companion (on the earth)
37|52|"Who used to say
column2: ´what! art thou amongst those who bear witness to the Truth (of the Message)?

column1: 37|53|"´When we die and become dust and bones
column2: shall we indeed receive rewards and punishments?´"

column1: 37|54|(A voice) said: "Would ye like to look down?"
37|55|He looked down and saw him in the midst of the Fire.
37|56|He said: "By Allah! thou wast little short of bringing me to perdition!
37|57|"Had it not been for the Grace of my Lord
column2: I should certainly have been among those brought (there)!

column1: 37|58|"Is it (the case) that we shall not die
37|59|"Except our first death
column2: and that we shall not be punished?"

column1: 37|60|Verily this is the supreme achievement!
37|61|For the like of this let all strive
column2: who wish to strive.

column1: 37|62|Is that the better entertainment or the Tree of Zaqqum?
37|63|For We have truly made it (as) a trial for the wrong-doers.
37|64|For it is a tree that springs out of the bottom of Hell-Fire:
37|65|The shoots of its fruit-stalks are like the heads of devils:
37|66|Truly they will eat thereof and fill their bellies therewith.
37|67|Then on top of that they will be given a mixture made of boiling water.
37|68|Then shall their return be to the (Blazing) Fire.
37|69|Truly they found their fathers on the wrong Path;
37|70|So they (too) were rushed down on their footsteps!
37|71|And truly before them
column2: many of the ancients went astray;-

column1: 37|72|But We sent aforetime
column2: among them
column3: (messengers) to admonish them;-

column1: 37|73|Then see what was the end of those who were admonished (but heeded not)
37|74|Except the sincere (and devoted) Servants of Allah.
37|75|(In the days of old)
column2: Noah cried to Us
column3: and We are the best to hear prayer.

column1: 37|76|And We delivered him and his people from the Great Calamity
37|77|And made his progeny to endure (on this earth);
37|78|And We left (this blessing) for him among generations to come in later times:
37|79|"Peace and salutation to Noah among the nations!"
37|80|Thus indeed do we reward those who do right.
37|81|For he was one of our believing Servants.
37|82|Then the rest we overwhelmed in the Flood.
37|83|Verily among those who followed his Way was Abraham.
37|84|Behold! he approached his Lord with a sound heart.
37|85|Behold! he said to his father and to his people
column2: "What is that which ye worship?

column1: 37|86|"Is it a falsehood- gods other than Allah- that ye desire?
37|87|"Then what is your idea about the Lord of the worlds?"
37|88|Then did he cast a glance at the Stars.
37|89|And he said
column2: "I am indeed sick (at heart)!"

column1: 37|90|So they turned away from him
column2: and departed.

column1: 37|91|Then did he turn to their gods and said
column2: "will ye not eat (of the offerings before you)?...

column1: 37|92|"What is the matter with you that ye speak not (intelligently)?"
37|93|Then did he turn upon them
column2: striking (them) with the right hand.

column1: 37|94|Then came (the worshippers) with hurried steps
column2: and faced (him).

column1: 37|95|He said: "Worship ye that which ye have (yourselves) carved?
37|96|"But Allah has created you and your handwork!"
37|97|They said
column2: "Build him a furnace
column3: and throw him into the blazing fire!"

column1: 37|98|(This failing)
column2: they then sought a stratagem against him
column3: but We made them the ones most humiliated!

column1: 37|99|He said: "I will go to my Lord! He will surely guide me!
37|100|"O my Lord! Grant me a righteous (son)!"
37|101|So We gave him the good news of a boy ready to suffer and forbear.

column2: when (the son) reached (the age of) (serious) work with him
column3: he said: "O my son! I see in vision that I offer thee in sacrifice: Now see what is thy view!" (The son) said: "O my father! Do as thou art commanded: thou will find me
column4: if Allah so wills one practising Patience and Constancy!"

column1: 37|103|So when they had both submitted their wills (to Allah)
column2: and he had laid him prostrate on his forehead (for sacrifice)

column1: 37|104|We called out to him "O Abraham!
37|105|"Thou hast already fulfilled the vision!" - thus indeed do We reward those who do right.
37|106|For this was obviously a trial-
37|107|And We ransomed him with a momentous sacrifice:
37|108|And We left (this blessing) for him among generations (to come) in later times:
37|109|"Peace and salutation to Abraham!"
37|110|Thus indeed do We reward those who do right.
37|111|For he was one of our believing Servants.
37|112|And We gave him the good news of Isaac - a prophet
column2: #NAME?

column1: 37|113|We blessed him and Isaac: but of their progeny are (some) that do right
column2: and (some) that obviously do wrong
column3: to their own souls.

column1: 37|114|Again (of old) We bestowed Our favour on Moses and Aaron
37|115|And We delivered them and their people from (their) Great Calamity;
37|116|And We helped them
column2: so they overcame (their troubles);

column1: 37|117|And We gave them the Book which helps to make things clear;
37|118|And We guided them to the Straight Way.
37|119|And We left (this blessing) for them among generations (to come) in later times:
37|120|"Peace and salutation to Moses and Aaron!"
37|121|Thus indeed do We reward those who do right.
37|122|For they were two of our believing Servants.
37|123|So also was Elias among those sent (by Us).
37|124|Behold
column2: he said to his people
column3: "Will ye not fear (Allah)?

column1: 37|125|"Will ye call upon Baal and forsake the Best of Creators

column2: your Lord and Cherisher and the Lord and Cherisher of your fathers of old?"

column1: 37|127|But they rejected him
column2: and they will certainly be called up (for punishment)

column1: 37|128|Except the sincere and devoted Servants of Allah (among them).
37|129|And We left (this blessing) for him among generations (to come) in later times:
37|130|"Peace and salutation to such as Elias!"
37|131|Thus indeed do We reward those who do right.
37|132|For he was one of our believing Servants.
37|133|So also was Lut among those sent (by Us).
37|134|Behold
column2: We delivered him and his adherents
column3: all

column1: 37|135|Except an old woman who was among those who lagged behind:
37|136|Then We destroyed the rest.
37|137|Verily
column2: ye pass by their (sites)
column3: by day-

column1: 37|138|And by night: will ye not understand?
37|139|So also was Jonah among those sent (by Us).
37|140|When he ran away (like a slave from captivity) to the ship (fully) laden
37|141|He (agreed to) cast lots
column2: and he was condemned:

column1: 37|142|Then the big Fish did swallow him
column2: and he had done acts worthy of blame.

column1: 37|143|Had it not been that he (repented and) glorified Allah
37|144|He would certainly have remained inside the Fish till the Day of Resurrection.
37|145|But We cast him forth on the naked shore in a state of sickness
37|146|And We caused to grow
column2: over him
column3: a spreading plant of the gourd kind.

column1: 37|147|And We sent him (on a mission) to a hundred thousand (men) or more.
37|148|And they believed; so We permitted them to enjoy (their life) for a while.
37|149|Now ask them their opinion: Is it that thy Lord has (only) daughters
column2: and they have sons?-

column1: 37|150|Or that We created the angels female
column2: and they are witnesses (thereto)?

column1: 37|151|Is it not that they say
column2: from their own invention

column1: 37|152|"Allah has begotten children"? but they are liars!
37|153|Did He (then) choose daughters rather than sons?
37|154|What is the matter with you? How judge ye?

column3: except such as it will please Allah (to exempt). Then will a second one be sounded
column4: when
column5: behold
column6: they will be standing and looking on!

column1: 39|69|And the Earth will shine with the Glory of its Lord: the Record (of Deeds) will be placed (open); the prophets and the witnesses will be brought forward and a just decision pronounced between them; and they will not be wronged (in the least).
39|70|And to every soul will be paid in full (the fruit) of its Deeds; and (Allah) knoweth best all that they do.
39|71|The Unbelievers will be led to Hell in crowd: until
column2: when they arrive
column3: there
column4: its gates will be opened. And its keepers will say
column5: "Did not messengers come to you from among yourselves
column6: rehearsing to you the Signs of your Lord
column7: and warning you of the Meeting of This Day of yours?" The answer will be: "True: but the Decree of Punishment has been proved true against the Unbelievers!"

column1: 39|72|(To them) will be said: "Enter ye the gates of Hell
column2: to dwell therein: and evil is (this) Abode of the Arrogant!"

column1: 39|73|And those who feared their Lord will be led to the Garden in crowds: until behold
column2: they arrive there; its gates will be opened; and its keepers will say: "Peace be upon you! well have ye done! enter ye here
column3: to dwell therein."

column1: 39|74|They will say: "Praise be to Allah
column2: Who has truly fulfilled His Promise to us
column3: and has given us (this) land in heritage: We can dwell in the Garden as we will: how excellent a reward for those who work (righteousness)!"

column1: 39|75|And thou wilt see the angels surrounding the Throne (Divine) on all sides
column2: singing Glory and Praise to their Lord. The Decision between them (at Judgment) will be in (perfect) justice
column3: and the cry (on all sides) will be
column4: "Praise be to Allah
column5: the Lord of the Worlds!"

column1: 40|1|Ha Mim
40|2|The revelation of this Book is from Allah
column2: Exalted in Power
column3: Full of Knowledge

column1: 40|3|Who forgiveth sin
column2: accepteth repentance
column3: is strict in punishment
column4: and hath a long reach (in all things). there is no god but He: to Him is the final goal.

column1: 40|4|None can dispute about the Signs of Allah but the Unbelievers. Let not
column2: then
column3: their strutting about through the land deceive thee!

column1: 40|5|But (there were people) before them
column2: who denied (the Signs)
column3: #NAME?
column4: and the Confederates (of Evil) after them; and every People plotted against their prophet
column5: to seize him
column6: and disputed by means of vanities
column7: therewith to condemn the Truth; but it was I that seized them! and how (terrible) was My Requital!

column1: 40|6|Thus was the Decree of thy Lord proved true against the Unbelievers; that truly they are Companions of the Fire!

40|7|Those who sustain the Throne (of Allah) and those around it Sing Glory and Praise to their Lord; believe in Him; and implore Forgiveness for those who believe: "Our Lord! Thy Reach is over all things
column2: in Mercy and Knowledge. Forgive
column3: then
column4: those who turn in Repentance
column5: and follow Thy Path; and preserve them from the Penalty of the Blazing Fire!

column1: 40|8|"And grant
column2: our Lord! that they enter the Gardens of Eternity
column3: which Thou hast promised to them
column4: and to the righteous among their fathers
column5: their wives
column6: and their posterity! For Thou art (He)
column7: the Exalted in Might
column8: Full of Wisdom.

column1: 40|9|"And preserve them from (all) ills; and any whom Thou dost preserve from ills that Day
column2: - on them wilt Thou have bestowed Mercy indeed: and that will be truly (for them) the highest Achievement".

column1: 40|10|The Unbelievers will be addressed: "Greater was the aversion of Allah to you than (is) your aversion to yourselves
column2: seeing that ye were called to the Faith and ye used to refuse."

column1: 40|11|They will say: "Our Lord! twice hast Thou made us without life
column2: and twice hast Thou given us Life! Now have we recognised our sins: Is there any way out (of this)?"

column1: 40|12|(The answer will be:) "This is because
column2: when Allah was invoked as the Only (object of worship)
column3: ye did reject Faith
column4: but when partners were joined to Him
column5: ye believed! the Command is with Allah
column6: Most High
column7: Most Great!"

column1: 40|13|He it is Who showeth you his Signs
column2: and sendeth down sustenance for you from the sky: but only those receive admonition who turn (to Allah).

column1: 40|14|Call ye
column2: then
column3: upon Allah with sincere devotion to Him
column4: even though the Unbelievers may detest it.

column1: 40|15|Raised high above ranks (or degrees)
column2: (He is) the Lord of the Throne (of Authority): by His Command doth He send the Spirit (of inspiration) to any of His servants he pleases
column3: that it may warn (men) of the Day of Mutual Meeting

column1: 40|16|The Day whereon they will (all) come forth: not a single thing concerning them is hidden from Allah. Whose will be the dominion that Day?" That of Allah
column2: the One the Irresistible!

column1: 40|17|That Day will every soul be requited for what it earned; no injustice will there be that Day
column2: for Allah is Swift in taking account.

column1: 40|18|Warn them of the Day that is (ever) drawing near
column2: when the hearts will (come) right up to the throats to choke (them); No intimate friend nor intercessor will the wrong-doers have
column3: who could be listened to.

column1: 40|19|(Allah) knows of (the tricks) that deceive with the eyes
column2: and all that the hearts (of men) conceal.

column1: 40|20|And Allah will judge with (justice and) Truth: but those whom (men) invoke besides Him
column2: will not (be in a position) to judge at all. Verily it is Allah (alone) Who hears and sees (all things).

column1: 40|21|Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the End of those before them? They were even superior to them in strength
column2: and in the traces (they have left) in the land: but Allah did call them to account for their sins
column3: and none had they to defend them against Allah.

column1: 40|22|That was because there came to them their messengers with Clear (Signs)
column2: but they rejected them: So Allah called them to account: for He is Full of Strength
column3: Strict in Punishment.

column1: 40|23|Of old We sent Moses
column2: with Our Signs and an authority manifest

column1: 40|24|To Pharaoh
column2: Haman
column3: and Qarun; but they called (him)" a sorcerer telling lies!"...

column2: when he came to them in Truth
column3: from Us
column4: they said
column5: "Slay the sons of those who believe with him
column6: and keep alive their females
column7:
but the plots of Unbelievers (end) in nothing but errors (and delusions)!...
40|26|Said Pharaoh: Leave me to slay Moses; and let him call on his Lord! What I fear is lest he should change your religion
column8: or lest he should cause mischief to appear in the land!"

column1: 40|27|Moses said: "I have indeed called upon my Lord and your Lord (for protection) from every arrogant one who believes not in the Day of Account!"
40|28|A believer
column2: a man from among the people of Pharaoh
column3: who had concealed his faith
column4: said: "Will ye slay a man because he says
column5: ´My Lord is Allah´?- when he has indeed come to you with Clear (Signs) from your Lord? and if he be a liar
column6: on him is (the sin of) his lie: but
column7: if he is telling the Truth
column8: then will fall on you something of the (calamity) of which he warns you: Truly Allah guides not one who transgresses and lies!

column1: 40|29|"O my People! Yours is the dominion this day: Ye have the upper hand in the land: but who will help us from the Punishment of Allah
column2: should it befall us?" Pharaoh said: "I but point out to you that which I see (myself); Nor do I guide you but to the Path of Right!"

column1: 40|30|Then said the man who believed: "O my people! Truly I do fear for you something like the Day (of disaster) of the Confederates (in sin)!-
40|31|"Something like the fate of the People of Noah
column2: the ´Ad
column3: and the Thamud
column4: and those who came after them: but Allah never wishes injustice to his Servants.

column1: 40|32|"And O my people! I fear for you a Day when there will be Mutual calling (and wailing)
40|33|"A Day when ye shall turn your backs and flee: No defender shall ye have from Allah: Any whom Allah leaves to stray
column2: there is none to guide...

column1: 40|34|"And to you there came Joseph in times gone by
column2: with Clear Signs
column3: but ye ceased not to doubt of the (Mission) for which he had come: At length
column4: when he died
column5: ye said: ´No messenger will Allah send after him.´ thus doth Allah leave to stray such as transgress and live in doubt

column1: 40|35|"(Such) as dispute about the Signs of Allah
column2: without any authority that hath reached them
column3: grievous and odious (is such conduct) in the sight of Allah and of the Believers. Thus doth Allah
column4: seal up every heart - of arrogant and obstinate Transgressors."

column1: 40|36|Pharaoh said: "O Haman! Build me a lofty palace
column2: that I may attain the ways and means-

column1: 40|37|"The ways and means of (reaching) the heavens
column2: and that I may mount up to the god of Moses: But as far as I am concerned
column3: I think (Moses) is a liar!" Thus was made alluring
column4: in Pharaoh´s eyes
column5: the evil of his deeds
column6: and he was hindered from the Path; and the plot of Pharaoh led to nothing but perdition (for him).

column1: 40|38|The man who believed said further: "O my people! Follow me: I will lead you to the Path of Right.
40|39|"O my people! This life of the present is nothing but (temporary) convenience: It is the Hereafter that is the Home that will last.

40|40|"He that works evil will not be requited but by the like thereof: and he that works a righteous deed - whether man or woman - and is a Believer- such will enter the Garden (of Bliss): Therein will they have abundance without measure.
40|41|"And O my people! How (strange) it is for me to call you to Salvation while ye call me to the Fire!
40|42|"Ye do call upon me to blaspheme against Allah
column2: and to join with Him partners of whom I have no knowledge; and I call you to the Exalted in Power
column3: Who forgives again and again!"

column1: 40|43|"Without doubt ye do call me to one who is not fit to be called to
column2: whether in this world
column3: or in the Hereafter; our return will be to Allah; and the Transgressors will be Companions of the Fire!

column1: 40|44|"Soon will ye remember what I say to you (now)
column2: My (own) affair I commit to Allah: for Allah (ever) watches over His Servants."

column1: 40|45|Then Allah saved him from (every) ill that they plotted (against him)
column2: but the burnt of the Penalty encompassed on all sides the People of Pharaoh.

column1: 40|46|In front of the Fire will they be brought
column2: morning and evening: And (the sentence will be) on the Day that Judgment will be established: "Cast ye the People of Pharaoh into the severest Penalty!"

column1: 40|47|Behold
column2: they will dispute with each other in the Fire! The weak ones (who followed) will say to those who had been arrogant
column3: "We but followed you: Can ye then take (on yourselves) from us some share of the Fire?

column1: 40|48|Those who had been arrogant will say: "We are all in this (Fire)! Truly
column2: Allah has judged between (his) Servants!"

column1: 40|49|Those in the Fire will say to the Keepers of Hell: "Pray to your Lord to lighten us the Penalty for a day (at least)!"
40|50|They will say: "Did there not come to you your messengers with Clear Signs?" They will say
column2: "Yes". They will reply
column3: "Then pray (as ye like)! But the prayer of those without Faith is nothing but (futile wandering) in (mazes of) error!"

column1: 40|51|We will
column2: without doubt
column3: help our messengers and those who believe
column4: (both) in this world´s life and on the Day when the Witnesses will stand forth

column1: 40|52|The Day when no profit will it be to Wrong-doers to present their excuses
column2: but they will (only) have the Curse and the Home of Misery.

column1: 40|53|We did aforetime give Moses the (Book of) Guidance
column2: and We gave the book in inheritance to the Children of Israel

column1: 40|54|A Guide and a Message to men of Understanding.
40|55|Patiently
column2: then
column3: persevere: for the Promise of Allah is true: and ask forgiveness for thy fault
column4: and celebrate the Praises of thy Lord in the evening and in the morning.

column1: 40|56|Those who dispute about the signs of Allah without any authority bestowed on them
column2: #NAME?
column3: which they shall never attain to: seek refuge
column4: then
column5: in Allah: It is He Who hears and sees (all things).

column1: 40|57|Assuredly the creation of the heavens and the earth is a greater (matter) than the creation of men: Yet most men understand not.
40|58|Not equal are the blind and those who (clearly) see: Nor are (equal) those who believe and work deeds of righteousness
column2: and those who do evil. Little do ye learn by admonition!

column1: 40|59|The Hour will certainly come: Therein is no doubt: Yet most men believe not.
40|60|And your Lord says: "Call on Me; I will answer your (Prayer): but those who are too arrogant to serve Me will surely find themselves in Hell - in humiliation!"
40|61|It is Allah Who has made the Night for you
column2: that ye may rest therein
column3: and the days as that which helps (you) to see. Verily Allah is full of Grace and Bounty to men: yet most men give no thanks.

column1: 40|62|Such is Allah
column2: your Lord
column3: the Creator of all things
column4: there is no god but He: Then how ye are deluded away from the Truth!

column1: 40|63|Thus are deluded those who are wont to reject the Signs of Allah.
40|64|It is Allah Who has made for you the earth as a resting place
column2: and the sky as a canopy
column3: and has given you shape- and made your shapes beautiful
column4: #NAME?
column5: of things pure and good;- such is Allah your Lord. So Glory to Allah
column6: the Lord of the Worlds!

column1: 40|65|He is the Living (One): There is no god but He: Call upon Him
column2: giving Him sincere devotion. Praise be to Allah
column3: Lord of the Worlds!

column1: 40|66|Say: "I have been forbidden to invoke those whom ye invoke besides Allah
column2: - seeing that the Clear Signs have come to me from my Lord; and I have been commanded to bow (in Islam) to the Lord of the Worlds."

column1: 40|67|It is He Who has created you from dust then from a sperm-drop
column2: then from a leech-like clot; then does he get you out (into the light) as a child: then lets you (grow and) reach your age of full strength; then lets you become old
column3: - though of you there are some who die before;- and lets you reach a Term appointed; in order that ye may learn wisdom.

column1: 40|68|It is He Who gives Life and Death; and when He decides upon an affair
column2: He says to it
column3: "Be"
column4: and it is.

column1: 40|69|Seest thou not those that dispute concerning the Signs of Allah? How are they turned away (from Reality)?-
40|70|Those who reject the Book and the (revelations) with which We sent our messengers: but soon shall they know
40|71|When the yokes (shall be) round their necks
column2: and the chains; they shall be dragged along-

column1: 40|72|In the boiling fetid fluid: then in the Fire shall they be burned;
40|73|Then shall it be said to them: "Where are the (deities) to which ye gave part-worship-
40|74|"In derogation of Allah?" They will reply: "They have left us in the lurch: Nay
column2: we invoked not
column3: of old
column4: anything (that had real existence)." Thus does Allah leave the Unbelievers to stray.

column1: 40|75|"That was because ye were wont to rejoice on the earth in things other than the Truth
column2: and that ye were wont to be insolent.

column1: 40|76|"Enter ye the gates of Hell
column2: to dwell therein: and evil is (this) abode of the arrogant!"

column1: 40|77|So persevere in patience; for the Promise of Allah is true: and whether We show thee (in this life) some part of what We promise them
column2: #NAME?
column3: #NAME?

column1: 40|78|We did aforetime send messengers before thee: of them there are some whose story We have related to thee
column2: and some whose story We have not related to thee. It was not (possible) for any messenger to bring a sign except by the leave of Allah: but when the Command of Allah issued
column3: the matter was decided in truth and justice
column4: and there perished
column5: there and then those who stood on Falsehoods.

column1: 40|79|It is Allah Who made cattle for you
column2: that ye may use some for riding and some for food;

column1: 40|80|And there are (other) advantages in them for you (besides); that ye may through them attain to any need (there may be) in your hearts; and on them and on ships ye are carried.
40|81|And He shows you (always) His Signs: then which of the Signs of Allah will ye deny?

40|82|Do they not travel through the earth and see what was the End of those before them? They were more numerous than these and superior in strength and in the traces (they have left) in the land: Yet all that they accomplished was of no profit to them.
40|83|For when their messengers came to them with Clear Signs
column2: they exulted in such knowledge (and skill) as they had; but that very (Wrath) at which they were wont to scoff hemmed them in.

column1: 40|84|But when they saw Our Punishment
column2: they said: "We believe in Allah
column3: - the one Allah - and we reject the partners we used to join with Him."

column1: 40|85|But their professing the Faith when they (actually) saw Our Punishment was not going to profit them. (Such has been) Allah´s Way of dealing with His Servants (from the most ancient times). And even thus did the Rejecters of Allah perish (utterly)!
41|1|Ha Mim:
41|2|A Revelation from (Allah)
column2: Most Gracious
column3: Most Merciful;-

column1: 41|3|A Book
column2: whereof the verses are explained in detail;- a Qur´an in Arabic
column3: for people who understand;-

column1: 41|4|Giving good news and admonition: yet most of them turn away
column2: and so they hear not.

column1: 41|5|They say: "Our hearts are under veils
column2: (concealed) from that to which thou dost invite us
column3: and in our ears in a deafness
column4: and between us and thee is a screen: so do thou (what thou wilt); for us
column5: we shall do (what we will!)"

column1: 41|6|Say thou: "I am but a man like you: It is revealed to me by Inspiration
column2: that your Allah is one Allah: so stand true to Him
column3: and ask for His Forgiveness." And woe to those who join gods with Allah

column1: 41|7|Those who practise not regular Charity
column2: and who even deny the Hereafter.

column1: 41|8|For those who believe and work deeds of righteousness is a reward that will never fail.
41|9|Say: Is it that ye deny Him Who created the earth in two Days? And do ye join equals with Him? He is the Lord of (all) the Worlds.
41|10|He set on the (earth)
column2: mountains standing firm
column3: high above it
column4: and bestowed blessings on the earth
column5: and measure therein all things to give them nourishment in due proportion
column6: in four Days
column7: in accordance with (the needs of) those who seek (Sustenance).

column1: 41|11|Moreover He comprehended in His design the sky
column2: and it had been (as) smoke: He said to it and to the earth: "Come ye together
column3: willingly or unwillingly." They said: "We do come (together)
column4: in willing obedience."

column1: 41|12|So He completed them as seven firmaments in two Days
column2: and He assigned to each heaven its duty and command. And We adorned the lower heaven with lights
column3: and (provided it) with guard. Such is the Decree of (Him) the Exalted in Might
column4: Full of Knowledge.

column1: 41|13|But if they turn away
column2: say thou: "I have warned you of a stunning Punishment (as of thunder and lightning) like that which (overtook) the ´Ad and the Thamud!"

column1: 41|14|Behold
column2: the messengers came to them
column3: from before them and behind them
column4: (preaching): "Serve none but Allah." They said
column5: "If our Lord had so pleased
column6: He would certainly have sent down angels (to preach). Now we reject your mission (altogether)."

column1: 41|15|Now the ´Ad behaved arrogantly through the land
column2: against (all) truth and reason
column3: and said: "Who is superior to us in strength?" What! did they not see that Allah
column4: Who created them
column5: was superior to them in strength? But they continued to reject Our Signs!

column1: 41|16|So We sent against them a furious Wind through days of disaster
column2: that We might give them a taste of a Penalty of humiliation in this life; but the Penalty of a Hereafter will be more humiliating still: and they will find no help.

column1: 41|17|As to the Thamud
column2: We gave them Guidance
column3: but they preferred blindness (of heart) to Guidance: so the stunning Punishment of humiliation seized them
column4: because of what they had earned.

column1: 41|18|But We delivered those who believed and practised righteousness.
41|19|On the Day that the enemies of Allah will be gathered together to the Fire
column2: they will be marched in ranks.

column1: 41|20|At length
column2: when they reach the (Fire)
column3: their hearing
column4: their sight
column5: and their skins will bear witness against them
column6: as to (all) their deeds.

column1: 41|21|They will say to their skins: "Why bear ye witness against us?" They will say: "Allah hath given us speech
column2: #NAME?
column3: and unto Him were ye to return.

column1: 41|22|"Ye did not seek to hide yourselves
column2: lest your hearing
column3: your sight
column4: and your skins should bear witness against you! But ye did think that Allah knew not many of the things that ye used to do!

column1: 41|23|"But this thought of yours which ye did entertain concerning your Lord
column2: hath brought you to destruction
column3: and (now) have ye become of those utterly lost!"

column2: then
column3: they have patience
column4: the Fire will be a home for them! and if they beg to be received into favour
column5: into favour will they not (then) be received.

column1: 41|25|And We have destined for them intimate companions (of like nature)
column2: who made alluring to them what was before them and behind them; and the sentence among the previous generations of Jinns and men
column3: who have passed away
column4: is proved against them; for they are utterly lost.

column1: 41|26|The Unbelievers say: "Listen not to this Qur´an
column2: but talk at random in the midst of its (reading)
column3: that ye may gain the upper hand!"

column1: 41|27|But We will certainly give the Unbelievers a taste of a severe Penalty
column2: and We will requite them for the worst of their deeds.

column1: 41|28|Such is the requital of the enemies of Allah
column2: #NAME?
column3: for that they were wont to reject Our Signs.

column1: 41|29|And the Unbelievers will say: "Our Lord! Show us those
column2: among Jinns and men
column3: who misled us: We shall crush them beneath our feet
column4: so that they become the vilest (before all)."

column1: 41|30|In the case of those who say
column2: "Our Lord is Allah"
column3: and
column4: further
column5: stand straight and steadfast
column6: the angels descend on them (from time to time): "Fear ye not!" (they suggest)
column7: "Nor grieve! but receive the Glad Tidings of the Garden (of Bliss)
column8: the which ye were promised!

column1: 41|31|"We are your protectors in this life and in the Hereafter: therein shall ye have all that your souls shall desire; therein shall ye have all that ye ask for!-
41|32|"A hospitable gift from one Oft-Forgiving
column2: Most Merciful!"

column1: 41|33|Who is better in speech than one who calls (men) to Allah
column2: works righteousness
column3: and says
column4: "I am of those who bow in Islam"?

column1: 41|34|Nor can goodness and Evil be equal. Repel (Evil) with what is better: Then will he between whom and thee was hatred become as it were thy friend and intimate!
41|35|And no one will be granted such goodness except those who exercise patience and self-restraint
column2: #NAME?

column1: 41|36|And if (at any time) an incitement to discord is made to thee by the Evil One
column2: seek refuge in Allah. He is the One Who hears and knows all things.

column1: 41|37|Among His Signs are the Night and the Day
column2: and the Sun and the Moon. Do not prostrate to the sun and the moon
column3: but prostrate to Allah
column4: Who created them
column5: if it is Him ye wish to serve.

column1: 41|38|But is the (Unbelievers) are arrogant
column2: (no matter): for in the presence of thy Lord are those who celebrate His praises by night and by day. And they never flag (nor feel themselves above it).

column1: 41|39|And among His Signs in this: thou seest the earth barren and desolate; but when We send down rain to it
column2: it is stirred to life and yields increase. Truly
column3: He Who gives life to the (dead) earth can surely give life to (men) who are dead. For He has power over all things.

column1: 41|40|Those who pervert the Truth in Our Signs are not hidden from Us. Which is better?- he that is cast into the Fire
column2: or he that comes safe through
column3: on the Day of Judgment? Do what ye will: verily He seeth (clearly) all that ye do.

column1: 41|41|Those who reject the Message when it comes to them (are not hidden from Us). And indeed it is a Book of exalted power.
41|42|No falsehood can approach it from before or behind it: It is sent down by One Full of Wisdom
column2: Worthy of all Praise.

column1: 41|43|Nothing is said to thee that was not said to the messengers before thee: that thy lord has at his Command (all) forgiveness as well as a most Grievous Penalty.
41|44|Had We sent this as a Qur´an (in the language) other than Arabic
column2: they would have said: "Why are not its verses explained in detail? What! (a Book) not in Arabic and (a Messenger an Arab?" Say: "It is a Guide and a Healing to those who believe; and for those who believe not
column3: there is a deafness in their ears
column4: and it is blindness in their (eyes): They are (as it were) being called from a place far distant!"

column1: 41|45|We certainly gave Moses the Book aforetime: but disputes arose therein. Had it not been for a Word that went forth before from thy Lord
column2: (their differences) would have been settled between them: but they remained in suspicious disquieting doubt thereon.

column1: 41|46|Whoever works righteousness benefits his own soul; whoever works evil
column2: it is against his own soul: nor is thy Lord ever unjust (in the least) to His Servants.

column1: 41|47|To Him is referred the Knowledge of the Hour (of Judgment: He knows all): No date-fruit comes out of its sheath
column2: nor does a female conceive (within her womb) nor bring forth the Day that (Allah) will propound to them the (question)
column3: "Where are the partners (ye attributed to Me?" They will say
column4: "We do assure thee not one of us can bear witness!"

column1: 41|48|The (deities) they used to invoke aforetime will leave them in the lurch
column2: and they will perceive that they have no way of escape.

column1: 41|49|Man does not weary of asking for good (things)
column2: but if ill touches him
column3: he gives up all hope (and) is lost in despair.

column1: 41|50|When we give him a taste of some Mercy from Ourselves
column2: after some adversity has touched him
column3: he is sure to say
column4: "This is due to my (merit): I think not that the Hour (of Judgment) will (ever) be established; but if I am brought back to my Lord
column5: I have (much) good (stored) in His sight!" But We will show the Unbelievers the truth of all that they did
column6: and We shall give them the taste of a severe Penalty.

column1: 41|51|When We bestow favours on man
column2: he turns away
column3: and gets himself remote on his side (instead of coming to Us); and when evil seizes him
column4: (he comes) full of prolonged prayer!

column1: 41|52|Say: "See ye if the (Revelation) is (really) from Allah
column2: and yet do ye reject it? Who is more astray than one who is in a schism far (from any purpose)?"

column1: 41|53|Soon will We show them our Signs in the (furthest) regions (of the earth)
column2: and in their own souls
column3: until it becomes manifest to them that this is the Truth. Is it not enough that thy Lord doth witness all things?

column1: 41|54|Ah indeed! Are they in doubt concerning the Meeting with their Lord? Ah indeed! It is He that doth encompass all things!
42|1|Ha-Mim
42|2|´Ain. Sin. Qaf.
42|3|Thus doth (He) send inspiration to thee as (He did) to those before thee
column2: #NAME?
column3: Exalted in Power
column4: Full of Wisdom.

column1: 42|4|To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: and He is Most High
column2: Most Great.

column1: 42|5|The heavens are almost rent asunder from above them (by Him Glory): and the angels celebrate the Praises of their Lord
column2: and pray for forgiveness for (all) beings on earth: Behold! Verily Allah is He
column3: the Oft-Forgiving
column4: Most Merciful.

column1: 42|6|And those who take as protectors others besides Him
column2: - Allah doth watch over them; and thou art not the disposer of their affairs.

column1: 42|7|Thus have We sent by inspiration to thee an Arabic Qur´an: that thou mayest warn the Mother of Cities and all around her
column2: #NAME?
column3: of which there is no doubt: (when) some will be in the Garden
column4: and some in the Blazing Fire.

column1: 42|8|If Allah had so willed
column2: He could have made them a single people; but He admits whom He will to His Mercy; and the Wrong-doers will have no protector nor helper.

column1: 42|9|What! Have they taken (for worship) protectors besides Him? But it is Allah
column2: #NAME?
column3: and it is He Who gives life to the dead: It is He Who has power over all things

column1: 42|10|Whatever it be wherein ye differ
column2: the decision thereof is with Allah: such is Allah my Lord: In Him I trust
column3: and to Him I turn.

column1: 42|11|(He is) the Creator of the heavens and the earth: He has made for you pairs from among yourselves
column2: and pairs among cattle: by this means does He multiply you: there is nothing whatever like unto Him
column3: and He is the One that hears and sees (all things).

column1: 42|12|To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth: He enlarges and restricts. The Sustenance to whom He will: for He knows full well all things.
42|13|The same religion has He established for you as that which He enjoined on Noah - the which We have sent by inspiration to thee - and that which We enjoined on Abraham
column2: Moses
column3: and Jesus: Namely
column4: that ye should remain steadfast in religion
column5: and make no divisions therein: to those who worship other things than Allah
column6: hard is the (way) to which thou callest them. Allah chooses to Himself those whom He pleases
column7: and guides to Himself those who turn (to Him).

column1: 42|14|And they became divided only after Knowledge reached them
column2: #NAME?
column3: (tending) to a Term appointed
column4: the matter would have been settled between them: But truly those who have inherited the Book after them are in suspicious (disquieting) doubt concerning it.

column1: 42|15|Now then
column2: for that (reason)
column3: call (them to the Faith)
column4: and stand steadfast as thou art commanded
column5: nor follow thou their vain desires; but say: "I believe in the Book which Allah has sent down; and I am commanded to judge justly between you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord: for us (is the responsibility for) our deeds
column6: and for you for your deeds. There is no contention between us and you. Allah will bring us together
column7: and to Him is (our) Final Goal.

column1: 42|16|But those who dispute concerning Allah after He has been accepted
column2: #NAME?

column1: 42|17|It is Allah Who has sent down the Book in Truth
column2: and the Balance (by which to weigh conduct). And what will make thee realise that perhaps the Hour is close at hand?

column1: 42|18|Only those wish to hasten it who believe not in it: those who believe hold it in awe
column2: and know that it is the Truth. Behold
column3: verily those that dispute concerning the Hour are far astray.

column1: 42|19|Gracious is Allah to His servants: He gives Sustenance to whom He pleases: and He has power and can carry out His Will.
42|20|To any that desires the tilth of the Hereafter
column2: We give increase in his tilth
column3: and to any that desires the tilth of this world
column4: We grant somewhat thereof
column5: but he has no share or lot in the Hereafter.

column1: 42|21|What! have they partners (in godhead)
column2: who have established for them some religion without the permission of Allah? Had it not been for the Decree of Judgment
column3: the matter would have been decided between them (at once). But verily the Wrong-doers will have a grievous Penalty.

column1: 42|22|Thou wilt see the Wrong-doers in fear on account of what they have earned
column2: and (the burden of) that must (necessarily) fall on them. But those who believe and work righteous deeds will be in the luxuriant meads of the Gardens: they shall have
column3: before their Lord
column4: all that they wish for. That will indeed be the magnificent Bounty (of Allah).

column1: 42|23|That is (the Bounty) whereof Allah gives Glad Tidings to His Servants who believe and do righteous deeds. Say: "No reward do I ask of you for this except the love of those near of kin." And if any one earns any good
column2: We shall give him an increase of good in respect thereof: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving
column3: Most Ready to appreciate (service).

column1: 42|24|What! Do they say
column2: "He has forged a falsehood against Allah"? But if Allah willed
column3: He could seal up thy heart. And Allah blots out Vanity
column4: and proves the Truth by His Words. For He knows well the secrets of all hearts.

column1: 42|25|He is the One that accepts repentance from His Servants and forgives sins: and He knows all that ye do.
42|26|And He listens to those who believe and do deeds of righteousness
column2: and gives them increase of His Bounty: but for the Unbelievers their is a terrible Penalty.

column1: 42|27|If Allah were to enlarge the provision for His Servants
column2: they would indeed transgress beyond all bounds through the earth; but he sends (it) down in due measure as He pleases. For He is with His Servants Well-acquainted
column3: Watchful.

column1: 42|28|He is the One that sends down rain (even) after (men) have given up all hope
column2: and scatters His Mercy (far and wide). And He is the Protector
column3: Worthy of all Praise.

column1: 42|29|And among His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth
column2: and the living creatures that He has scattered through them: and He has power to gather them together when He wills.

column1: 42|30|Whatever misfortune happens to you
column2: is because on the things your hands have wrought
column3: and for many (of them) He grants forgiveness.

column1: 42|31|Nor can ye frustrate (aught)
column2: (fleeing) through the earth; nor have ye
column3: besides Allah
column4: any one to protect or to help.

column1: 42|32|And among His Signs are the ships
column2: smooth-running through the ocean
column3: (tall) as mountains.

column1: 42|33|If it be His Will He can still the Wind: then would they become motionless on the back of the (ocean). Verily in this are Signs for everyone who patiently perseveres and is grateful.
42|34|Or He can cause them to perish because of the (evil) which (the men) have earned; but much doth He forgive.
42|35|But let those know
column2: who dispute about Our Signs
column3: that there is for them no way of escape.

column1: 42|36|Whatever ye are given (here) is (but) a convenience of this life: but that which is with Allah is better and more lasting: (it is) for those who believe and put their trust in their Lord:
42|37|Those who avoid the greater crimes and shameful deeds
column2: and
column3: when they are angry even then forgive;

column1: 42|38|Those who hearken to their Lord
column2: and establish regular Prayer; who (conduct) their affairs by mutual Consultation; who spend out of what We bestow on them for Sustenance;

column1: 42|39|And those who
column2: when an oppressive wrong is inflicted on them
column3: (are not cowed but) help and defend themselves.

column1: 42|40|The recompense for an injury is an injury equal thereto (in degree): but if a person forgives and makes reconciliation
column2: his reward is due from Allah: for (Allah) loveth not those who do wrong.

column1: 42|41|But indeed if any do help and defend themselves after a wrong (done) to them
column2: against such there is no cause of blame.

column1: 42|42|The blame is only against those who oppress men and wrong-doing and insolently transgress beyond bounds through the land
column2: defying right and justice: for such there will be a penalty grievous.

column1: 42|43|But indeed if any show patience and forgive
column2: that would truly be an exercise of courageous will and resolution in the conduct of affairs.

column1: 42|44|For any whom Allah leaves astray
column2: there is no protector thereafter. And thou wilt see the Wrong-doers
column3: when in sight of the Penalty
column4: Say: "Is there any way (to effect) a return?"

column1: 42|45|And thou wilt see them brought forward to the (Penalty)
column2: in a humble frame of mind because of (their) disgrace
column3: (and) looking with a stealthy glance. And the Believers will say: "Those are indeed in loss
column4: who have given to perdition their own selves and those belonging to them on the Day of Judgment. Behold! Truly the Wrong-doers are in a lasting Penalty!"

column1: 42|46|And no protectors have they to help them
column2: other than Allah. And for any whom Allah leaves to stray
column3: there is no way (to the Goal).

column1: 42|47|Hearken ye to your Lord
column2: before there come a Day which there will be no putting back
column3: because of (the Ordainment of) Allah! that Day there will be for you no place of refuge nor will there be for you any room for denial (of your sins)!

column1: 42|48|If then they run away
column2: We have not sent thee as a guard over them. Thy duty is but to convey (the Message). And truly
column3: when We give man a taste of a Mercy from Ourselves
column4: he doth exult thereat
column5: but when some ill happens to him
column6: on account of the deeds which his hands have sent forth
column7: truly then is man ungrateful!

column1: 42|49|To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He creates what He wills (and plans). He bestows (children) male or female according to His Will (and Plan)
42|50|Or He bestows both males and females
column2: and He leaves barren whom He will: for He is full of Knowledge and Power.

column1: 42|51|It is not fitting for a man that Allah should speak to him except by inspiration
column2: or from behind a veil
column3: or by the sending of a messenger to reveal
column4: with Allah´s permission
column5: what Allah wills: for He is Most High
column6: Most Wise.

column1: 42|52|And thus have We
column2: by Our Command
column3: sent inspiration to thee: thou knewest not (before) what was Revelation
column4: and what was Faith; but We have made the (Qur´an) a Light
column5: wherewith We guide such of Our servants as We will; and verily thou dost guide (men) to the Straight Way

column1: 42|53|The Way of Allah
column2: to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on earth. Behold (how) all affairs tend towards Allah!

column1: 43|1|Ha-Mim
43|2|By the Book that makes things clear
43|3|We have made it a Qur´an in Arabic
column2: that ye may be able to understand (and learn wisdom).

column1: 43|4|And verily
column2: it is in the Mother of the Book
column3: in Our Presence
column4: high (in dignity)
column5: full of wisdom.

column1: 43|5|Shall We then take away the Message from you and repel (you)
column2: for that ye are a people transgressing beyond bounds?

column1: 43|6|But how many were the prophets We sent amongst the peoples of old?
43|7|And never came there a prophet to them but they mocked him.
43|8|So We destroyed (them)- stronger in power than these;- and (thus) has passed on the Parable of the peoples of old.
43|9|If thou wert to question them
column2: ´Who created the heavens and the earth?´ They would be sure to reply
column3: ´they were created by (Him)
column4: the Exalted in Power
column5: Full of Knowledge´;-

column2: the same that) has made for you the earth (like a carpet) spread out
column3: and has made for you roads (and channels) therein
column4: in order that ye may find guidance (on the way);

column1: 43|11|That sends down (from time to time) rain from the sky in due measure;- and We raise to life therewith a land that is dead; even so will ye be raised (from the dead);-
43|12|That has created pairs in all things
column2: and has made for you ships and cattle on which ye ride

column1: 43|13|In order that ye may sit firm and square on their backs
column2: and when so seated
column3: ye may celebrate the (kind) favour of your Lord
column4: and say
column5: "Glory to Him Who has subjected these to our (use)
column6: for we could never have accomplished this (by ourselves)

column1: 43|14|"And to our Lord
column2: surely
column3: must we turn back!"

column1: 43|15|Yet they attribute to some of His servants a share with Him (in his godhead)! truly is man a blasphemous ingrate avowed!
