43|16|What! has He taken daughters out of what He himself creates
column2: and granted to you sons for choice?

column1: 43|17|When news is brought to one of them of (the birth of) what he sets up as a likeness to (Allah) Most Gracious
column2: his face darkens
column3: and he is filled with inward grief!

column1: 43|18|Is then one brought up among trinkets
column2: and unable to give a clear account in a dispute (to be associated with Allah)?

column1: 43|19|And they make into females angels who themselves serve Allah. Did they witness their creation? Their evidence will be recorded
column2: and they will be called to account!

column1: 43|20|("Ah!") they say
column2: "If it had been the will of (Allah) Most Gracious
column3: we should not have worshipped such (deities)!" Of that they have no knowledge! they do nothing but lie!

column1: 43|21|What! have We given them a Book before this
column2: to which they are holding fast?

column1: 43|22|Nay! they say: "We found our fathers following a certain religion
column2: and we do guide ourselves by their footsteps."

column1: 43|23|Just in the same way
column2: whenever We sent a Warner before thee to any people
column3: the wealthy ones among them said: "We found our fathers following a certain religion
column4: and we will certainly follow in their footsteps."

column1: 43|24|He said: "What! Even if I brought you better guidance than that which ye found your fathers following?" They said: "For us
column2: we deny that ye (prophets) are sent (on a mission at all)."

column1: 43|25|So We exacted retribution from them: now see what was the end of those who rejected (Truth)!
43|26|Behold! Abraham said to his father and his people: "I do indeed clear myself of what ye worship:
43|27|"(I worship) only Him Who made me
column2: and He will certainly guide me."

column1: 43|28|And he left it as a Word to endure among those who came after him
column2: that they may turn back (to Allah).
I have given the good things of this life to these (men) and their fathers
column3: until the Truth has come to them
column4: and a messenger making things clear.

column1: 43|30|But when the Truth came to them
column2: they said: "This is sorcery
column3: and we do reject it."

column1: 43|31|Also
column2: they say: "Why is not this Qur´an sent down to some leading man in either of the two (chief) cities?"

column1: 43|32|Is it they who would portion out the Mercy of thy Lord? It is We Who portion out between them their livelihood in the life of this world: and We raise some of them above others in ranks
column2: so that some may command work from others. But the Mercy of thy Lord is better than the (wealth) which they amass.

column1: 43|33|And were it not that (all) men might become of one (evil) way of life
column2: We would provide
column3: for everyone that blasphemes against (Allah) Most Gracious
column4: silver roofs for their houses and (silver) stair-ways on which to go up

column1: 43|34|And (silver) doors to their houses
column2: and thrones (of silver) on which they could recline

column1: 43|35|And also adornments of gold. But all this were nothing but conveniences of the present life: The Hereafter
column2: in the sight of thy Lord is for the Righteous.

column1: 43|36|If anyone withdraws himself from remembrance of (Allah) Most Gracious
column2: We appoint for him an evil one
column3: to be an intimate companion to him.

column1: 43|37|Such (evil ones) really hinder them from the Path
column2: but they think that they are being guided aright!

column1: 43|38|At length
column2: when (such a one) comes to Us
column3: he says (to his evil companion): "Would that between me and thee were the distance of East and West!" Ah! evil is the companion (indeed)!

column1: 43|39|When ye have done wrong
column2: it will avail you nothing
column3: that Day
column4: that ye shall be partners in Punishment!

column1: 43|40|Canst thou then make the deaf to hear
column2: or give direction to the blind or to such as (wander) in manifest error?

column1: 43|41|Even if We take thee away
column2: We shall be sure to exact retribution from them

column1: 43|42|Or We shall show thee that (accomplished) which We have promised them: for verily We shall prevail over them.
43|43|So hold thou fast to the Revelation sent down to thee; verily thou art on a Straight Way.
43|44|The (Qur´an) is indeed the message
column2: for thee and for thy people; and soon shall ye (all) be brought to account.

column1: 43|45|And question thou our messengers whom We sent before thee; did We appoint any deities other than (Allah) Most Gracious
column2: to be worshipped?

column1: 43|46|We did send Moses aforetime
column2: with Our Signs
column3: to Pharaoh and his Chiefs: He said
column4: "I am a messenger of the Lord of the Worlds."

column1: 43|47|But when he came to them with Our Signs
column2: behold they ridiculed them.

column1: 43|48|We showed them Sign after Sign
column2: each greater than its fellow
column3: and We seized them with Punishment
column4: in order that they might turn (to Us).

column1: 43|49|And they said
column2: "O thou sorcerer! Invoke thy Lord for us according to His covenant with thee; for we shall truly accept guidance."

column1: 43|50|But when We removed the Penalty from them
column2: behold
column3: they broke their word.

column1: 43|51|And Pharaoh proclaimed among his people
column2: saying: "O my people! Does not the dominion of Egypt belong to me
column3: (witness) these streams flowing underneath my (palace)? What! see ye not then?

column1: 43|52|"Am I not better than this (Moses)
column2: who is a contemptible wretch and can scarcely express himself clearly?

column1: 43|53|"Then why are not gold bracelets bestowed on him
column2: or (why) come (not) with him angels accompanying him in procession?"

column1: 43|54|Thus did he make fools of his people
column2: and they obeyed him: truly were they a people rebellious (against Allah).

column1: 43|55|When at length they provoked Us
column2: We exacted retribution from them
column3: and We drowned them all.

column1: 43|56|And We made them (a people) of the Past and an Example to later ages.
43|57|When (Jesus) the son of Mary is held up as an example
column2: behold
column3: thy people raise a clamour thereat (in ridicule)!

column1: 43|58|And they say
column2: "Are our gods best
column3: or he?" This they set forth to thee
column4: only by way of disputation: yea
column5: they are a contentious people.

column1: 43|59|He was no more than a servant: We granted Our favour to him
column2: and We made him an example to the Children of Israel.

column1: 43|60|And if it were Our Will
column2: We could make angels from amongst you
column3: succeeding each other on the earth.

column1: 43|61|And (Jesus) shall be a Sign (for the coming of) the Hour (of Judgment): therefore have no doubt about the (Hour)
column2: but follow ye Me: this is a Straight Way.

column1: 43|62|Let not the Evil One hinder you: for he is to you an enemy avowed.
43|63|When Jesus came with Clear Signs
column2: he said: "Now have I come to you with Wisdom
column3: and in order to make clear to you some of the (points) on which ye dispute: therefore fear Allah and obey me.

column1: 43|64|"For Allah
column2: He is my Lord and your Lord: so worship ye Him: this is a Straight Way."

column1: 43|65|But sects from among themselves fell into disagreement: then woe to the wrong-doers
column2: from the Penalty of a Grievous Day!

column1: 43|66|Do they only wait for the Hour - that it should come on them all of a sudden
column2: while they perceive not?

column1: 43|67|Friends on that day will be foes
column2: one to another
column3: #NAME?

column1: 43|68|My devotees! no fear shall be on you that Day
column2: nor shall ye grieve

column1: 43|69|(Being) those who have believed in Our Signs and bowed (their wills to Ours) in Islam.
43|70|Enter ye the Garden
column2: ye and your wives
column3: in (beauty and) rejoicing.

column1: 43|71|To them will be passed round
column2: dishes and goblets of gold: there will be there all that the souls could desire
column3: all that their ayes could delight in: and ye shall abide therein (for eye).

column1: 43|72|Such will be the Garden of which ye are made heirs for your (good) deeds (in life).
43|73|Ye shall have therein abundance of fruit
column2: from which ye shall have satisfaction.

column1: 43|74|The sinners will be in the Punishment of Hell
column2: to dwell therein (for aye):

column1: 43|75|Nowise will the (Punishment) be lightened for them
column2: and in despair will they be there overwhelmed.

column1: 43|76|Nowise shall We be unjust to them: but it is they who have been unjust themselves.
43|77|They will cry: "O Malik! would that thy Lord put an end to us!" He will say
column2: "Nay
column3: but ye shall abide!"

column1: 43|78|Verily We have brought the Truth to you: but most of you have a hatred for Truth.
43|79|What! have they settled some plan (among themselves)? But it is We Who settle things.
43|80|Or do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private counsels? Indeed (We do)
column2: and Our messengers are by them
column3: to record.

column1: 43|81|Say: "If (Allah) Most Gracious had a son
column2: I would be the first to worship."

column1: 43|82|Glory to the Lord of the heavens and the earth
column2: the Lord of the Throne (of Authority)! (He is free) from the things they attribute (to him)!

column1: 43|83|So leave them to babble and play (with vanities) until they meet that Day of theirs
column2: which they have been promised.

column1: 43|84|It is He Who is Allah in heaven and Allah on earth; and He is full of Wisdom and Knowledge.
43|85|And blessed is He to Whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth
column2: and all between them: with Him is the Knowledge of the Hour (of Judgment): and to Him shall ye be brought back.

column1: 43|86|And those whom they invoke besides Allah have no power of intercession;- only he who bears witness to the Truth
column2: and they know (him).

column1: 43|87|If thou ask them
column2: who created them
column3: they will certainly say
column4: Allah: How then are they deluded away (from the Truth)?

column1: 43|88|(Allah has knowledge) of the (Prophet´s) cry
column2: "O my Lord! Truly these are people who will not believe!"

column1: 43|89|But turn away from them
column2: and say "Peace!" But soon shall they know!

column1: 44|1|Ha-Mim.
44|2|By the Book that makes things clear;-
44|3|We sent it down during a Blessed Night: for We (ever) wish to warn (against Evil).
44|4|In the (Night) is made distinct every affair of wisdom
44|5|By command
column2: from Our Presence. For We (ever) send (revelations)

column1: 44|6|As Mercy from thy Lord: for He hears and knows (all things);
44|7|The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all between them
column2: if ye (but) have an assured faith.

column1: 44|8|There is no god but He: It is He Who gives life and gives death
column2: #NAME?

column1: 44|9|Yet they play about in doubt.
44|10|Then watch thou for the Day that the sky will bring forth a kind of smoke (or mist) plainly visible
44|11|Enveloping the people: this will be a Penalty Grievous.
44|12|(They will say:) "Our Lord! remove the Penalty from us
column2: for we do really believe!"

column1: 44|13|How shall the message be (effectual) for them
column2: seeing that an Messenger explaining things clearly has (already) come to them

column1: 44|14|Yet they turn away from him and say: "Tutored (by others)
column2: a man possessed!"

column1: 44|15|We shall indeed remove the Penalty for a while
column2: (but) truly ye will revert (to your ways).

column1: 44|16|One day We shall seize you with a mighty onslaught: We will indeed (then) exact Retribution!
44|17|We did
column2: before them
column3: try the people of Pharaoh: there came to them a messenger most honourable

column1: 44|18|Saying: "Restore to me the Servants of Allah: I am to you an messenger worthy of all trust;
44|19|"And be not arrogant as against Allah: for I come to you with authority manifest.
44|20|"For me
column2: I have sought safety with my Lord and your Lord
column3: against your injuring me.

column1: 44|21|"If ye believe me not
column2: at least keep yourselves away from me."

column1: 44|22|(But they were aggressive:) then he cried to his Lord: "These are indeed a people given to sin."
44|23|(The reply came:) "March forth with My Servants by night: for ye are sure to be pursued.
44|24|"And leave the sea as a furrow (divided): for they are a host (destined) to be drowned."
44|25|How many were the gardens and springs they left behind
44|26|And corn-fields and noble buildings
44|27|And wealth (and conveniences of life)
column2: wherein they had taken such delight!

column1: 44|28|Thus (was their end)! And We made other people inherit (those things)!
44|29|And neither heaven nor earth shed a tear over them: nor were they given a respite (again).
44|30|We did deliver aforetime the Children of Israel from humiliating Punishment
44|31|Inflicted by Pharaoh
column2: for he was arrogant (even) among inordinate transgressors.

column1: 44|32|And We chose them aforetime above the nations
column2: knowingly

column1: 44|33|And granted them Signs in which there was a manifest trial
44|34|As to these (Quraish)
column2: they say forsooth:

column1: 44|35|"There is nothing beyond our first death
column2: and we shall not be raised again.

column1: 44|36|"Then bring (back) our forefathers
column2: if what ye say is true!"

column1: 44|37|What! Are they better than the people of Tubba and those who were before them? We destroyed them because they were guilty of sin.
44|38|We created not the heavens
column2: the earth
column3: and all between them
column4: merely in (idle) sport:

column1: 44|39|We created them not except for just ends: but most of them do not understand.
44|40|Verily the Day of sorting out is the time appointed for all of them
44|41|The Day when no protector can avail his client in aught
column2: and no help can they receive

column1: 44|42|Except such as receive Allah´s Mercy: for He is Exalted in Might
column2: Most Merciful.

column1: 44|43|Verily the tree of Zaqqum
44|44|Will be the food of the Sinful
44|45|Like molten brass; it will boil in their insides.
44|46|Like the boiling of scalding water.
44|47|(A voice will cry: "Seize ye him and drag him into the midst of the Blazing Fire!
44|48|"Then pour over his head the Penalty of Boiling Water
44|49|"Taste thou (this)! Truly wast thou mighty
column2: full of honour!

column1: 44|50|"Truly this is what ye used to doubt!"
44|51|As to the Righteous (they will be) in a position of Security
44|52|Among Gardens and Springs;
44|53|Dressed in fine silk and in rich brocade
column2: they will face each other;

column1: 44|54|So; and We shall join them to fair women with beautiful
column2: big
column3: and lustrous eyes.

column1: 44|55|There can they call for every kind of fruit in peace and security;
44|56|Nor will they there taste Death
column2: except the first death; and He will preserve them from the Penalty of the Blazing Fire

column1: 44|57|As a Bounty from thy Lord! that will be the supreme achievement!
44|58|Verily
column2: We have made this (Qur´an) easy
column3: in thy tongue
column4: in order that they may give heed.

column1: 44|59|So wait thou and watch; for they (too) are waiting.
45|1|Ha-Mim.
45|2|The revelation of the Book is from Allah the Exalted in Power
column2: Full of Wisdom.

column1: 45|3|Verily in the heavens and the earth
column2: are Signs for those who believe.

column1: 45|4|And in the creation of yourselves and the fact that animals are scattered (through the earth)
column2: are Signs for those of assured Faith.

column1: 45|5|And in the alternation of Night and Day
column2: and the fact that Allah sends down Sustenance from the sky
column3: and revives therewith the earth after its death
column4: and in the change of the winds
column5: #NAME?

column1: 45|6|Such are the Signs of Allah
column2: which We rehearse to thee in Truth; then in what exposition will they believe after (rejecting) Allah and His Signs?

column1: 45|7|Woe to each sinful dealer in Falsehoods:
45|8|He hears the Signs of Allah rehearsed to him
column2: yet is obstinate and lofty
column3: as if he had not heard them: then announce to him a Penalty Grievous!

column1: 45|9|And when he learns something of Our Signs
column2: he takes them in jest: for such there will be a humiliating Penalty.

column1: 45|10|In front of them is Hell: and of no profit to them is anything they may have earned
column2: nor any protectors they may have taken to themselves besides Allah: for them is a tremendous Penalty.

column1: 45|11|This is (true) Guidance and for those who reject the Signs of their Lord
column2: is a grievous Penalty of abomination.

column1: 45|12|It is Allah Who has subjected the sea to you
column2: that ships may sail through it by His command
column3: that ye may seek of his Bounty
column4: and that ye may be grateful.

column1: 45|13|And He has subjected to you
column2: as from Him
column3: all that is in the heavens and on earth: Behold
column4: in that are Signs indeed for those who reflect.

column1: 45|14|Tell those who believe
column2: to forgive those who do not look forward to the Days of Allah: It is for Him to recompense (for good or ill) each People according to what they have earned.

column1: 45|15|If any one does a righteous deed
column2: it ensures to the benefit of his own soul; if he does evil
column3: it works against (his own soul). In the end will ye (all) be brought back to your Lord.

column1: 45|16|We did aforetime grant to the Children of Israel the Book the Power of Command
column2: and Prophethood; We gave them
column3: for Sustenance
column4: things good and pure; and We favoured them above the nations.

column1: 45|17|And We granted them Clear Signs in affairs (of Religion): it was only after knowledge had been granted to them that they fell into schisms
column2: through insolent envy among themselves. Verily thy Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgment as to those matters in which they set up differences.

column1: 45|18|Then We put thee on the (right) Way of Religion: so follow thou that (Way)
column2: and follow not the desires of those who know not.

column1: 45|19|They will be of no use to thee in the sight of Allah: it is only Wrong-doers (that stand as) protectors
column2: one to another: but Allah is the Protector of the Righteous.

column1: 45|20|These are clear evidences to men and a Guidance and Mercy to those of assured Faith.
45|21|What! Do those who seek after evil ways think that We shall hold them equal with those who believe and do righteous deeds
column2: #NAME?

column1: 45|22|Allah created the heavens and the earth for just ends
column2: and in order that each soul may find the recompense of what it has earned
column3: and none of them be wronged.

column1: 45|23|Then seest thou such a one as takes as his god his own vain desire? Allah has
column2: knowing (him as such)
column3: left him astray
column4: and sealed his hearing and his heart (and understanding)
column5: and put a cover on his sight. Who
column6: then
column7: will guide him after Allah (has withdrawn Guidance)? Will ye not then receive admonition?

column1: 45|24|And they say: "What is there but our life in this world? We shall die and we live
column2: and nothing but time can destroy us." But of that they have no knowledge: they merely conjecture:

column1: 45|25|And when Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them their argument is nothing but this: They say
column2: "Bring (back) our forefathers
column3: if what ye say is true!"

column1: 45|26|Say: "It is Allah Who gives you life
column2: then gives you death; then He will gather you together for the Day of Judgment about which there is no doubt": But most men do not understand.

column1: 45|27|To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth
column2: and the Day that the Hour of Judgment is established
column3: - that Day will the dealers in Falsehood perish!

column1: 45|28|And thou wilt see every sect bowing the knee: Every sect will be called to its Record: "This Day shall ye be recompensed for all that ye did!
45|29|"This Our Record speaks about you with truth: For We were wont to put on Record all that ye did."
45|30|Then
column2: as to those who believed and did righteous deeds
column3: their Lord will admit them to His Mercy that will be the achievement for all to see.

column1: 45|31|But as to those who rejected Allah
column2: (to them will be said): "Were not Our Signs rehearsed to you? But ye were arrogant
column3: and were a people given to sin!

column1: 45|32|"And when it was said that the promise of Allah was true
column2: and that the Hour- there was no doubt about its (coming)
column3: ye used to say
column4: ´We know not what is the hour: we only think it is an idea
column5: and we have no firm assurance.´"

column1: 45|33|Then will appear to them the evil (fruits) of what they did
column2: and they will be completely encircled by that which they used to mock at!

column1: 45|34|It will also be said: "This Day We will forget you as ye forgot the meeting of this Day of yours! and your abode is the Fire
column2: and no helpers have ye!
because ye used to take the Signs of Allah in jest
column3: and the life of the world deceived you:" (From) that Day
column4: therefore
column5: they shall not be taken out thence
column6: nor shall they be received into Grace.

column1: 45|36|Then Praise be to Allah
column2: Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth
column3: - Lord and Cherisher of all the Worlds!

column1: 45|37|To Him be glory throughout the heavens and the earth: and He is Exalted in Power
column2: Full of Wisdom!

column1: 46|1|Ha-Mim.
46|2|The Revelation of the Book is from Allah the Exalted in Power
column2: Full of Wisdom.

column1: 46|3|We created not the heavens and the earth and all between them but for just ends
column2: and for a Term Appointed: But those who reject Faith turn away from that whereof they are warned.

column1: 46|4|Say: "Do ye see what it is ye invoke besides Allah? Show me what it is they have created on earth
column2: or have they a share in the heavens bring me a book (revealed) before this
column3: or any remnant of knowledge (ye may have)
column4: if ye are telling the truth!

column1: 46|5|And who is more astray than one who invokes besides Allah
column2: such as will not answer him to the Day of Judgment
column3: and who (in fact) are unconscious of their call (to them)?

column1: 46|6|And when mankind are gathered together (at the Resurrection)
column2: they will be hostile to them and reject their worship (altogether)!

column1: 46|7|When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them
column2: the Unbelievers say
column3: of the Truth when it comes to them: "This is evident sorcery!"

column1: 46|8|Or do they say
column2: "He has forged it"? Say: "Had I forged it
column3: then can ye obtain no single (blessing) for me from Allah. He knows best of that whereof ye talk (so glibly)! Enough is He for a witness between me and you! And he is Oft-Forgiving
column4: Most Merciful."

column1: 46|9|Say: "I am no bringer of new-fangled doctrine among the messengers
column2: nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I follow but that which is revealed to me by inspiration; I am but a Warner open and clear."

column1: 46|10|Say: "See ye? If (this teaching) be from Allah
column2: and ye reject it
column3: and a witness from among the Children of Israel testifies to its similarity (with earlier scripture)
column4: and has believed while ye are arrogant
column5: (how unjust ye are!) truly
column6: Allah guides not a people unjust."

column1: 46|11|The Unbelievers say of those who believe: "If (this Message) were a good thing
column2: (such men) would not have gone to it first
column3: before us!" And seeing that they guide not themselves thereby
column4: they will say
column5: "this is an (old
column6: ) falsehood!"

column1: 46|12|And before this
column2: was the Book of Moses as a guide and a mercy: And this Book confirms (it) in the Arabic tongue; to admonish the unjust
column3: and as Glad Tidings to those who do right.

column1: 46|13|Verily those who say
column2: "Our Lord is Allah
column3:
and remain firm (on that Path),- on them shall be no fear, nor shall they grieve.
46|14|Such shall be Companions of the Gardens, dwelling therein (for aye): a recompense for their (good) deeds.
46|15|We have enjoined on man kindness to his parents: In pain did his mother bear him, and in pain did she give him birth. The carrying of the (child) to his weaning is (a period of) thirty months. At length, when he reaches the age of full strength and attains forty years, he says, O my Lord! Grant me that I may be grateful for Thy favour which Thou has bestowed upon me
column4: and upon both my parents
column5: and that I may work righteousness such as Thou mayest approve; and be gracious to me in my issue. Truly have I turned to Thee and truly do I bow (to Thee) in Islam."

column1: 46|16|Such are they from whom We shall accept the best of their deeds and pass by their ill deeds: (They shall be) among the Companions of the Garden: a promise! of truth
column2: which was made to them (in this life).

column1: 46|17|But (there is one) who says to his parents
column2: "Fie on you! Do ye hold out the promise to me that I shall be raised up
column3: even though generations have passed before me (without rising again)?" And they two seek Allah´s aid
column4: (and rebuke the son): "Woe to thee! Have faith! for the promise of Allah is true." But he says
column5: "This is nothing but tales of the ancients!"

column1: 46|18|Such are they against whom is proved the sentence among the previous generations of Jinns and men
column2: that have passed away; for they will be (utterly) lost.

column1: 46|19|And to all are (assigned) degrees according to the deeds which they (have done)
column2: and in order that (Allah) may recompense their deeds
column3: and no injustice be done to them.

column1: 46|20|And on the Day that the Unbelievers will be placed before the Fire
column2: (It will be said to them): "Ye received your good things in the life of the world
column3: and ye took your pleasure out of them: but today shall ye be recompensed with a Penalty of humiliation: for that ye were arrogant on earth without just cause
column4: and that ye (ever) transgressed."

column1: 46|21|Mention (Hud) one of ´Ad´s (own) brethren: Behold
column2: he warned his people about the winding Sand-tracts: but there have been warners before him and after him: "Worship ye none other than Allah: Truly I fear for you the Penalty of a Mighty Day."

column1: 46|22|They said: "Hast thou come in order to turn us aside from our gods? Then bring upon us the (calamity) with which thou dost threaten us
column2: if thou art telling the truth?"

column1: 46|23|He said: "The Knowledge (of when it will come) is only with Allah: I proclaim to you the mission on which I have been sent: But I see that ye are a people in ignorance!"..
46|24|Then
column2: when they saw the (Penalty in the shape of) a cloud traversing the sky
column3: coming to meet their valleys
column4: they said
column5: "This cloud will give us rain!" "Nay
column6: it is the (Calamity) ye were asking to be hastened!- A wind wherein is a Grievous Penalty!

column1: 46|25|"Everything will it destroy by the command of its Lord!" Then by the morning they - nothing was to be seen but (the ruins of) their houses! thus do We recompense those given to sin!
46|26|And We had firmly established them in a (prosperity and) power which We have not given to you (ye Quraish!) and We had endowed them with (faculties of) hearing
column2: seeing
column3: heart and intellect: but of no profit to them were their (faculties of) hearing
column4: sight
column5: and heart and intellect
column6: when they went on rejecting the Signs of Allah; and they were (completely) encircled by that which they used to mock at!

column1: 46|27|We destroyed aforetime populations round about you; and We have shown the Signs in various ways
column2: that they may turn (to Us).

column1: 46|28|Why then was no help forthcoming to them from those whom they worshipped as gods
column2: besides Allah
column3: as a means of access (to Allah)? Nay
column4: they left them in the lurch: but that was their falsehood and their invention.

column1: 46|29|Behold
column2: We turned towards thee a company of Jinns (quietly) listening to the Qur´an: when they stood in the presence thereof
column3: they said
column4: "Listen in silence!" When the (reading) was finished
column5: they returned to their people
column6: to warn (them of their sins).

column1: 46|30|They said
column2: "O our people! We have heard a Book revealed after Moses
column3: confirming what came before it: it guides (men) to the Truth and to a Straight Path.

column1: 46|31|"O our people
column2: hearken to the one who invites (you) to Allah
column3: and believe in him: He will forgive you your faults
column4: and deliver you from a Penalty Grievous.

column1: 46|32|"If any does not hearken to the one who invites (us) to Allah
column2: he cannot frustrate (Allah´s Plan) on earth
column3: and no protectors can he have besides Allah: such men (wander) in manifest error."

column1: 46|33|See they not that Allah
column2: Who created the heavens and the earth
column3: and never wearied with their creation
column4: is able to give life to the dead? Yea
column5: verily He has power over all things.

column1: 46|34|And on the Day that the Unbelievers will be placed before the Fire
column2: (they will be asked
column3: ) "Is this not the Truth?" they will say
column4: "Yea
column5: by our Lord!" (One will say:) "Then taste ye the Penalty
column6: for that ye were wont to deny (Truth)!"

column1: 46|35|Therefore patiently persevere
column2: as did (all) messengers of inflexible purpose; and be in no haste about the (Unbelievers). On the Day that they see the (Punishment) promised them
column3: (it will be) as if they had not tarried more than an hour in a single day. (Thine but) to proclaim the Message: but shall any be destroyed except those who transgress?

column1: 47|1|Those who reject Allah and hinder (men) from the Path of Allah
column2: - their deeds will Allah render astray (from their mark).

column1: 47|2|But those who believe and work deeds of righteousness
column2: and believe in the (Revelation) sent down to Muhammad - for it is the Truth from their Lord
column3: #NAME?

column1: 47|3|This because those who reject Allah follow vanities
column2: while those who believe follow the Truth from their Lord: Thus does Allah set forth for men their lessons by similitudes.

column1: 47|4|Therefore
column2: when ye meet the Unbelievers (in fight)
column3: smite at their necks; At length
column4: when ye have thoroughly subdued them
column5: bind a bond firmly (on them): thereafter (is the time for) either generosity or ransom: Until the war lays down its burdens. Thus (are ye commanded): but if it had been Allah´s Will
column6: He could certainly have exacted retribution from them (Himself); but (He lets you fight) in order to test you
column7: some with others. But those who are slain in the Way of Allah
column8: #NAME?

column1: 47|5|Soon will He guide them and improve their condition
47|6|And admit them to the Garden which He has announced for them.
47|7|O ye who believe! If ye will aid (the cause of) Allah
column2: He will aid you
column3: and plant your feet firmly.

column1: 47|8|But those who reject (Allah)
column2: #NAME?
column3: and (Allah) will render their deeds astray (from their mark).

column1: 47|9|That is because they hate the Revelation of Allah; so He has made their deeds fruitless.
47|10|Do they not travel through the earth
column2: and see what was the End of those before them (who did evil)? Allah brought utter destruction on them
column3: and similar (fates await) those who reject Allah.

column1: 47|11|That is because Allah is the Protector of those who believe
column2: but those who reject Allah have no protector.

column1: 47|12|Verily Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds
column2: to Gardens beneath which rivers flow; while those who reject Allah will enjoy (this world) and eat as cattle eat; and the Fire will be their abode.

column1: 47|13|And how many cities
column2: with more power than thy city which has driven thee out
column3: have We destroyed (for their sins)? and there was none to aid them.

column1: 47|14|Is then one who is on a clear (Path) from his Lord
column2: no better than one to whom the evil of his conduct seems pleasing
column3: and such as follow their own lusts?

column1: 47|15|(Here is) a Parable of the Garden which the righteous are promised: in it are rivers of water incorruptible; rivers of milk of which the taste never changes; rivers of wine
column2: a joy to those who drink; and rivers of honey pure and clear. In it there are for them all kinds of fruits; and Grace from their Lord. (Can those in such Bliss) be compared to such as shall dwell for ever in the Fire
column3: and be given
column4: to drink
column5: boiling water
column6: so that it cuts up their bowels (to pieces)?

column1: 47|16|And among them are men who listen to thee
column2: but in the end
column3: when they go out from thee
column4: they say to those who have received Knowledge
column5: "What is it he said just then?" Such are men whose hearts Allah has sealed
column6: and who follow their own lusts.

column1: 47|17|But to those who receive Guidance
column2: He increases the (light of) Guidance
column3: and bestows on them their Piety and Restraint (from evil).

column1: 47|18|Do they then only wait for the Hour
column2: #NAME?
column3: and when it (actually) is on them
column4: how can they benefit then by their admonition?

column1: 47|19|Know
column2: therefore
column3: that there is no god but Allah
column4: and ask forgiveness for thy fault
column5: and for the men and women who believe: for Allah knows how ye move about and how ye dwell in your homes.

column1: 47|20|Those who believe say
column2: "Why is not a sura sent down (for us)?" But when a sura of basic or categorical meaning is revealed
column3: and fighting is mentioned therein
column4: thou wilt see those in whose hearts is a disease looking at thee with a look of one in swoon at the approach of death. But more fitting for them-

column1: 47|21|Were it to obey and say what is just
column2: and when a matter is resolved on
column3: it were best for them if they were true to Allah.

column1: 47|22|Then
column2: is it to be expected of you
column3: if ye were put in authority
column4: that ye will do mischief in the land
column5: and break your ties of kith and kin?

column1: 47|23|Such are the men whom Allah has cursed for He has made them deaf and blinded their sight.
47|24|Do they not then earnestly seek to understand the Qur´an
column2: or are their hearts locked up by them?

column1: 47|25|Those who turn back as apostates after Guidance was clearly shown to them
column2: - the Evil One has instigated them and busied them up with false hopes.

column1: 47|26|This
column2: because they said to those who hate what Allah has revealed
column3: "We will obey you in part of (this) matter"; but Allah knows their (inner) secrets.

column1: 47|27|But how (will it be) when the angels take their souls at death
column2: and smite their faces and their backs?

column1: 47|28|This because they followed that which called forth the Wrath of Allah
column2: and they hated Allah´s good pleasure; so He made their deeds of no effect.

column1: 47|29|Or do those in whose hearts is a disease
column2: think that Allah will not bring to light all their rancour?

column1: 47|30|Had We so wiled
column2: We could have shown them up to thee
column3: and thou shouldst have known them by their marks: but surely thou wilt know them by the tone of their speech! And Allah knows all that ye do.

column1: 47|31|And We shall try you until We test those among you who strive their utmost and persevere in patience; and We shall try your reported (mettle).
47|32|Those who reject Allah
column2: hinder (men) from the Path of Allah
column3: and resist the Messenger
column4: after Guidance has been clearly shown to them
column5: will not injure Allah in the least
column6: but He will make their deeds of no effect.

column1: 47|33|O ye who believe! Obey Allah
column2: and obey the messenger
column3: and make not vain your deeds!

column1: 47|34|Those who reject Allah
column2: and hinder (men) from the Path of Allah
column3: then die rejecting Allah
column4: #NAME?

column1: 47|35|Be not weary and faint-hearted
column2: crying for peace
column3: when ye should be uppermost: for Allah is with you
column4: and will never put you in loss for your (good) deeds.

column1: 47|36|The life of this world is but play and amusement: and if ye believe and guard against Evil
column2: He will grant you your recompense
column3: and will not ask you (to give up) your possessions.

column1: 47|37|If He were to ask you for all of them
column2: and press you
column3: ye would covetously withhold
column4: and He would bring out all your ill-feeling.

column1: 47|38|Behold
column2: ye are those invited to spend (of your substance) in the Way of Allah: But among you are some that are niggardly. But any who are niggardly are so at the expense of their own souls. But Allah is free of all wants
column3: and it is ye that are needy. If ye turn back (from the Path)
column4: He will substitute in your stead another people; then they would not be like you!

column1: 48|1|Verily We have granted thee a manifest Victory:
48|2|That Allah may forgive thee thy faults of the past and those to follow; fulfil His favour to thee; and guide thee on the Straight Way;
48|3|And that Allah may help thee with powerful help.
48|4|It is He Who sent down tranquillity into the hearts of the Believers
column2: that they may add faith to their faith;- for to Allah belong the Forces of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is Full of Knowledge and Wisdom;-

column1: 48|5|That He may admit the men and women who believe
column2: to Gardens beneath which rivers flow
column3: to dwell therein for aye
column4: and remove their ills from them;- and that is
column5: in the sight of Allah
column6: the highest achievement (for man)

column1: 48|6|And that He may punish the Hypocrites
column2: men and women
column3: and the Polytheists men and women
column4: who imagine an evil opinion of Allah. On them is a round of Evil: the Wrath of Allah is on them: He has cursed them and got Hell ready for them: and evil is it for a destination.

column1: 48|7|For to Allah belong the Forces of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is Exalted in Power
column2: Full of Wisdom.

column1: 48|8|We have truly sent thee as a witness
column2: as a bringer of Glad Tidings
column3: and as a Warner:

column1: 48|9|In order that ye (O men) may believe in Allah and His Messenger
column2: that ye may assist and honour Him
column3: and celebrate His praise morning and evening.

column1: 48|10|Verily those who plight their fealty to thee do no less than plight their fealty to Allah: the Hand of Allah is over their hands: then any one who violates his oath
column2: does so to the harm of his own soul
column3: and any one who fulfils what he has covenanted with Allah
column4: #NAME?

column1: 48|11|The desert Arabs who lagged behind will say to thee: "We were engaged in (looking after) our flocks and herds
column2: and our families: do thou then ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say: "Who then has any power at all (to intervene) on your behalf with Allah
column3: if His Will is to give you some loss or to give you some profit? But Allah is well acquainted with all that ye do.

column2: ye thought that the Messenger and the Believers would never return to their families; this seemed pleasing in your hearts
column3: and ye conceived an evil thought
column4: for ye are a people lost (in wickedness)."

column1: 48|13|And if any believe not in Allah and His Messenger
column2: We have prepared
column3: for those who reject Allah
column4: a Blazing Fire!

column1: 48|14|To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: He forgives whom He wills
column2: and He punishes whom He wills: but Allah is Oft-Forgiving
column3: Most Merciful.

column1: 48|15|Those who lagged behind (will say)
column2: when ye (are free to) march and take booty (in war): "Permit us to follow you." They wish to change Allah´s decree: Say: "Not thus will ye follow us: Allah has already declared (this) beforehand": then they will say
column3: "But ye are jealous of us." Nay
column4: but little do they understand (such things).

column2: if Allah wills
column3: with minds secure
column4: heads shaved
column5: hair cut short
column6: and without fear. For He knew what ye knew not
column7: and He granted
column8: besides this

column1: 48|28|It is He Who has sent His Messenger with Guidance and the Religion of Truth

column1: 48|29|Muhammad is the messenger of Allah; and those who are with him are strong against Unbelievers
column2: (but) compassionate amongst each other. Thou wilt see them bow and prostrate themselves (in prayer)
column3: seeking Grace from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure. On their faces are their marks
column4: (being) the traces of their prostration. This is their similitude in the Taurat; and their similitude in the Gospel is: like a seed which sends forth its blade
column5: then makes it strong; it then becomes thick
column6: and it stands on its own stem
column7: (filling) the sowers with wonder and delight. As a result
column8: it fills the Unbelievers with rage at them. Allah has promised those among them who believe and do righteous deeds forgiveness

column1: 49|1|O Ye who believe! Put not yourselves forward before Allah and His Messenger; but fear Allah: for Allah is He Who hears and knows all things.

column2: nor speak aloud to him in talk
column3: as ye may speak aloud to one another

column1: 49|3|Those that lower their voices in the presence of Allah´s Messenger
column2: #NAME?

column1: 49|4|Those who shout out to thee from without the inner apartments - most of them lack understanding.
49|5|If only they had patience until thou couldst come out to them
column2: it would be best for them: but Allah is Oft-Forgiving
column3: Most Merciful.

column1: 49|6|O ye who believe! If a wicked person comes to you with any news
column2: ascertain the truth
column3: lest ye harm people unwittingly
column4: and afterwards become full of repentance for what ye have done.

column1: 49|7|And know that among you is Allah´s Messenger: were he
column2: in many matters
column3: to follow your (wishes)
column4: ye would certainly fall into misfortune: But Allah has endeared the Faith to you
column5: and has made it beautiful in your hearts
column6: and He has made hateful to you Unbelief
column7: wickedness
column8: and rebellion: such indeed are those who walk in righteousness;-

column1: 49|8|A Grace and Favour from Allah; and Allah is full of Knowledge and Wisdom.
49|9|If two parties among the Believers fall into a quarrel
column2: make ye peace between them: but if one of them transgresses beyond bounds against the other
column3: then fight ye (all) against the one that transgresses until it complies with the command of Allah; but if it complies
column4: then make peace between them with justice
column5: and be fair: for Allah loves those who are fair (and just).

column2: that ye may receive Mercy.

column1: 49|11|O ye who believe! Let not some men among you laugh at others: It may be that the (latter) are better than the (former): Nor let some women laugh at others: It may be that the (latter are better than the (former): Nor defame nor be sarcastic to each other
column2: nor call each other by (offensive) nicknames: Ill-seeming is a name connoting wickedness
column3: (to be used of one) after he has believed: And those who do not desist are (indeed) doing wrong.

column1: 49|12|O ye who believe! Avoid suspicion as much (as possible): for suspicion in some cases is a sin: And spy not on each other behind their backs. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? Nay
column2: ye would abhor it...But fear Allah: For Allah is Oft-Returning
column3: Most Merciful.

column1: 49|13|O mankind! We created you from a single (pair) of a male and a female
column2: and made you into nations and tribes
column3: that ye may know each other (not that ye may despise (each other). Verily the most honoured of you in the sight of Allah is (he who is) the most righteous of you. And Allah has full knowledge and is well acquainted (with all things).

column1: 49|14|The desert Arabs say
column2: "We believe." Say
column3: "Ye have no faith; but ye (only)say
column4: ´We have submitted our wills to Allah
column5: ´ For not yet has Faith entered your hearts. But if ye obey Allah and His Messenger
column6: He will not belittle aught of your deeds: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving
column7: Most Merciful."

column1: 49|15|Only those are Believers who have believed in Allah and His Messenger

column3: but have striven with their belongings and their persons in the Cause of Allah: Such are the sincere ones.

column1: 49|18|"Verily Allah knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth: and Allah Sees well all that ye do."
50|1|Qaf: By the Glorious Qur´an (Thou art Allah´s Messenger).

column2: and set thereon mountains standing firm
column3: and produced therein every kind of beautiful growth (in pairs)-

column1: 50|8|To be observed and commemorated by every devotee turning (to Allah).

column1: 50|10|And tall (and stately) palm-trees

column3: piled one over another;-

column3: the brethren of Lut

column3: cast doubts and suspicions;

column3: who kept (His Law)

column3: with patience
column4: all that they say

column3: "Fear not
column4:
and they gave him glad tidings of a son endowed with knowledge.

then
column3: to the Unbelievers

column1: 52|1|By the Mount (of Revelation);

column1: 52|28|"Truly

column4: the Merciful!"

to Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: so that He rewards those who do evil
column3: according to their deeds
column4: and He rewards those who do good
column5: with what is best.

column1: 53|32|Those who avoid great sins and shameful deeds
column2: only (falling into) small faults
column3: #NAME?
column4: And when ye are hidden in your mothers´ wombs. Therefore justify not yourselves: He knows best who it is that guards against evil.

column1: 53|33|Seest thou one who turns back
53|34|Gives a little
column2: then hardens (his heart)?

column1: 53|35|What! Has he knowledge of the Unseen so that he can see?

column2: is he not acquainted with what is in the Books of Moses-

column1: 53|37|And of Abraham who fulfilled his engagements?-
53|38|Namely
column2: that no bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another;

column1: 53|39|That man can have nothing but what he strives for;
53|40|That (the fruit of) his striving will soon come in sight:
53|41|Then will he be rewarded with a reward complete;
53|42|That to thy Lord is the final Goal;
53|43|That it is He Who granteth Laughter and Tears;
53|44|That it is He Who granteth Death and Life;
53|45|That He did create in pairs
column2: #NAME?

column1: 53|46|From a seed when lodged (in its place);
53|47|That He hath promised a Second Creation (Raising of the Dead);
53|48|That it is He Who giveth wealth and satisfaction;
53|49|That He is the Lord of Sirius (the Mighty Star);
53|50|And that it is He Who destroyed the (powerful) ancient ´Ad (people)
53|51|And the Thamud nor gave them a lease of perpetual life.
53|52|And before them
column2: the people of Noah
column3: for that they were (all) most unjust and most insolent transgressors

column1: 53|53|And He destroyed the Overthrown Cities (of Sodom and Gomorrah).
53|54|So that (ruins unknown) have covered them up.
53|55|Then which of the gifts of thy Lord
column2: (O man
column3: ) wilt thou dispute about?

column1: 53|56|This is a Warner
column2: of the (series of) Warners of old!

column1: 53|57|The (Judgment) ever approaching draws nigh:
53|58|No (soul) but Allah can lay it bare.
53|59|Do ye then wonder at this recital?
53|60|And will ye laugh and not weep
53|61|Wasting your time in vanities?
53|62|But fall ye down in prostration to Allah
column2: and adore (Him)!

column1: 54|1|The Hour (of Judgment) is nigh
column2: and the moon is cleft asunder.

column1: 54|2|But if they see a Sign
column2: they turn away
column3: and say
column4: "This is (but) transient magic."

column1: 54|3|They reject (the warning) and follow their (own) lusts but every matter has its appointed time.
54|4|There have already come to them Recitals wherein there is (enough) to check (them)
54|5|Mature wisdom;- but (the preaching of) Warners profits them not.
54|6|Therefore
column2: (O Prophet
column3: ) turn away from them. The Day that the Caller will call (them) to a terrible affair

column1: 54|7|They will come forth
column2: #NAME?
column3: (torpid) like locusts scattered abroad

column1: 54|8|Hastening
column2: with eyes transfixed
column3: towards the Caller!- "Hard is this Day!"
column4: the Unbelievers will say.

column1: 54|9|Before them the People of Noah rejected (their messenger): they rejected Our servant
column2: and said
column3: "Here is one possessed!"
column4: and he was driven out.

column1: 54|10|Then he called on his Lord: "I am one overcome: do Thou then help (me)!"
54|11|So We opened the gates of heaven
column2: with water pouring forth.

column1: 54|12|And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs
column2: so the waters met (and rose) to the extent decreed.

column1: 54|13|But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:
54|14|She floats under our eyes (and care): a recompense to one who had been rejected (with scorn)!
54|15|And We have left this as a Sign (for all time): then is there any that will receive admonition?
54|16|But how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning?
54|17|And We have indeed made the Qur´an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
54|18|The ´Ad (people) (too) rejected (Truth): then how terrible was My Penalty and My Warning?
54|19|For We sent against them a furious wind
column2: on a Day of violent Disaster

column1: 54|20|Plucking out men as if they were roots of palm-trees torn up (from the ground).

column2: how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!

column1: 54|22|But We have indeed made the Qur´an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
54|23|The Thamud (also) rejected (their) Warners.
54|24|For they said: "What! a man! a Solitary one from among ourselves! shall we follow such a one? Truly should we then be straying in mind
column2: and mad!

column1: 54|25|"Is it that the Message is sent to him
column2: of all people amongst us? Nay
column3: he is a liar
column4: an insolent one!"

column1: 54|26|Ah! they will know on the morrow
column2: which is the liar
column3: the insolent one!

column1: 54|27|For We will send the she-camel by way of trial for them. So watch them
column2: (O Salih)
column3: and possess thyself in patience!

column1: 54|28|And tell them that the water is to be divided between them: Each one´s right to drink being brought forward (by suitable turns).
54|29|But they called to their companion
column2: and he took a sword in hand
column3: and hamstrung (her).

column1: 54|30|Ah! how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!
54|31|For We sent against them a single Mighty Blast
column2: and they became like the dry stubble used by one who pens cattle.

column1: 54|32|And We have indeed made the Qur´an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
54|33|The people of Lut rejected (his) warning.
54|34|We sent against them a violent Tornado with showers of stones
column2: (which destroyed them)
column3: except Lut´s household: them We delivered by early Dawn

column1: 54|35|As a Grace from Us: thus do We reward those who give thanks.
54|36|And (Lut) did warn them of Our Punishment
column2: but they disputed about the Warning.

column1: 54|37|And they even sought to snatch away his guests from him
column2: but We blinded their eyes. (They heard:) "Now taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."

column1: 54|38|Early on the morrow an abiding Punishment seized them:
54|39|"So taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."
54|40|And We have indeed made the Qur´an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
54|41|To the People of Pharaoh
column2: too
column3: aforetime
column4: came Warners (from Allah).

column1: 54|42|The (people) rejected all Our Signs; but We seized them with such Penalty (as comes) from One Exalted in Power
column2: able to carry out His Will.

column1: 54|43|Are your Unbelievers
column2: (O Quraish)
column3: better than they? Or have ye an immunity in the Sacred Books?

column1: 54|44|Or do they say: "We acting together can defend ourselves"?
54|45|Soon will their multitude be put to flight
column2: and they will show their backs.
the Hour (of Judgment) is the time promised them (for their full recompense): And that Hour will be most grievous and most bitter.

column1: 54|47|Truly those in sin are the ones straying in mind
column2: and mad.

column1: 54|48|The Day they will be dragged through the Fire on their faces
column2: (they will hear:) "Taste ye the touch of Hell!"

column1: 54|49|Verily
column2: all things have We created in proportion and measure.

column1: 54|50|And Our Command is but a single (Act)
column2: #NAME?

column1: 54|51|And (oft) in the past
column2: have We destroyed gangs like unto you: then is there any that will receive admonition?

column1: 54|52|All that they do is noted in (their) Books (of Deeds):
54|53|Every matter
column2: small and great
column3: is on record.

column1: 54|54|As to the Righteous
column2: they will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers

column1: 54|55|In an Assembly of Truth
column2: in the Presence of a Sovereign Omnipotent.

column1: 55|1|(Allah) Most Gracious!
55|2|It is He Who has taught the Qur´an.
55|3|He has created man:
55|4|He has taught him speech (and intelligence).
55|5|The sun and the moon follow courses (exactly) computed;
55|6|And the herbs and the trees - both (alike) prostrate in adoration.
55|7|And the Firmament has He raised high
column2: and He has set up the Balance (of Justice)

column1: 55|8|In order that ye may not transgress (due) balance.
55|9|So establish weight with justice and fall not short in the balance.
55|10|It is He Who has spread out the earth for (His) creatures:
55|11|Therein is fruit and date-palms
column2: producing spathes (enclosing dates);

column1: 55|12|Also corn
column2: with (its) leaves and stalk for fodder
column3: and sweet-smelling plants.

column1: 55|13|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|14|He created man from sounding clay like unto pottery
55|15|And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:
55|16|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|17|(He is) Lord of the two Easts and Lord of the two Wests:
55|18|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|19|He has let free the two bodies of flowing water
column2: meeting together:

column1: 55|20|Between them is a Barrier which they do not transgress:
55|21|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|22|Out of them come Pearls and Coral:
55|23|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|24|And His are the Ships sailing smoothly through the seas
column2: lofty as mountains:

column1: 55|25|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|26|All that is on earth will perish:
55|27|But will abide (for ever) the Face of thy Lord
column2: #NAME?
column3: Bounty and Honour.

column1: 55|28|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|29|Of Him seeks (its need) every creature in the heavens and on earth: every day in (new) Splendour doth He (shine)!
55|30|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|31|Soon shall We settle your affairs
column2: O both ye worlds!

column1: 55|32|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|33|O ye assembly of Jinns and men! If it be ye can pass beyond the zones of the heavens and the earth
column2: pass ye! not without authority shall ye be able to pass!

column1: 55|34|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|35|On you will be sent (O ye evil ones twain!) a flame of fire (to burn) and a smoke (to choke): no defence will ye have:
55|36|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|37|When the sky is rent asunder
column2: and it becomes red like ointment:

column1: 55|38|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|39|On that Day no question will be asked of man or Jinn as to his sin.
55|40|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|41|(For) the sinners will be known by their marks: and they will be seized by their forelocks and their feet.
55|42|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|43|This is the Hell which the Sinners deny:
55|44|In its midst and in the midst of boiling hot water will they wander round!
55|45|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|46|But for such as fear the time when they will stand before (the Judgment Seat of) their Lord
column2: there will be two Gardens-

column1: 55|47|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
55|48|Containing all kinds (of trees and delights);-
55|49|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
55|50|In them (each) will be two Springs flowing (free);
55|51|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
55|52|In them will be Fruits of every kind
column2: two and two.

column1: 55|53|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|54|They will recline on Carpets
column2: whose inner linings will be of rich brocade: the Fruit of the Gardens will be near (and easy of reach).

column1: 55|55|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|56|In them will be (Maidens)
column2: chaste
column3: restraining their glances
column4: whom no man or Jinn before them has touched;-

column1: 55|57|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
55|58|Like unto Rubies and coral.
55|59|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|60|Is there any Reward for Good - other than Good?
55|61|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|62|And besides these two
column2: there are two other Gardens

column1: 55|63|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
55|64|Dark-green in colour (from plentiful watering).
55|65|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|66|In them (each) will be two Springs pouring forth water in continuous abundance:
55|67|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|68|In them will be Fruits
column2: and dates and pomegranates:

column1: 55|69|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|70|In them will be fair (Companions)
column2: good
column3: beautiful;-

column1: 55|71|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
55|72|Companions restrained (as to their glances)
column2: in (goodly) pavilions;-

column1: 55|73|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
55|74|Whom no man or Jinn before them has touched;-
55|75|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
55|76|Reclining on green Cushions and rich Carpets of beauty.
55|77|Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
55|78|Blessed be the name of thy Lord
column2: full of Majesty
column3: Bounty and Honour.

column1: 56|1|When the Event inevitable cometh to pass
56|2|Then will no (soul) entertain falsehood concerning its coming.
56|3|(Many) will it bring low; (many) will it exalt;
56|4|When the earth shall be shaken to its depths
56|5|And the mountains shall be crumbled to atoms
56|6|Becoming dust scattered abroad
56|7|And ye shall be sorted out into three classes.
56|8|Then (there will be) the Companions of the Right Hand;- What will be the Companions of the Right Hand?
56|9|And the Companions of the Left Hand
column2: #NAME?

column1: 56|10|And those Foremost (in Faith) will be Foremost (in the Hereafter).
56|11|These will be those Nearest to Allah:
56|12|In Gardens of Bliss:
56|13|A number of people from those of old
56|14|And a few from those of later times.
56|15|(They will be) on Thrones encrusted (with gold and precious stones)
56|16|Reclining on them
column2: facing each other.

column1: 56|17|Round about them will (serve) youths of perpetual (freshness)
56|18|With goblets
column2: (shining) beakers
column3: and cups (filled) out of clear-flowing fountains:

column1: 56|19|No after-ache will they receive therefrom
column2: nor will they suffer intoxication:

column1: 56|20|And with fruits
column2: any that they may select:

column1: 56|21|And the flesh of fowls
column2: any that they may desire.

column1: 56|22|And (there will be) Companions with beautiful
column2: big
column3: and lustrous eyes

column1: 56|23|Like unto Pearls well-guarded.
56|24|A Reward for the deeds of their past (life).
56|25|Not frivolity will they hear therein
column2: nor any taint of ill

column1: 56|26|Only the saying
column2: "Peace! Peace".

column1: 56|27|The Companions of the Right Hand
column2: #NAME?

column1: 56|28|(They will be) among Lote-trees without thorns
56|29|Among Talh trees with flowers (or fruits) piled one above another
56|30|In shade long-extended
56|31|By water flowing constantly
56|32|And fruit in abundance.
56|33|Whose season is not limited
column2: nor (supply) forbidden

column1: 56|34|And on Thrones (of Dignity)
column2: raised high.

column1: 56|35|We have created (their Companions) of special creation.
56|36|And made them virgin - pure (and undefiled)
56|37|Beloved (by nature)
column2: equal in age

column1: 56|38|For the Companions of the Right Hand.
56|39|A (goodly) number from those of old
56|40|And a (goodly) number from those of later times.
56|41|The Companions of the Left Hand
column2: #NAME?

column1: 56|42|(They will be) in the midst of a Fierce Blast of Fire and in Boiling Water
56|43|And in the shades of Black Smoke:
56|44|Nothing (will there be) to refresh
column2: nor to please:

column1: 56|45|For that they were wont to be indulged
column2: before that
column3: in wealth (and luxury)

column1: 56|46|And persisted obstinately in wickedness supreme!
56|47|And they used to say
column2: "What! when we die and become dust and bones
column3: shall we then indeed be raised up again?-

column1: 56|48|"(We) and our fathers of old?"
56|49|Say: "Yea
column2: those of old and those of later times

column1: 56|50|"All will certainly be gathered together for the meeting appointed for a Day well-known.
56|51|"Then will ye truly
column2: #NAME?
column3: and treat (Truth) as Falsehood!-

column1: 56|52|"Ye will surely taste of the Tree of Zaqqum.
56|53|"Then will ye fill your insides therewith
56|54|"And drink Boiling Water on top of it:
56|55|"Indeed ye shall drink like diseased camels raging with thirst!"
56|56|Such will be their entertainment on the Day of Requital!
56|57|It is We Who have created you: why will ye not witness the Truth?
56|58|Do ye then see?- The (human Seed) that ye throw out
56|59|Is it ye who create it
column2: or are We the Creators?

column1: 56|60|We have decreed Death to be your common lot
column2: and We are not to be frustrated

column1: 56|61|from changing your Forms and creating you (again) in (forms) that ye know not.
56|62|And ye certainly know already the first form of creation: why then do ye not celebrate His praises?
56|63|See ye the seed that ye sow in the ground?
56|64|Is it ye that cause it to grow
column2: or are We the Cause?

column1: 56|65|Were it Our Will
column2: We could crumble it to dry powder
column3: and ye would be left in wonderment

column1: 56|66|(Saying)
column2: "We are indeed left with debts (for nothing):

column1: 56|67|"Indeed are we shut out (of the fruits of our labour)"
56|68|See ye the water which ye drink?
56|69|Do ye bring it down (in rain) from the cloud or do We?
56|70|Were it Our Will
column2: We could make it salt (and unpalatable): then why do ye not give thanks?

column1: 56|71|See ye the Fire which ye kindle?
56|72|Is it ye who grow the tree which feeds the fire
column2: or do We grow it?

column1: 56|73|We have made it a memorial (of Our handiwork)
column2: and an article of comfort and convenience for the denizens of deserts.

column1: 56|74|Then celebrate with praises the name of thy Lord
column2: the Supreme!

column1: 56|75|Furthermore I call to witness the setting of the Stars
56|76|And that is indeed a mighty adjuration if ye but knew
56|77|That this is indeed a qur´an Most Honourable
56|78|In Book well-guarded
56|79|Which none shall touch but those who are clean:
56|80|A Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
56|81|Is it such a Message that ye would hold in light esteem?
56|82|And have ye made it your livelihood that ye should declare it false?
56|83|Then why do ye not (intervene) when (the soul of the dying man) reaches the throat
56|84|And ye the while (sit) looking on
56|85|But We are nearer to him than ye
column2: and yet see not

column1: 56|86|Then why do ye not
column2: #NAME?

column1: 56|87|Call back the soul
column2: if ye are true (in the claim of independence)?

column1: 56|88|Thus
column2: then
column3: if he be of those Nearest to Allah

column1: 56|89|(There is for him) Rest and Satisfaction
column2: and a Garden of Delights.

column1: 56|90|And if he be of the Companions of the Right Hand
56|91|(For him is the salutation)
column2: "Peace be unto thee"
column3: from the Companions of the Right Hand.

column1: 56|92|And if he be of those who treat (Truth) as Falsehood
column2: who go wrong

column1: 56|93|For him is Entertainment with Boiling Water.
56|94|And burning in Hell-Fire.
56|95|Verily
column2: this is the Very Truth and Certainly.

column1: 56|96|So celebrate with praises the name of thy Lord
column2: the Supreme.

column1: 57|1|Whatever is in the heavens and on earth
column2: #NAME?
column3: the Wise.

column1: 57|2|To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: It is He Who gives Life and Death; and He has Power over all things.
57|3|He is the First and the Last
column2: the Evident and the Immanent: and He has full knowledge of all things.

column1: 57|4|He it is Who created the heavens and the earth in Six Days
column2: and is moreover firmly established on the Throne (of Authority). He knows what enters within the earth and what comes forth out of it
column3: what comes down from heaven and what mounts up to it. And He is with you wheresoever ye may be. And Allah sees well all that ye do.

column1: 57|5|To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth: and all affairs are referred back to Allah.
57|6|He merges Night into Day
column2: and He merges Day into Night; and He has full knowledge of the secrets of (all) hearts.

column1: 57|7|Believe in Allah and His messenger
column2: and spend (in charity) out of the (substance) whereof He has made you heirs. For
column3: those of you who believe and spend (in charity)
column4: #NAME?

column1: 57|8|What cause have ye why ye should not believe in Allah?- and the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord
column2: and has indeed taken your Covenant
column3: if ye are men of Faith.

column1: 57|9|He is the One Who sends to His Servant Manifest Signs
column2: that He may lead you from the depths of Darkness into the Light and verily Allah is to you most kind and Merciful.

column1: 57|10|And what cause have ye why ye should not spend in the cause of Allah?- For to Allah belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth. Not equal among you are those who spent (freely) and fought
column2: before the Victory
column3: (with those who did so later). Those are higher in rank than those who spent (freely) and fought afterwards. But to all has Allah promised a goodly (reward). And Allah is well acquainted with all that ye do.

column1: 57|11|Who is he that will Loan to Allah a beautiful loan? for (Allah) will increase it manifold to his credit
column2: and he will have (besides) a liberal Reward.

column1: 57|12|One Day shalt thou see the believing men and the believing women- how their Light runs forward before them and by their right hands: (their greeting will be): "Good News for you this Day! Gardens beneath which flow rivers! to dwell therein for aye! This is indeed the highest Achievement!"

57|13|One Day will the Hypocrites- men and women - say to the Believers: "Wait for us! Let us borrow (a Light) from your Light!" It will be said: "Turn ye back to your rear! then seek a Light (where ye can)!" So a wall will be put up betwixt them
column2: with a gate therein. Within it will be Mercy throughout
column3: and without it
column4: all alongside
column5: will be (Wrath and) Punishment!

column1: 57|14|(Those without) will call out
column2: "Were we not with you?" (The others) will reply
column3: "True! but ye led yourselves into temptation; ye looked forward (to our ruin); ye doubted (Allah´s Promise); and (your false) desires deceived you; until there issued the Command of Allah. And the Deceiver deceived you in respect of Allah.

column1: 57|15|"This Day shall no ransom be accepted of you
column2: nor of those who rejected Allah." Your abode is the Fire: that is the proper place to claim you: and an evil refuge it is!"

column1: 57|16|Has not the Time arrived for the Believers that their hearts in all humility should engage in the remembrance of Allah and of the Truth which has been revealed (to them)
column2: and that they should not become like those to whom was given Revelation aforetime
column3: but long ages passed over them and their hearts grew hard? For many among them are rebellious transgressors.

column1: 57|17|Know ye (all) that Allah giveth life to the earth after its death! already have We shown the Signs plainly to you
column2: that ye may learn wisdom.

column1: 57|18|For those who give in Charity
column2: men and women
column3: and loan to Allah a Beautiful Loan
column4: it shall be increased manifold (to their credit)
column5: and they shall have (besides) a liberal reward.

column1: 57|19|And those who believe in Allah and His messengers- they are the Sincere (lovers of Truth)
column2: and the witnesses (who testify)
column3: in the eyes of their Lord: They shall have their Reward and their Light. But those who reject Allah and deny Our Signs
column4: #NAME?

column1: 57|20|Know ye (all)
column2: that the life of this world is but play and amusement
column3: pomp and mutual boasting and multiplying
column4: (in rivalry) among yourselves
column5: riches and children. Here is a similitude: How rain and the growth which it brings forth
column6: delight (the hearts of) the tillers; soon it withers; thou wilt see it grow yellow; then it becomes dry and crumbles away. But in the Hereafter is a Penalty severe (for the devotees of wrong). And Forgiveness from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure (for the devotees of Allah). And what is the life of this world
column7: but goods and chattels of deception?

column1: 57|21|Be ye foremost (in seeking) Forgiveness from your Lord
column2: and a Garden (of Bliss)
column3: the width whereof is as the width of heaven and earth
column4: prepared for those who believe in Allah and His messengers: that is the Grace of Allah
column5: which He bestows on whom he pleases: and Allah is the Lord of Grace abounding.

column1: 57|22|No misfortune can happen on earth or in your souls but is recorded in a decree before We bring it into existence: That is truly easy for Allah:
57|23|In order that ye may not despair over matters that pass you by
column2: nor exult over favours bestowed upon you. For Allah loveth not any vainglorious boaster

column1: 57|24|Such persons as are covetous and commend covetousness to men. And if any turn back (from Allah´s Way)
column2: verily Allah is Free of all Needs
column3: Worthy of all Praise.

column1: 57|25|We sent aforetime our messengers with Clear Signs and sent down with them the Book and the Balance (of Right and Wrong)
column2: that men may stand forth in justice; and We sent down Iron
column3: in which is (material for) mighty war
column4: as well as many benefits for mankind
column5: that Allah may test who it is that will help
column6: Unseen
column7: Him and His messengers: For Allah is Full of Strength
column8: Exalted in Might (and able to enforce His Will).

column1: 57|26|And We sent Noah and Abraham
column2: and established in their line Prophethood and Revelation: and some of them were on right guidance. But many of them became rebellious transgressors.

column1: 57|27|Then
column2: in their wake
column3: We followed them up with (others of) Our messengers: We sent after them Jesus the son of Mary
column4: and bestowed on him the Gospel; and We ordained in the hearts of those who followed him Compassion and Mercy. But the Monasticism which they invented for themselves
column5: We did not prescribe for them: (We commanded) only the seeking for the Good Pleasure of Allah; but that they did not foster as they should have done. Yet We bestowed
column6: on those among them who believed
column7: their (due) reward
column8: but many of them are rebellious transgressors.

column1: 57|28|O ye that believe! Fear Allah
column2: and believe in His Messenger
column3: and He will bestow on you a double portion of His Mercy: He will provide for you a Light by which ye shall walk (straight in your path)
column4: and He will forgive you (your past): for Allah is Oft-Forgiving
column5: Most Merciful.

column1: 57|29|That the People of the Book may know that they have no power whatever over the Grace of Allah
column2: that (His) Grace is (entirely) in His Hand
column3: to bestow it on whomsoever He wills. For Allah is the Lord of Grace abounding.

column1: 58|1|Allah has indeed heard (and accepted) the statement of the woman who pleads with thee concerning her husband and carries her complaint (in prayer) to Allah: and Allah (always) hears the arguments between both sides among you: for Allah hears and sees (all things).
58|2|If any men among you divorce their wives by Zihar (calling them mothers)
column2: they cannot be their mothers: None can be their mothers except those who gave them birth. And in fact they use words (both) iniquitous and false: but truly Allah is one that blots out (sins)
column3: and forgives (again and again).

column1: 58|3|But those who divorce their wives by Zihar
column2: then wish to go back on the words they uttered
column3: #NAME?

column1: 58|4|And if any has not (the wherewithal)
column2: he should fast for two months consecutively before they touch each other. But if any is unable to do so
column3: he should feed sixty indigent ones
column4: this
column5: that ye may show your faith in Allah and His Messenger. Those are limits (set by) Allah. For those who reject (Him)
column6: there is a grievous Penalty.

column1: 58|5|Those who resist Allah and His Messenger will be humbled to dust
column2: as were those before them: for We have already sent down Clear Signs. And the Unbelievers (will have) a humiliating Penalty

column1: 58|6|On the Day that Allah will raise them all up (again) and show them the Truth (and meaning) of their conduct. Allah has reckoned its (value)
column2: though they may have forgotten it
column3: for Allah is Witness to all things.

column1: 58|7|Seest thou not that Allah doth know (all) that is in the heavens and on earth? There is not a secret consultation between three
column2: but He makes the fourth among them
column3: - Nor between five but He makes the sixth
column4: #NAME?
column5: but He is in their midst
column6: wheresoever they be: In the end will He tell them the truth of their conduct
column7: on the Day of Judgment. For Allah has full knowledge of all things.

column1: 58|8|Turnest thou not thy sight towards those who were forbidden secret counsels yet revert to that which they were forbidden (to do)? And they hold secret counsels among themselves for iniquity and hostility
column2: and disobedience to the Messenger. And when they come to thee
column3: they salute thee
column4: not as Allah salutes thee
column5: (but in crooked ways): And they say to themselves
column6: "Why does not Allah punish us for our words?" Enough for them is Hell: In it will they burn
column7: and evil is that destination!

column1: 58|9|O ye who believe! When ye hold secret counsel
column2: do it not for iniquity and hostility
column3: and disobedience to the Prophet; but do it for righteousness and self-restraint; and fear Allah
column4: to Whom ye shall be brought back.

column1: 58|10|Secret counsels are only (inspired) by the Evil One
column2: in order that he may cause grief to the Believers; but he cannot harm them in the least
column3: except as Allah permits; and on Allah let the Believers put their trust.

column1: 58|11|O ye who believe! When ye are told to make room in the assemblies
column2: (spread out and) make room: (ample) room will Allah provide for you. And when ye are told to rise up
column3: rise up Allah will rise up
column4: to (suitable) ranks (and degrees)
column5: those of you who believe and who have been granted (mystic) Knowledge. And Allah is well-acquainted with all ye do.

column1: 58|12|O ye who believe! When ye consult the Messenger in private
column2: spend something in charity before your private consultation. That will be best for you
column3: and most conducive to purity (of conduct). But if ye find not (the wherewithal)
column4: Allah is Oft-Forgiving
column5: Most Merciful.

column1: 58|13|Is it that ye are afraid of spending sums in charity before your private consultation (with him)? If
column2: then
column3: ye do not so
column4: and Allah forgives you
column5: then (at least) establish regular prayer; practise regular charity; and obey Allah and His Messenger. And Allah is well-acquainted with all that ye do.

column1: 58|14|Turnest thou not thy attention to those who turn (in friendship) to such as have the Wrath of Allah upon them? They are neither of you nor of them
column2: and they swear to falsehood knowingly.

column1: 58|15|Allah has prepared for them a severe Penalty: evil indeed are their deeds.
58|16|They have made their oaths a screen (for their misdeeds): thus they obstruct (men) from the Path of Allah: therefore shall they have a humiliating Penalty.
58|17|Of no profit whatever to them
column2: against Allah
column3: will be their riches nor their sons: they will be Companions of the Fire
column4: to dwell therein (for aye)!

column1: 58|18|One day will Allah raise them all up (for Judgment): then will they swear to Him as they swear to you: And they think that they have something (to stand upon). No
column2: indeed! they are but liars!

column1: 58|19|The Evil One has got the better of them: so he has made them lose the remembrance of Allah. They are the Party of the Evil One. Truly
column2: it is the Party of the Evil One that will perish!

column1: 58|20|Those who resist Allah and His Messenger will be among those most humiliated.
58|21|Allah has decreed: "It is I and My messengers who must prevail": For Allah is One full of strength
column2: able to enforce His Will.

column1: 58|22|Thou wilt not find any people who believe in Allah and the Last Day
