column2: loving those who resist Allah and His Messenger
column3: even though they were their fathers or their sons
column4: or their brothers
column5: or their kindred. For such He has written Faith in their hearts
column6: and strengthened them with a spirit from Himself. And He will admit them to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow
column7: to dwell therein (for ever). Allah will be well pleased with them
column8: and they with Him. They are the Party of Allah. Truly it is the Party of Allah that will achieve Felicity.

column1: 59|1|Whatever is in the heavens and on earth
column2: let it declare the Praises and Glory of Allah: for He is the Exalted in Might
column3: the Wise.

column1: 59|2|It is He Who got out the Unbelievers among the People of the Book from their homes at the first gathering (of the forces). Little did ye think that they would get out: And they thought that their fortresses would defend them from Allah! But the (Wrath of) Allah came to them from quarters from which they little expected (it)
column2: and cast terror into their hearts
column3: so that they destroyed their dwellings by their own hands and the hands of the Believers
column4: take warning
column5: then
column6: O ye with eyes (to see)!

column1: 59|3|And had it not been that Allah had decreed banishment for them
column2: He would certainly have punished them in this world: And in the Hereafter they shall (certainly) have the Punishment of the Fire.

column1: 59|4|That is because they resisted Allah and His Messenger: and if any one resists Allah
column2: verily Allah is severe in Punishment.

column1: 59|5|Whether ye cut down (O ye Muslim!) The tender palm-trees
column2: or ye left them standing on their roots
column3: it was by leave of Allah
column4: and in order that He might cover with shame the rebellious transgresses.

column1: 59|6|What Allah has bestowed on His Messenger (and taken away) from them - for this ye made no expedition with either cavalry or camelry: but Allah gives power to His messengers over any He pleases: and Allah has power over all things.
59|7|What Allah has bestowed on His Messenger (and taken away) from the people of the townships
column2: #NAME?
column3: #NAME?
column4: the needy and the wayfarer; In order that it may not (merely) make a circuit between the wealthy among you. So take what the Messenger assigns to you
column5: and deny yourselves that which he withholds from you. And fear Allah; for Allah is strict in Punishment.

column1: 59|8|(Some part is due) to the indigent Muhajirs
column2: those who were expelled from their homes and their property
column3: while seeking Grace from Allah and (His) Good Pleasure
column4: and aiding Allah and His Messenger: such are indeed the sincere ones:-

column1: 59|9|But those who before them
column2: had homes (in Medina) and had adopted the Faith
column3: #NAME?
column4: and entertain no desire in their hearts for things given to the (latter)
column5: but give them preference over themselves
column6: even though poverty was their (own lot). And those saved from the covetousness of their own souls
column7: #NAME?

column1: 59|10|And those who came after them say: "Our Lord! Forgive us
column2: and our brethren who came before us into the Faith
column3: and leave not
column4: in our hearts
column5: rancour (or sense of injury) against those who have believed. Our Lord! Thou art indeed Full of Kindness
column6: Most Merciful."

column1: 59|11|Hast thou not observed the Hypocrites say to their misbelieving brethren among the People of the Book? - "If ye are expelled
column2: we too will go out with you
column3: and we will never hearken to any one in your affair; and if ye are attacked (in fight) we will help you". But Allah is witness that they are indeed liars.

column1: 59|12|If they are expelled
column2: never will they go out with them; and if they are attacked (in fight)
column3: they will never help them; and if they do help them
column4: they will turn their backs; so they will receive no help.

column1: 59|13|Of a truth ye are stronger (than they) because of the terror in their hearts
column2: (sent) by Allah. This is because they are men devoid of understanding.

column1: 59|14|They will not fight you (even) together
column2: except in fortified townships
column3: or from behind walls. Strong is their fighting (spirit) amongst themselves: thou wouldst think they were united
column4: but their hearts are divided: that is because they are a people devoid of wisdom.

column1: 59|15|Like those who lately preceded them
column2: they have tasted the evil result of their conduct; and (in the Hereafter there is) for them a grievous Penalty;-

column1: 59|16|(Their allies deceived them)
column2: like the Evil One
column3: when he says to man
column4: "Deny Allah": but when (man) denies Allah
column5: (the Evil One) says
column6: "I am free of thee: I do fear Allah
column7: the Lord of the Worlds!"

column1: 59|17|The end of both will be that they will go into the Fire
column2: dwelling therein for ever. Such is the reward of the wrong-doers.

column1: 59|18|O ye who believe! Fear Allah
column2: and let every soul look to what (provision) He has sent forth for the morrow. Yea
column3: fear Allah: for Allah is well-acquainted with (all) that ye do.

column1: 59|19|And be ye not like those who forgot Allah; and He made them forget their own souls! Such are the rebellious transgressors!
59|20|Not equal are the Companions of the Fire and the Companions of the Garden: it is the Companions of the Garden
column2: that will achieve Felicity.

column1: 59|21|Had We sent down this Qur´an on a mountain
column2: verily
column3: thou wouldst have seen it humble itself and cleave asunder for fear of Allah. Such are the similitudes which We propound to men
column4: that they may reflect.

column1: 59|22|Allah is He
column2: than Whom there is no other god;- Who knows (all things) both secret and open; He
column3: Most Gracious
column4: Most Merciful.

column1: 59|23|Allah is He
column2: than Whom there is no other god;- the Sovereign
column3: the Holy One
column4: the Source of Peace (and Perfection)
column5: the Guardian of Faith
column6: the Preserver of Safety
column7: the Exalted in Might
column8: the Irresistible
column9: the Supreme: Glory to Allah! (High is He) above the partners they attribute to Him.

column1: 59|24|He is Allah
column2: the Creator
column3: the Evolver
column4: the Bestower of Forms (or Colours). To Him belong the Most Beautiful Names: whatever is in the heavens and on earth
column5: doth declare His Praises and Glory: and He is the Exalted in Might
column6: the Wise.

column1: 60|1|O ye who believe! Take not my enemies and yours as friends (or protectors)
column2: #NAME?
column3: even though they have rejected the Truth that has come to you
column4: and have (on the contrary) driven out the Prophet and yourselves (from your homes)
column5: (simply) because ye believe in Allah your Lord! If ye have come out to strive in My Way and to seek My Good Pleasure
column6: (take them not as friends)
column7: holding secret converse of love (and friendship) with them: for I know full well all that ye conceal and all that ye reveal. And any of you that does this has strayed from the Straight Path.

column1: 60|2|If they were to get the better of you
column2: they would behave to you as enemies
column3: and stretch forth their hands and their tongues against you for evil: and they desire that ye should reject the Truth.

column1: 60|3|Of no profit to you will be your relatives and your children on the Day of Judgment: He will judge between you: for Allah sees well all that ye do.
60|4|There is for you an excellent example (to follow) in Abraham and those with him
column2: when they said to their people: "We are clear of you and of whatever ye worship besides Allah: we have rejected you
column3: and there has arisen
column4: between us and you
column5: enmity and hatred for ever
column6: - unless ye believe in Allah and Him alone": But not when Abraham said to his father: "I will pray for forgiveness for thee
column7: though I have no power (to get) aught on thy behalf from Allah." (They prayed): "Our Lord! in Thee do we trust
column8: and to Thee do we turn in repentance: to Thee is (our) Final Goal.

column1: 60|5|"Our Lord! Make us not a (test and) trial for the Unbelievers
column2: but forgive us
column3: our Lord! for Thou art the Exalted in Might
column4: the Wise."

column1: 60|6|There was indeed in them an excellent example for you to follow
column2: #NAME?
column3: truly Allah is Free of all Wants
column4: Worthy of all Praise.

column1: 60|7|It may be that Allah will grant love (and friendship) between you and those whom ye (now) hold as enemies. For Allah has power (over all things); And Allah is Oft-Forgiving
column2: Most Merciful.

column1: 60|8|Allah forbids you not
column2: with regard to those who fight you not for (your) Faith nor drive you out of your homes
column3: from dealing kindly and justly with them: for Allah loveth those who are just.

column1: 60|9|Allah only forbids you
column2: with regard to those who fight you for (your) Faith
column3: and drive you out of your homes
column4: and support (others) in driving you out
column5: from turning to them (for friendship and protection). It is such as turn to them (in these circumstances)
column6: that do wrong.

column1: 60|10|O ye who believe! When there come to you believing women refugees
column2: examine (and test) them: Allah knows best as to their Faith: if ye ascertain that they are Believers
column3: then send them not back to the Unbelievers. They are not lawful (wives) for the Unbelievers
column4: nor are the (Unbelievers) lawful (husbands) for them. But pay the Unbelievers what they have spent (on their dower)
column5: and there will be no blame on you if ye marry them on payment of their dower to them. But hold not to the guardianship of unbelieving women: ask for what ye have spent on their dowers
column6: and let the (Unbelievers) ask for what they have spent (on the dowers of women who come over to you). Such is the command of Allah: He judges (with justice) between you. And Allah is Full of Knowledge and Wisdom.

column1: 60|11|And if any of your wives deserts you to the Unbelievers
column2: and ye have an accession (by the coming over of a woman from the other side)
column3: then pay to those whose wives have deserted the equivalent of what they had spent (on their dower). And fear Allah
column4: in Whom ye believe.

column1: 60|12|O Prophet! When believing women come to thee to take the oath of fealty to thee
column2: that they will not associate in worship any other thing whatever with Allah
column3: that they will not steal
column4: that they will not commit adultery (or fornication)
column5: that they will not kill their children
column6: that they will not utter slander
column7: intentionally forging falsehood
column8: and that they will not disobey thee in any just matter
column10: and pray to Allah for the forgiveness (of their sins): for Allah is Oft-Forgiving

column1: 60|13|O ye who believe! Turn not (for friendship) to people on whom is the Wrath of Allah
column2: of the Hereafter they are already in despair
column3: just as the Unbelievers are in despair about those (buried) in graves.

column1: 61|1|Whatever is in the heavens and on earth
column2: let it declare the Praises and Glory of Allah: for He is the Exalted in Might
column3: the Wise.

column1: 61|2|O ye who believe! Why say ye that which ye do not?
61|3|Grievously odious is it in the sight of Allah that ye say that which ye do not.
61|4|Truly Allah loves those who fight in His Cause in battle array
column2: as if they were a solid cemented structure.

column1: 61|5|And remember
column2: Moses said to his people: "O my people! why do ye vex and insult me
column3: though ye know that I am the messenger of Allah (sent) to you?" Then when they went wrong
column4: Allah let their hearts go wrong. For Allah guides not those who are rebellious transgressors.

column1: 61|6|And remember
column2: Jesus
column3: the son of Mary
column4: said: "O Children of Israel! I am the messenger of Allah (sent) to you
column5: confirming the Law (which came) before me
column6: and giving Glad Tidings of a Messenger to come after me
column7: whose name shall be Ahmad." But when he came to them with Clear Signs
column8: they said

column1: 61|7|Who doth greater wrong than one who invents falsehood against Allah
column2: even as he is being invited to Islam? And Allah guides not those who do wrong.

column1: 61|8|Their intention is to extinguish Allah´s Light (by blowing) with their mouths: But Allah will complete (the revelation of) His Light
column2: even though the Unbelievers may detest (it).

column1: 61|9|It is He Who has sent His Messenger with Guidance and the Religion of Truth
column2: that he may proclaim it over all religion
column3: even though the Pagans may detest (it).

column1: 61|10|O ye who believe! Shall I lead you to a bargain that will save you from a grievous Penalty?-
61|11|That ye believe in Allah and His Messenger
column2: and that ye strive (your utmost) in the Cause of Allah
column3: with your property and your persons: That will be best for you
column4: if ye but knew!

column1: 61|12|He will forgive you your sins
column2: and admit you to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow
column3: and to beautiful mansions in Gardens of Eternity: that is indeed the Supreme Achievement.

column1: 61|13|And another (favour will He bestow
column2: ) which ye do love
column3: #NAME?

column1: 61|14|O ye who believe! Be ye helpers of Allah: As said Jesus the son of Mary to the Disciples
column2: "Who will be my helpers to (the work of) Allah?" Said the disciples
column3: "We are Allah´s helpers!" then a portion of the Children of Israel believed
column4: and a portion disbelieved: But We gave power to those who believed
column5: against their enemies
column6: and they became the ones that prevailed.

column1: 62|1|Whatever is in the heavens and on earth
column2: doth declare the Praises and Glory of Allah
column3: #NAME?
column4: the Holy One
column5: the Exalted in Might
column6: the Wise.

column1: 62|2|It is He Who has sent amongst the Unlettered a messenger from among themselves
column2: to rehearse to them His Signs
column3: to sanctify them
column4: and to instruct them in Scripture and Wisdom
column5: #NAME?
column6: before
column7: in manifest error;-

column1: 62|3|As well as (to confer all these benefits upon) others of them
column2: who have not already joined them: And He is exalted in Might
column3: Wise.

column1: 62|4|Such is the Bounty of Allah
column2: which He bestows on whom He will: and Allah is the Lord of the highest bounty.

column1: 62|5|The similitude of those who were charged with the (obligations of the) Mosaic Law
column2: but who subsequently failed in those (obligations)
column3: is that of a donkey which carries huge tomes (but understands them not). Evil is the similitude of people who falsify the Signs of Allah: and Allah guides not people who do wrong.

column1: 62|6|Say: "O ye that stand on Judaism! If ye think that ye are friends to Allah
column2: to the exclusion of (other) men
column3: then express your desire for Death
column4: if ye are truthful!"

column1: 62|7|But never will they express their desire (for Death)
column2: because of the (deeds) their hands have sent on before them! and Allah knows well those that do wrong!

column1: 62|8|Say: "The Death from which ye flee will truly overtake you: then will ye be sent back to the Knower of things secret and open: and He will tell you (the truth of) the things that ye did!"
62|9|O ye who believe! When the call is proclaimed to prayer on Friday (the Day of Assembly)
column2: hasten earnestly to the Remembrance of Allah
column3: and leave off business (and traffic): That is best for you if ye but knew!

column1: 62|10|And when the Prayer is finished
column2: then may ye disperse through the land
column3: and seek of the Bounty of Allah: and celebrate the Praises of Allah often (and without stint): that ye may prosper.

column1: 62|11|But when they see some bargain or some amusement
column2: they disperse headlong to it
column3: and leave thee standing. Say: "The (blessing) from the Presence of Allah is better than any amusement or bargain! and Allah is the Best to provide (for all needs)."

column1: 63|1|When the Hypocrites come to thee
column2: they say
column3: "We bear witness that thou art indeed the Messenger of Allah." Yea
column4: Allah knoweth that thou art indeed His Messenger
column5: and Allah beareth witness that the Hypocrites are indeed liars.

column1: 63|2|They have made their oaths a screen (for their misdeeds): thus they obstruct (men) from the Path of Allah: truly evil are their deeds.
63|3|That is because they believed
column2: then they rejected Faith: So a seal was set on their hearts: therefore they understand not.

column1: 63|4|When thou lookest at them
column2: their exteriors please thee; and when they speak
column3: thou listenest to their words. They are as (worthless as hollow) pieces of timber propped up
column4: (unable to stand on their own). They think that every cry is against them. They are the enemies; so beware of them. The curse of Allah be on them! How are they deluded (away from the Truth)!

column1: 63|5|And when it is said to them
column2: "Come
column3: the Messenger of Allah will pray for your forgiveness"
column4: they turn aside their heads
column5: and thou wouldst see them turning away their faces in arrogance.

column1: 63|6|It is equal to them whether thou pray for their forgiveness or not. Allah will not forgive them. Truly Allah guides not rebellious transgressors.
63|7|They are the ones who say
column2: "Spend nothing on those who are with Allah´s Messenger
column3: to the end that they may disperse (and quit Medina)." But to Allah belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth; but the Hypocrites understand not.

column1: 63|8|They say
column2: "If we return to Medina
column3: surely the more honourable (element) will expel therefrom the meaner." But honour belongs to Allah and His Messenger
column4: and to the Believers; but the Hypocrites know not.

column1: 63|9|O ye who believe! Let not your riches or your children divert you from the remembrance of Allah. If any act thus
column2: the loss is their own.

column1: 63|10|and spend something (in charity) out of the substance which We have bestowed on you
column2: before Death should come to any of you and he should say
column3: "O my Lord! why didst Thou not give me respite for a little while? I should then have given (largely) in charity
column4: and I should have been one of the doers of good".

column1: 63|11|But to no soul will Allah grant respite when the time appointed (for it) has come; and Allah is well acquainted with (all) that ye do.
64|1|Whatever is in the heavens and on earth
column2: doth declare the Praises and Glory of Allah: to Him belongs dominion
column3: and to Him belongs praise: and He has power over all things.

column1: 64|2|It is He Who has created you; and of you are some that are Unbelievers
column2: and some that are Believers: and Allah sees well all that ye do.

column1: 64|3|He has created the heavens and the earth in just proportions
column2: and has given you shape
column3: and made your shapes beautiful: and to Him is the final Goal.

column1: 64|4|He knows what is in the heavens and on earth; and He knows what ye conceal and what ye reveal: yea
column2: Allah knows well the (secrets) of (all) hearts.

column1: 64|5|Has not the story reached you
column2: of those who rejected Faith aforetime? So they tasted the evil result of their conduct; and they had a grievous Penalty.

column1: 64|6|That was because there came to them messengers with Clear Signs
column2: but they said: "Shall (mere) human beings direct us?" So they rejected (the Message) and turned away. But Allah can do without (them): and Allah is free of all needs
column3: worthy of all praise.

column1: 64|7|The Unbelievers think that they will not be raised up (for Judgment). Say: "Yea
column2: By my Lord
column3: Ye shall surely be raised up: then shall ye be told (the truth) of all that ye did. And that is easy for Allah."

column1: 64|8|Believe
column2: therefore
column3: in Allah and His Messenger
column4: and in the Light which we have sent down. And Allah is well acquainted with all that ye do.

column1: 64|9|The Day that He assembles you (all) for a Day of Assembly
column2: #NAME?
column3: and those who believe in Allah and work righteousness
column4: #NAME?
column5: and He will admit them to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow
column6: to dwell therein for ever: that will be the Supreme Achievement.

column1: 64|10|But those who reject Faith and treat Our Signs as falsehoods
column2: they will be Companions of the Fire
column3: to dwell therein for aye: and evil is that Goal.

column1: 64|11|No kind of calamity can occur
column2: except by the leave of Allah: and if any one believes in Allah
column3: (Allah) guides his heart (aright): for Allah knows all things.

column1: 64|12|So obey Allah
column2: and obey His Messenger: but if ye turn back
column3: the duty of Our Messenger is but to proclaim (the Message) clearly and openly.

column1: 64|13|Allah! There is no god but He: and on Allah
column2: therefore
column3: let the Believers put their trust.

column1: 64|14|O ye who believe! Truly
column2: among your wives and your children are (some that are) enemies to yourselves: so beware of them! But if ye forgive and overlook
column3: and cover up (their faults)
column4: verily Allah is Oft-Forgiving
column5: Most Merciful.

column1: 64|15|Your riches and your children may be but a trial: but in the Presence of Allah
column2: is the highest
column3: Reward.

column1: 64|16|So fear Allah as much as ye can; listen and obey and spend in charity for the benefit of your own soul and those saved from the covetousness of their own souls
column2: #NAME?

column1: 64|17|If ye loan to Allah
column2: a beautiful loan
column3: He will double it to your (credit)
column4: and He will grant you Forgiveness: for Allah is most Ready to appreciate (service)
column5: Most Forbearing

column1: 64|18|Knower of what is open
column2: Exalted in Might
column3: Full of Wisdom.

column1: 65|1|O Prophet! When ye do divorce women
column2: divorce them at their prescribed periods
column3: and count (accurately)
column4: their prescribed periods: And fear Allah your Lord: and turn them not out of their houses
column5: nor shall they (themselves) leave
column6: except in case they are guilty of some open lewdness
column7: those are limits set by Allah: and any who transgresses the limits of Allah
column8: does verily wrong his (own) soul: thou knowest not if perchance Allah will bring about thereafter some new situation.

column1: 65|2|Thus when they fulfil their term appointed
column2: either take them back on equitable terms or part with them on equitable terms; and take for witness two persons from among you
column3: endued with justice
column4: and establish the evidence (as) before Allah. Such is the admonition given to him who believes in Allah and the Last Day. And for those who fear Allah
column5: He (ever) prepares a way out

column1: 65|3|And He provides for him from (sources) he never could imagine. And if any one puts his trust in Allah
column2: sufficient is (Allah) for him. For Allah will surely accomplish his purpose: verily
column3: for all things has Allah appointed a due proportion.

column1: 65|4|Such of your women as have passed the age of monthly courses
column2: for them the prescribed period
column3: if ye have any doubts
column4: is three months
column5: and for those who have no courses (it is the same): for those who carry (life within their wombs)
column6: their period is until they deliver their burdens: and for those who fear Allah
column7: He will make their path easy.

column1: 65|5|That is the Command of Allah
column2: which He has sent down to you: and if any one fears Allah
column3: He will remove his ills
column4: from him
column5: and will enlarge his reward.

column1: 65|6|Let the women live (in ´iddat) in the same style as ye live
column2: according to your means: Annoy them not
column3: so as to restrict them. And if they carry (life in their wombs)
column4: then spend (your substance) on them until they deliver their burden: and if they suckle your (offspring)
column5: give them their recompense: and take mutual counsel together
column6: according to what is just and reasonable. And if ye find yourselves in difficulties
column7: let another woman suckle (the child) on the (father´s) behalf.

column1: 65|7|Let the man of means spend according to his means: and the man whose resources are restricted
column2: let him spend according to what Allah has given him. Allah puts no burden on any person beyond what He has given him. After a difficulty
column3: Allah will soon grant relief.

column1: 65|8|How many populations that insolently opposed the Command of their Lord and of His messengers
column2: did We not then call to account
column3: #NAME?

column1: 65|9|Then did they taste the evil result of their conduct
column2: and the End of their conduct was Perdition.

column1: 65|10|Allah has prepared for them a severe Punishment (in the Hereafter). Therefore fear Allah
column2: O ye men of understanding - who have believed!- for Allah hath indeed sent down to you a Message

column1: 65|11|An Messenger
column2: who rehearses to you the Signs of Allah containing clear explanations
column3: that he may lead forth those who believe and do righteous deeds from the depths of Darkness into Light. And those who believe in Allah and work righteousness
column4: He will admit to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow
column5: to dwell therein for ever: Allah has indeed granted for them a most excellent Provision.

column1: 65|12|Allah is He Who created seven Firmaments and of the earth a similar number. Through the midst of them (all) descends His Command: that ye may know that Allah has power over all things
column2: and that Allah comprehends
column3: all things in (His) Knowledge.

column1: 66|1|O Prophet! Why holdest thou to be forbidden that which Allah has made lawful to thee? Thou seekest to please thy consorts. But Allah is Oft-Forgiving
column2: Most Merciful.

column1: 66|2|Allah has already ordained for you
column2: (O men)
column3: the dissolution of your oaths (in some cases): and Allah is your Protector
column4: and He is Full of Knowledge and Wisdom.

column1: 66|3|When the Prophet disclosed a matter in confidence to one of his consorts
column2: and she then divulged it (to another)
column3: and Allah made it known to him
column4: he confirmed part thereof and repudiated a part. Then when he told her thereof
column5: she said
column6: "Who told thee this? "He said
column7: "He told me Who knows and is well-acquainted (with all things)."

column1: 66|4|If ye two turn in repentance to Him
column2: your hearts are indeed so inclined; But if ye back up each other against him
column3: truly Allah is his Protector
column4: and Gabriel
column5: and (every) righteous one among those who believe
column6: #NAME?
column7: the angels - will back (him) up.

column1: 66|5|It may be
column2: if he divorced you (all)
column3: that Allah will give him in exchange consorts better than you
column4: #NAME?
column5: who believe
column6: who are devout
column7: who turn to Allah in repentance
column8: who worship (in humility)

column1: 66|6|O ye who believe! save yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is Men and Stones
column2: over which are (appointed) angels stern (and) severe
column3: who flinch not (from executing) the Commands they receive from Allah
column4: but do (precisely) what they are commanded.

column1: 66|7|(They will say)
column2: "O ye Unbelievers! Make no excuses this Day! Ye are being but requited for all that ye did!"

column1: 66|8|O ye who believe! Turn to Allah with sincere repentance: In the hope that your Lord will remove from you your ills and admit you to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow
column2: #NAME?
column3: while they say
column4: "Our Lord! Perfect our Light for us
column5: and grant us Forgiveness: for Thou hast power over all things."

column1: 66|9|O Prophet! Strive hard against the Unbelievers and the Hypocrites
column2: and be firm against them. Their abode is Hell
column3: - an evil refuge (indeed).

column1: 66|10|Allah sets forth
column2: for an example to the Unbelievers
column3: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lut: they were (respectively) under two of our righteous servants
column4: but they were false to their (husbands)
column5: and they profited nothing before Allah on their account
column6: but were told: "Enter ye the Fire along with (others) that enter!"

column1: 66|11|And Allah sets forth
column2: as an example to those who believe the wife of Pharaoh: Behold she said: "O my Lord! Build for me
column3: in nearness to Thee
column4: a mansion in the Garden
column5: and save me from Pharaoh and his doings
column6: and save me from those that do wrong";

column1: 66|12|And Mary the daughter of ´Imran
column2: who guarded her chastity; and We breathed into (her body) of Our spirit; and she testified to the truth of the words of her Lord and of His Revelations
column3: and was one of the devout (servants).

column1: 67|1|Blessed be He in Whose hands is Dominion; and He over all things hath Power;-
67|2|He Who created Death and Life
column2: that He may try which of you is best in deed: and He is the Exalted in Might
column3: Oft-Forgiving;-

column1: 67|3|He Who created the seven heavens one above another: No want of proportion wilt thou see in the Creation of (Allah) Most Gracious. So turn thy vision again: seest thou any flaw?
67|4|Again turn thy vision a second time: (thy) vision will come back to thee dull and discomfited
column2: in a state worn out.

column1: 67|5|And we have
column2: (from of old)
column3: adorned the lowest heaven with Lamps
column4: and We have made such (Lamps) (as) missiles to drive away the Evil Ones
column5: and have prepared for them the Penalty of the Blazing Fire.

column1: 67|6|For those who reject their Lord (and Cherisher) is the Penalty of Hell: and evil is (such)
column2: Destination.

column1: 67|7|When they are cast therein
column2: they will hear the (terrible) drawing in of its breath even as it blazes forth

column1: 67|8|Almost bursting with fury: Every time a Group is cast therein
column2: its Keepers will ask
column3: "Did no Warner come to you?"

column1: 67|9|They will say: "Yes indeed; a Warner did come to us
column2: but we rejected him and said
column3: ´Allah never sent down any (Message): ye are nothing but an egregious delusion!´"

column1: 67|10|They will further say: "Had we but listened or used our intelligence
column2: we should not (now) be among the Companions of the Blazing Fire!"

column1: 67|11|They will then confess their sins: but far will be (Forgiveness) from the Companions of the Blazing Fire!
67|12|As for those who fear their Lord unseen
column2: for them is Forgiveness and a great Reward.

column1: 67|13|And whether ye hide your word or publish it
column2: He certainly has (full) knowledge
column3: of the secrets of (all) hearts.

column1: 67|14|Should He not know
column2: - He that created? and He is the One that understands the finest mysteries (and) is well-acquainted (with them).

column1: 67|15|It is He Who has made the earth manageable for you
column2: so traverse ye through its tracts and enjoy of the Sustenance which He furnishes: but unto Him is the Resurrection.

column1: 67|16|Do ye feel secure that He Who is in heaven will not cause you to be swallowed up by the earth when it shakes (as in an earthquake)?
67|17|Or do ye feel secure that He Who is in Heaven will not send against you a violent tornado (with showers of stones)
column2: so that ye shall know how (terrible) was My warning?

column1: 67|18|But indeed men before them rejected (My warning): then how (terrible) was My rejection (of them)?
67|19|Do they not observe the birds above them
column2: spreading their wings and folding them in? None can uphold them except (Allah) Most Gracious: Truly (Allah) Most Gracious: Truly it is He that watches over all things.
who is there that can help you
column3: (even as) an army
column4: besides (Allah) Most Merciful? In nothing but delusion are the Unbelievers.

column1: 67|21|Or who is there that can provide you with Sustenance if He were to withhold His provision? Nay
column2: they obstinately persist in insolent impiety and flight (from the Truth).

column1: 67|22|Is then one who walks headlong
column2: with his face grovelling
column3: better guided
column4: #NAME?

column1: 67|23|Say: "It is He Who has created you (and made you grow)
column2: and made for you the faculties of hearing
column3: seeing
column4: feeling and understanding: little thanks it is ye give.

column1: 67|24|Say: "It is He Who has multiplied you through the earth
column2: and to Him shall ye be gathered together."

column1: 67|25|They ask: When will this promise be (fulfilled)? - If ye are telling the truth.
67|26|Say: "As to the knowledge of the time
column2: it is with Allah alone: I am (sent) only to warn plainly in public."

column1: 67|27|At length
column2: when they see it close at hand
column3: grieved will be the faces of the Unbelievers
column4: and it will be said (to them): "This is (the promise fulfilled)
column5: which ye were calling for!"

column1: 67|28|Say: "See ye?- If Allah were to destroy me
column2: and those with me
column3: or if He bestows His Mercy on us
column4: - yet who can deliver the Unbelievers from a grievous Penalty?"

column1: 67|29|Say: "He is (Allah) Most Gracious: We have believed in Him
column2: and on Him have we put our trust: So
column3: soon will ye know which (of us) it is that is in manifest error."

column1: 67|30|Say: "See ye?- If your stream be some morning lost (in the underground earth)
column2: who then can supply you with clear-flowing water?"

column1: 68|1|Nun. By the Pen and the (Record) which (men) write
68|2|Thou art not
column2: by the Grace of thy Lord
column3: mad or possessed.

column2: verily for thee is a Reward unfailing:

column1: 68|4|And thou (standest) on an exalted standard of character.
68|5|Soon wilt thou see
column2: and they will see

column1: 68|6|Which of you is afflicted with madness.
68|7|Verily it is thy Lord that knoweth best
column2: which (among men) hath strayed from His Path: and He knoweth best those who receive (true) Guidance.

column1: 68|8|So hearken not to those who deny (the Truth).
68|9|Their desire is that thou shouldst be pliant: so would they be pliant.
68|10|Heed not the type of despicable men
column2: #NAME?

column1: 68|11|A slanderer
column2: going about with calumnies

column1: 68|12|(Habitually) hindering (all) good
column2: transgressing beyond bounds
column3: deep in sin

column1: 68|13|Violent (and cruel)
column2: #NAME?
column3: base-born

column1: 68|14|Because he possesses wealth and (numerous) sons.
68|15|When to him are rehearsed Our Signs
column2: "Tales of the ancients"
column3: he cries!

column1: 68|16|Soon shall We brand (the beast) on the snout!
68|17|Verily We have tried them as We tried the People of the Garden
column2: when they resolved to gather the fruits of the (garden) in the morning.

column1: 68|18|But made no reservation
column2: ("If it be Allah´s Will").

column1: 68|19|Then there came on the (garden) a visitation from thy Lord
column2: (which swept away) all around
column3: while they were asleep.

column1: 68|20|So the (garden) became
column2: by the morning
column3: like a dark and desolate spot
column4: (whose fruit had been gathered).

column1: 68|21|As the morning broke
column2: they called out
column3: one to another

column1: 68|22|"Go ye to your tilth (betimes) in the morning
column2: if ye would gather the fruits."

column1: 68|23|So they departed
column2: conversing in secret low tones
column3: (saying)-

column1: 68|24|"Let not a single indigent person break in upon you into the (garden) this day."
68|25|And they opened the morning
column2: strong in an (unjust) resolve.

column1: 68|26|But when they saw the (garden)
column2: they said: "We have surely lost our way:

column1: 68|27|"Indeed we are shut out (of the fruits of our labour)!"
68|28|Said one of them
column2: more just (than the rest): "Did I not say to you
column3: ´Why not glorify (Allah)?´"

column1: 68|29|They said: "Glory to our Lord! Verily we have been doing wrong!"
68|30|Then they turned
column2: one against another
column3: in reproach.

column1: 68|31|They said: "Alas for us! We have indeed transgressed!
68|32|"It may be that our Lord will give us in exchange a better (garden) than this: for we do turn to Him (in repentance)!"
68|33|Such is the Punishment (in this life); but greater is the Punishment in the Hereafter
column2: - if only they knew!

column1: 68|34|Verily
column2: for the Righteous
column3: are Gardens of Delight
column4: in the Presence of their Lord.

column1: 68|35|Shall We then treat the People of Faith like the People of Sin?
68|36|What is the matter with you? How judge ye?
68|37|Or have ye a book through which ye learn-
68|38|That ye shall have
column2: through it whatever ye choose?

column1: 68|39|Or have ye Covenants with Us to oath
column2: reaching to the Day of Judgment
column3: (providing) that ye shall have whatever ye shall demand?

column1: 68|40|Ask thou of them
column2: which of them will stand surety for that!

column1: 68|41|Or have they some "Partners" (in Allahhead)? Then let them produce their "partners"
column2: if they are truthful!

column1: 68|42|The Day that the shin shall be laid bare
column2: and they shall be summoned to bow in adoration
column3: but they shall not be able

column1: 68|43|Their eyes will be cast down
column2: - ignominy will cover them; seeing that they had been summoned aforetime to bow in adoration
column3: while they were whole
column4: (and had refused).

column1: 68|44|Then leave Me alone with such as reject this Message: by degrees shall We punish them from directions they perceive not.
68|45|A (long) respite will I grant them: truly powerful is My Plan.
68|46|Or is it that thou dost ask them for a reward
column2: so that they are burdened with a load of debt?-

column1: 68|47|Or that the Unseen is in their hands
column2: so that they can write it down?

column1: 68|48|So wait with patience for the Command of thy Lord
column2: and be not like the Companion of the Fish
column3: #NAME?

column1: 68|49|Had not Grace from his Lord reached him
column2: he would indeed have been cast off on the naked shore
column3: in disgrace.

column1: 68|50|Thus did his Lord choose him and make him of the Company of the Righteous.
68|51|And the Unbelievers would almost trip thee up with their eyes when they hear the Message; and they say: "Surely he is possessed!"
68|52|But it is nothing less than a Message to all the worlds.
69|1|The Sure Reality!
69|2|What is the Sure Reality?
69|3|And what will make thee realise what the Sure Reality is?
69|4|The Thamud and the ´Ad People (branded) as false the Stunning Calamity!
69|5|But the Thamud
column2: - they were destroyed by a terrible Storm of thunder and lightning!

column1: 69|6|And the ´Ad
column2: they were destroyed by a furious Wind
column3: exceedingly violent;

column1: 69|7|He made it rage against them seven nights and eight days in succession: so that thou couldst see the (whole) people lying prostrate in its (path)
column2: as they had been roots of hollow palm-trees tumbled down!

column1: 69|8|Then seest thou any of them left surviving?
69|9|And Pharaoh
column2: and those before him
column3: and the Cities Overthrown
column4: committed habitual Sin.

column1: 69|10|And disobeyed (each) the messenger of their Lord; so He punished them with an abundant Penalty.

column2: when the water (of Noah´s Flood) overflowed beyond its limits
column3: carried you (mankind)
column4: in the floating (Ark)

column1: 69|12|That We might make it a Message unto you
column2: and that ears (that should hear the tale and) retain its memory should bear its (lessons) in remembrance.

column1: 69|13|Then
column2: when one blast is sounded on the Trumpet

column1: 69|14|And the earth is moved
column2: and its mountains
column3: and they are crushed to powder at one stroke

column1: 69|15|On that Day shall the (Great) Event come to pass.
69|16|And the sky will be rent asunder
column2: for it will that Day be flimsy

column1: 69|17|And the angels will be on its sides
column2: and eight will
column3: that Day
column4: bear the Throne of thy Lord above them.

column1: 69|18|That Day shall ye be brought to Judgment: not an act of yours that ye hide will be hidden.
69|19|Then he that will be given his Record in his right hand will say: "Ah here! Read ye my Record!
69|20|"I did really understand that my Account would (One Day) reach me!"
69|21|And he will be in a life of Bliss
69|22|In a Garden on high
69|23|The Fruits whereof (will hang in bunches) low and near.
69|24|"Eat ye and drink ye
column2: with full satisfaction; because of the (good) that ye sent before you
column3: in the days that are gone!"

column1: 69|25|And he that will be given his Record in his left hand
column2: will say: "Ah! Would that my Record had not been given to me!

column1: 69|26|"And that I had never realised how my account (stood)!
69|27|"Ah! Would that (Death) had made an end of me!
69|28|"Of no profit to me has been my wealth!
69|29|"My power has perished from me!"...
69|30|(The stern command will say): "Seize ye him
column2: and bind ye him

column1: 69|31|"And burn ye him in the Blazing Fire.
69|32|"Further
column2: make him march in a chain
column3: whereof the length is seventy cubits!

column1: 69|33|"This was he that would not believe in Allah Most High.
69|34|"And would not encourage the feeding of the indigent!
69|35|"So no friend hath he here this Day.
69|36|"Nor hath he any food except the corruption from the washing of wounds
69|37|"Which none do eat but those in sin."
69|38|So I do call to witness what ye see
69|39|And what ye see not
69|40|That this is verily the word of an honoured messenger;
69|41|It is not the word of a poet: little it is ye believe!
69|42|Nor is it the word of a soothsayer: little admonition it is ye receive.
69|43|(This is) a Message sent down from the Lord of the Worlds.
69|44|And if the messenger were to invent any sayings in Our name
69|45|We should certainly seize him by his right hand
69|46|And We should certainly then cut off the artery of his heart:
69|47|Nor could any of you withhold him (from Our wrath).
69|48|But verily this is a Message for the Allah-fearing.
69|49|And We certainly know that there are amongst you those that reject (it).
69|50|But truly (Revelation) is a cause of sorrow for the Unbelievers.
69|51|But verily it is Truth of assured certainty.
69|52|So glorify the name of thy Lord Most High.
70|1|A questioner asked about a Penalty to befall-
70|2|The Unbelievers
column2: the which there is none to ward off

column1: 70|3|(A Penalty) from Allah
column2: Lord of the Ways of Ascent.

column1: 70|4|The angels and the spirit ascend unto him in a Day the measure whereof is (as) fifty thousand years:
70|5|Therefore do thou hold Patience
column2: - a Patience of beautiful (contentment).

column1: 70|6|They see the (Day) indeed as a far-off (event):
70|7|But We see it (quite) near.
70|8|The Day that the sky will be like molten brass
70|9|And the mountains will be like wool
70|10|And no friend will ask after a friend
70|11|Though they will be put in sight of each other
column2: #NAME?

column1: 70|12|His wife and his brother
70|13|His kindred who sheltered him
70|14|And all
column2: all that is on earth
column3: - so it could deliver him:

column1: 70|15|By no means! for it would be the Fire of Hell!-
70|16|Plucking out (his being) right to the skull!-
70|17|Inviting (all) such as turn their backs and turn away their faces (from the Right).
70|18|And collect (wealth) and hide it (from use)!
70|19|Truly man was created very impatient;-
70|20|Fretful when evil touches him;
70|21|And niggardly when good reaches him;-
70|22|Not so those devoted to Prayer;-
70|23|Those who remain steadfast to their prayer;
70|24|And those in whose wealth is a recognised right.
70|25|For the (needy) who asks and him who is prevented (for some reason from asking);
70|26|And those who hold to the truth of the Day of Judgment;
70|27|And those who fear the displeasure of their Lord
70|28|For their Lord´s displeasure is the opposite of Peace and Tranquillity;-
70|29|And those who guard their chastity
70|30|Except with their wives and the (captives) whom their right hands possess
column2: #NAME?

column1: 70|31|But those who trespass beyond this are transgressors;-
70|32|And those who respect their trusts and covenants;
70|33|And those who stand firm in their testimonies;
70|34|And those who guard (the sacredness) of their worship;-
70|35|Such will be the honoured ones in the Gardens (of Bliss).
70|36|Now what is the matter with the Unbelievers that they rush madly before thee-
70|37|From the right and from the left
column2: in crowds?

column1: 70|38|Does every man of them long to enter the Garden of Bliss?
70|39|By no means! For We have created them out of the (base matter) they know!
70|40|Now I do call to witness the Lord of all points in the East and the West that We can certainly-
70|41|Substitute for them better (men) than they; And We are not to be defeated (in Our Plan).
70|42|So leave them to plunge in vain talk and play about
column2: until they encounter that Day of theirs which they have been promised!-

column1: 70|43|The Day whereon they will issue from their sepulchres in sudden haste as if they were rushing to a goal-post (fixed for them)
70|44|Their eyes lowered in dejection
column2: - ignominy covering them (all over)! such is the Day the which they are promised!

column1: 71|1|We sent Noah to his People (with the Command): "Do thou warn thy People before there comes to them a grievous Penalty."
71|2|He said: "O my People! I am to you a Warner
column2: clear and open:

column1: 71|3|"That ye should worship Allah
column2: fear Him and obey me:

column1: 71|4|"So He may forgive you your sins and give you respite for a stated Term: for when the Term given by Allah is accomplished
column2: it cannot be put forward: if ye only knew."

column1: 71|5|He said: "O my Lord! I have called to my People night and day:
71|6|"But my call only increases (their) flight (from the Right).
71|7|"And every time I have called to them
column2: that Thou mightest forgive them
column3: they have (only) thrust their fingers into their ears
column4: covered themselves up with their garments
column5: grown obstinate
column6: and given themselves up to arrogance.

column1: 71|8|"So I have called to them aloud;
71|9|"Further I have spoken to them in public and secretly in private
71|10|"Saying
column2: ´Ask forgiveness from your Lord; for He is Oft-Forgiving;

column1: 71|11|"´He will send rain to you in abundance;
71|12|"´Give you increase in wealth and sons; and bestow on you gardens and bestow on you rivers (of flowing water).
71|13|"´What is the matter with you
column2: that ye place not your hope for kindness and long-suffering in Allah

column1: 71|14|"´Seeing that it is He that has created you in diverse stages?
71|15|"´See ye not how Allah has created the seven heavens one above another
71|16|"´And made the moon a light in their midst
column2: and made the sun as a (Glorious) Lamp?

column1: 71|17|"´And Allah has produced you from the earth growing (gradually)
71|18|"´And in the End He will return you into the (earth)
column2: and raise you forth (again at the Resurrection)?

column1: 71|19|"´And Allah has made the earth for you as a carpet (spread out)
71|20|"´That ye may go about therein
column2: in spacious roads.´"

column1: 71|21|Noah said: "O my Lord! They have disobeyed me
column2: but they follow (men) whose wealth and children give them no increase but only Loss.

column1: 71|22|"And they have devised a tremendous Plot.
71|23|"And they have said (to each other)
column2: ´Abandon not your gods: Abandon neither Wadd nor Suwa´
column3: neither Yaguth nor Ya´uq
column4: nor Nasr´;-

column1: 71|24|"They have already misled many; and grant Thou no increase to the wrong-doers but in straying (from their mark)."
71|25|Because of their sins they were drowned (in the flood)
column2: and were made to enter the Fire (of Punishment): and they found- in lieu of Allah- none to help them.

column1: 71|26|And Noah
column2: said: "O my Lord! Leave not of the Unbelievers
column3: a single one on earth!

column2: if Thou dost leave (any of) them
column3: they will but mislead Thy devotees
column4: and they will breed none but wicked ungrateful ones.

column1: 71|28|"O my Lord! Forgive me
column2: my parents
column3: all who enter my house in Faith
column4: and (all) believing men and believing women: and to the wrong-doers grant Thou no increase but in perdition!"

column1: 72|1|Say: It has been revealed to me that a company of Jinns listened (to the Qur´an). They said
column2: ´We have really heard a wonderful Recital!

column1: 72|2|´It gives guidance to the Right
column2: and we have believed therein: we shall not join (in worship) any (gods) with our Lord.

column1: 72|3|´And Exalted is the Majesty of our Lord: He has taken neither a wife nor a son.
72|4|´There were some foolish ones among us
column2: who used to utter extravagant lies against Allah;

column1: 72|5|´But we do think that no man or spirit should say aught that untrue against Allah.
72|6|´True
column2: there were persons among mankind who took shelter with persons among the Jinns
column3: but they increased them in folly.

column1: 72|7|´And they (came to) think as ye thought
column2: that Allah would not raise up any one (to Judgment).

column1: 72|8|´And we pried into the secrets of heaven; but we found it filled with stern guards and flaming fires.
72|9|´We used
column2: indeed
column3: to sit there in (hidden) stations
column4: to (steal) a hearing; but any who listen now will find a flaming fire watching him in ambush.

column1: 72|10|´And we understand not whether ill is intended to those on earth
column2: or whether their Lord (really) intends to guide them to right conduct.

column1: 72|11|´There are among us some that are righteous
column2: and some the contrary: we follow divergent paths.

column1: 72|12|´But we think that we can by no means frustrate Allah throughout the earth
column2: nor can we frustrate Him by flight.

column1: 72|13|´And as for us
column2: since we have listened to the Guidance
column3: we have accepted it: and any who believes in his Lord has no fear
column4: either of a short (account) or of any injustice.

column1: 72|14|´Amongst us are some that submit their wills (to Allah)
column2: and some that swerve from justice. Now those who submit their wills - they have sought out (the path) of right conduct:

column1: 72|15|´But those who swerve
column2: - they are (but) fuel for Hell-fire´-

column1: 72|16|(And Allah´s Message is): "If they (the Pagans) had (only) remained on the (right) Way
column2: We should certainly have bestowed on them Rain in abundance.

column1: 72|17|"That We might try them by that (means). But if any turns away from the remembrance of his Lord
column2: He will cause him to undergo a severe Penalty.

column1: 72|18|"And the places of worship are for Allah (alone): So invoke not any one along with Allah;
72|19|"Yet when the Devotee of Allah stands forth to invoke Him
column2: they just make round him a dense crowd."

column1: 72|20|Say: "I do no more than invoke my Lord
column2: and I join not with Him any (false god)."

column1: 72|21|Say: "It is not in my power to cause you harm
column2: or to bring you to right conduct."

column1: 72|22|Say: "No one can deliver me from Allah (If I were to disobey Him)
column2: nor should I find refuge except in Him

column1: 72|23|"Unless I proclaim what I receive from Allah and His Messages: for any that disobey Allah and His Messenger
column2: - for them is Hell: they shall dwell therein for ever."

column1: 72|24|At length
column2: when they see (with their own eyes) that which they are promised
column3: #NAME?

column1: 72|25|Say: "I know not whether the (Punishment) which ye are promised is near
column2: or whether my Lord will appoint for it a distant term.

column1: 72|26|"He (alone) knows the Unseen

column1: 72|27|"Except a messenger whom He has chosen: and then He makes a band of watchers march before him and behind him
72|28|"That He may know that they have (truly) brought and delivered the Messages of their Lord: and He surrounds (all the mysteries) that are with them

column1: 73|1|O thou folded in garments!

column1: 73|3|Half of it

column2: measured rhythmic tones.

column2: and most suitable for (framing) the Word (of Prayer and Praise).

column1: 73|7|True

column1: 73|8|But keep in remembrance the name of thy Lord and devote thyself to Him whole-heartedly.

column1: 73|13|And a Food that chokes

column3: to be a witness concerning you

column5: therefore
column6: of the Qur´an as much as may be easy for you. He knoweth that there may be (some) among you in ill-health; others travelling through the land
column7: seeking of Allah´s bounty; yet others fighting in Allah´s Cause
column8: read ye
column10: as much of the Qur´an as may be easy (for you); and establish regular Prayer and give regular Charity; and loan to Allah a Beautiful Loan. And whatever good ye send forth for your souls ye shall find it in Allah´s Presence
column13: in Reward and seek ye the Grace of Allah: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving

We feed you for the sake of Allah alone: no reward do we desire from you, nor thanks.

95|1|By the Fig and the Olive
95|2|And the Mount of Sinai
95|3|And this City of security
95|4|We have indeed created man in the best of moulds
95|5|Then do We abase him (to be) the lowest of the low
95|6|Except such as believe and do righteous deeds: For they shall have a reward unfailing.
95|7|Then what can
column2: after this
column3: contradict thee
column4: as to the judgment (to come)?

column1: 95|8|Is not Allah the wisest of judges?
96|1|Proclaim! (or read!) in the name of thy Lord and Cherisher
column2: Who created-

column1: 96|2|Created man
column2: out of a (mere) clot of congealed blood:

column1: 96|3|Proclaim! And thy Lord is Most Bountiful
96|4|He Who taught (the use of) the pen
96|5|Taught man that which he knew not.

column2: but man doth transgress all bounds

column1: 96|7|In that he looketh upon himself as self-sufficient.
96|8|Verily
column2: to thy Lord is the return (of all).

column1: 96|9|Seest thou one who forbids-
96|10|A votary when he (turns) to pray?
96|11|Seest thou if he is on (the road of) Guidance?-
96|12|Or enjoins Righteousness?
96|13|Seest thou if he denies (Truth) and turns away?
96|14|Knoweth he not that Allah doth see?
96|15|Let him beware! If he desist not
column2: We will drag him by the forelock

column1: 96|16|A lying
column2: sinful forelock!

column1: 96|17|Then
column2: let him call (for help) to his council (of comrades):

column1: 96|18|We will call on the angels of punishment (to deal with him)!

column2: heed him not: But bow down in adoration
column3: and bring thyself the closer (to Allah)!

column1: 97|1|We have indeed revealed this (Message) in the Night of Power:
97|2|And what will explain to thee what the night of power is?
97|3|The Night of Power is better than a thousand months.
97|4|Therein come down the angels and the Spirit by Allah´s permission
column2: on every errand:

column1: 97|5|Peace!...This until the rise of morn!
98|1|Those who reject (Truth)
column2: among the People of the Book and among the Polytheists
column3: were not going to depart (from their ways) until there should come to them Clear Evidence

column1: 98|2|An messenger from Allah
column2: rehearsing scriptures kept pure and holy:

column1: 98|3|Wherein are laws (or decrees) right and straight.
98|4|Nor did the People of the Book make schisms
column2: until after there came to them Clear Evidence.

column1: 98|5|And they have been commanded no more than this: To worship Allah
column2: offering Him sincere devotion
column3: being true (in faith); to establish regular prayer; and to practise regular charity; and that is the Religion Right and Straight.

column1: 98|6|Those who reject (Truth)
column2: among the People of the Book and among the Polytheists
column3: will be in Hell-Fire
column4: to dwell therein (for aye). They are the worst of creatures.

column1: 98|7|Those who have faith and do righteous deeds
column2: #NAME?

column1: 98|8|Their reward is with Allah: Gardens of Eternity
column2: beneath which rivers flow; they will dwell therein for ever; Allah well pleased with them
column3: and they with Him: all this for such as fear their Lord and Cherisher.

column1: 99|1|When the earth is shaken to her (utmost) convulsion
99|2|And the earth throws up her burdens (from within)
99|3|And man cries (distressed): ´What is the matter with her?´-
99|4|On that Day will she declare her tidings:
99|5|For that thy Lord will have given her inspiration.
99|6|On that Day will men proceed in companies sorted out
column2: to be shown the deeds that they (had done).

column1: 99|7|Then shall anyone who has done an atom´s weight of good
column2: see it!

column1: 99|8|And anyone who has done an atom´s weight of evil
column2: shall see it.

column1: 100|1|By the (Steeds) that run
column2: with panting (breath)

column1: 100|2|And strike sparks of fire
100|3|And push home the charge in the morning
100|4|And raise the dust in clouds the while
100|5|And penetrate forthwith into the midst (of the foe) en masse;-
100|6|Truly man is
column2: to his Lord
column3: ungrateful;

column1: 100|7|And to that (fact) he bears witness (by his deeds);
100|8|And violent is he in his love of wealth.
100|9|Does he not know
column2: #NAME?

column1: 100|10|And that which is (locked up) in (human) breasts is made manifest-
100|11|That their Lord had been Well-acquainted with them
column2: (even to) that Day?

column1: 101|1|The (Day) of Noise and Clamour:
101|2|What is the (Day) of Noise and Clamour?
101|3|And what will explain to thee what the (Day) of Noise and Clamour is?
101|4|(It is) a Day whereon men will be like moths scattered about
101|5|And the mountains will be like carded wool.
101|6|Then
column2: he whose balance (of good deeds) will be (found) heavy

column1: 101|7|Will be in a life of good pleasure and satisfaction.
101|8|But he whose balance (of good deeds) will be (found) light
101|9|Will have his home in a (bottomless) Pit.
101|10|And what will explain to thee what this is?
101|11|(It is) a Fire Blazing fiercely!
102|1|The mutual rivalry for piling up (the good things of this world) diverts you (from the more serious things)
102|2|Until ye visit the graves.
102|3|But nay
column2: ye soon shall know (the reality).

column1: 102|4|Again
column2: ye soon shall know!
were ye to know with certainty of mind
column3: (ye would beware!)

column1: 102|6|Ye shall certainly see Hell-Fire!
102|7|Again
column2: ye shall see it with certainty of sight!

column1: 102|8|Then
column2: shall ye be questioned that Day about the joy (ye indulged in!).

column1: 103|1|By (the Token of) Time (through the ages)
103|2|Verily Man is in loss
103|3|Except such as have Faith
column2: and do righteous deeds
column3: and (join together) in the mutual teaching of Truth
column4: and of Patience and Constancy.

column1: 104|1|Woe to every (kind of) scandal-monger and-backbiter
104|2|Who pileth up wealth and layeth it by
104|3|Thinking that his wealth would make him last for ever!
104|4|By no means! He will be sure to be thrown into That which Breaks to Pieces
104|5|And what will explain to thee That which Breaks to Pieces?
104|6|(It is) the Fire of (the Wrath of) Allah kindled (to a blaze)
104|7|The which doth mount (Right) to the Hearts:
104|8|It shall be made into a vault over them
104|9|In columns outstretched.
105|1|Seest thou not how thy Lord dealt with the Companions of the Elephant?
105|2|Did He not make their treacherous plan go astray?
105|3|And He sent against them Flights of Birds
105|4|Striking them with stones of baked clay.
105|5|Then did He make them like an empty field of stalks and straw
column2: (of which the corn) has been eaten up.

column1: 106|1|For the covenants (of security and safeguard enjoyed) by the Quraish
106|2|Their covenants (covering) journeys by winter and summer
106|3|Let them adore the Lord of this House
106|4|Who provides them with food against hunger
column2: and with security against fear (of danger).

column1: 107|1|Seest thou one who denies the Judgment (to come)?
107|2|Then such is the (man) who repulses the orphan (with harshness)
107|3|And encourages not the feeding of the indigent.
107|4|So woe to the worshippers
107|5|Who are neglectful of their prayers
107|6|Those who (want but) to be seen (of men)
107|7|But refuse (to supply) (even) neighbourly needs.
108|1|To thee have We granted the Fount (of Abundance).
108|2|Therefore to thy Lord turn in Prayer and Sacrifice.
108|3|For he who hateth thee
column2: he will be cut off (from Future Hope).

column1: 109|1|Say : O ye that reject Faith!
109|2|I worship not that which ye worship
109|3|Nor will ye worship that which I worship.
109|4|And I will not worship that which ye have been wont to worship
109|5|Nor will ye worship that which I worship.
109|6|To you be your Way
column2: and to me mine.

column1: 110|1|When comes the Help of Allah
column2: and Victory

column1: 110|2|And thou dost see the people enter Allah´s Religion in crowds
110|3|Celebrate the praises of thy Lord
column2: and pray for His Forgiveness: For He is Oft-Returning (in Grace and Mercy).

column1: 111|1|Perish the hands of the Father of Flame! Perish he!
111|2|No profit to him from all his wealth
column2: and all his gains!

column1: 111|3|Burnt soon will he be in a Fire of Blazing Flame!
111|4|His wife shall carry the (crackling) wood - As fuel!-
111|5|A twisted rope of palm-leaf fibre round her (own) neck!
112|1|Say: He is Allah
column2: the One and Only;

column1: 112|2|Allah
column2: the Eternal
column3: Absolute;

column1: 112|3|He begetteth not
column2: nor is He begotten;

column1: 112|4|And there is none like unto Him.
113|1|Say: I seek refuge with the Lord of the Dawn
113|2|From the mischief of created things;
113|3|From the mischief of Darkness as it overspreads;
113|4|From the mischief of those who practise secret arts;
113|5|And from the mischief of the envious one as he practises envy.
114|1|Say: I seek refuge with the Lord and Cherisher of Mankind
114|2|The King (or Ruler) of Mankind
114|3|The god (or judge) of Mankind
114|4|From the mischief of the Whisperer (of Evil)
column2: who withdraws (after his whisper)

column1: 114|5|(The same) who whispers into the hearts of Mankind
114|6|Among Jinns and among men.
